It was obviously effective, Leonard grew up to be an experimental physicist. Perhaps if she‰Ûªd also denied him Christmas he‰Ûªd be a little better at it.
Thank you.
Well I love birthdays, waking up to Mom‰Ûªs special French Toast breakfast, wearing the birthday king crown, playing laser tag with all my friends.
Yeah, see, that‰Ûªs what kids should have.
Actually that was last year.
So you‰Ûªve really never had a birthday party?

No. But it was okay. I mean, when I was little I‰Ûªd think maybe my parents would change their mind, and surprise me with a party, like this one birthday I came home from my Cello lesson, and I saw a lot of strange cars parked out front, and when I got to the door I could hear people whispering, and I could smell German chocolate cake, which is my favourite.
And?
Uh, it turns out my grandfather had died. åÊ
Oh my God, that‰Ûªs terrible.
Oh, it was kind of like a birthday party. I got to see all my cousins and there was cake, so‰Û_7
That‰Ûªs the saddest thing I‰Ûªve ever heard.
You think? Go ahead, tell her about your senior prom.
Leonard is exiting the apartment.
Make sure they remember no peanuts.
Howard, every Thai restaurant in town knows you can‰Ûªt eat peanuts. They see me coming they go ‰ÛÏah, no peanut boy!‰Û
Hello Penny. Leonard just left.
I know. I want to talk to you.
What would we talk about? We‰Ûªve no overlapping areas of interest I‰Ûªm aware of, and you know I don‰Ûªt care for chit-chat.
Okay, can you just let me in.
Well alright, but I don‰Ûªt see this as a promising endeavour.
Okay, here‰Ûªs the deal, we are going to throw Leonard a kick-ass surprise party for his birthday on Saturday.
I hardly think so, Leonard made it very clear he doesn‰Ûªt want a party.
Did someone say party?
He just doesn‰Ûªt know he wants one because he‰Ûªs never had one.
I suppose that‰Ûªs possible, but for the record, I‰Ûªve never had a threesome and yet I still know I want one.
Howard, here‰Ûªs the difference. The possibility exists that Leonard could have a birthday party before hell freezes over.
Fine. If I do have a threesome, you can‰Ûªt be part of it. I‰Ûªm just kidding, yes you can. Can you bring a friend?
I think a birthday party is a terrible idea. I envy Leonard for growing up without that anguish.
Anguish?

Year after year, I had to endure wearing conical hats while being forced into the crowded sweaty hell of bouncy castles, not to mention being blindfolded and spun towards a grotesque tailless donkey as the other children mocked my disorientation.
Okay, sweetie, I understand you have scars that no non-professional can heal, but nevertheless we are going to throw Leonard a birthday party.
Have I pointed out that I am extremely uncomfortable with dancing, loud music and most other forms of alcohol induced frivolity.
Nevertheless we are‰Û_.
In addition I really don‰Ûªt think that Leonard wants a‰Û_

Okay, here‰Ûªs the deal, you either help me throw Leonard a birthday party or, so help me God, I will go into your bedroom and I will unbag all of your most valuable mint condition comic books. And on one of them, you won‰Ûªt know which, I‰Ûªll draw a tiny happy face in ink.
You can‰Ûªt do that, if you make a mark on a mint comic book it‰Ûªs no longer mint.
Sheldon, do you understand the concept of blackmail?
Well of course I‰Û_ oh! Yeah, I have an idea, let‰Ûªs throw Leonard a kick ass birthday party.
Howard and Raj sneak up the stairwell carrying presents. Howard knocks on Penny‰Ûªs door, a combination of two knocks, two knocks, one knock. Nothing happens. He tries again. Sheldon opens the door.
That‰Ûªs not the secret knock. This is the secret knock. (He knocks two, one, two.)
What difference does it make?
The whole point of a secret knock is to establish a non-verbal signal to verify the identity of one‰Ûªs co-conspirators.
Is that Raj and Howard?
Can you just let us in.
Luckily for you this is not a nuclear reactor.
So, what did you get the birthday boy?
Well, Raj got him an awesome limited edition Dark Knight sculpture based on Alex Ross‰Ûªs definitive Batman, and I got him this amazing autographed copy of the Feynman lectures on physics.
Nice. I got him a sweater.
Okay, well, he might like that, I‰Ûªve seen him‰Û_ chilly.
Uh, Sheldon, I didn‰Ûªt see your present.
That‰Ûªs because I didn‰Ûªt bring one.
Well why not?
Don‰Ûªt ask.
The entire institution of gift giving makes no sense.
Too late.

Let‰Ûªs say that I go out and I spend fifty dollars on you, it‰Ûªs a laborious activity, because I have to imagine what you need, whereas you know what you need. Now I can simplify things, just give you the fifty dollars directly and, you could give me fifty dollars on my birthday, and so on until one of us dies leaving the other one old and fifty dollars richer. And I ask you, is it worth it?
Told you not to ask.
Well, Sheldon, you‰Ûªre his friend. Friends give each other presents.
I accept your premise, I reject your conclusion.
Try telling him it‰Ûªs a non-optional social convention.
What?
Just do it.
It‰Ûªs a non-optional social convention.
Oh. Fair enough.
He came with a manual.

Question, how am I going to get Leonard a present before the party? I don‰Ûªt drive, and the only things available within walking distance are a Thai restaurant and a gas station. I suppose I could wrap up an order of mee krob and a couple of lottery scratchers.
Okay, let‰Ûªs do this, um, I will drive Sheldon to get a present, and Howard, you need to get rid of Leonard for about two hours.
No problem.
And then Raj, you bring the stuff across the hall and start setting up.

character: Howard (after Raj whispers in his ear)
line: What if guests show up?
Entertain them.
What if they‰Ûªre women?
Stare at them and make them feel uncomfortable.
The apartment. Leonard is playing an X-Box game.
Hey!
Hey.
How‰Ûªs it going?
Fine.
So, listen, the New Art is showing the revised definitive cut of Blade Runner.
Seen it.
No, you‰Ûªve seen the 25th anniversary final cut. This one has eight seconds of previously unseen footage. They say it completely changes the tone of the film.
Oh. Pass.
Come on, afterwards there‰Ûªs a Q & A with Harrison Ford‰Ûªs body double.
Look, I am in the Halo battle of my life here, there‰Ûªs this kid in Copenhagen, he has no immune system so all he does is sit in his bubble and play Halo 24/7.
Can‰Ûªt you play him some other time?
Not if you believe his doctors.
Oh my God, do you smell gas.
No.
Yeah, no.
An electrical store.
Alright, you know they have DVDs over there.
Yes, but they have DVD burners over here. Leonard needs a DVD burner.
Sheldon, a gift shouldn‰Ûªt be something someone needs, it should be something fun, you know, something they wouldn‰Ûªt buy for themselves.
You mean, like a sweater?
Well, it‰Ûªs a fun sweater, it‰Ûªs got a bold geometric print.
Is it the geometry that makes it fun.
Okay, the point is, one of the ways we show we care about people is by putting thought and imagination into the gifts we give them.
Okay, I see, so not a DVD burner.
Exactly.
Something he wouldn‰Ûªt buy for himself. Something fun. Something like‰Û_ oh, an 802.11n wireless router.
The apartment.

Here you go, Copenhagen boy, how about a taste of Hans Christian Hand Grenade. (Raj enters carrying party supplies. Howard waves him away while in the background Leonard is heard saying ‰ÛÏoh, that did not feel good.‰Û) Come on, come on, oh you clever little‰Û_. Come on, come on, take that!

character: Howard (picks up a granola bar from the table, breaks off half and puts it in his back pocket.)
line: Oh-oh. (Louder) Oh-oh!
What‰Ûªs the matter?
This granola bar, there‰Ûªs peanuts in it.
Oh my God, why did you eat it?
I don‰Ûªt know, it was just there.
Well if I had a gun there, would you have shot yourself?
Don‰Ûªt yell at me, I‰Ûªve got to go to the emergency room.
Now?
No, after my tongue has swollen to the size of a brisket.
Alright, um, just, uh, let me get my keys.

Oh God, oh God, oh God, oh‰Û_. (into phone after Leonard leaves room) The laundry is out of the hamper. (Looks exasperated) Okay Sheldon, what was it supposed to be? Fine, it‰Ûªs out of the washer. I‰Ûªll call you when it‰Ûªs in the dryer.
Alright, let‰Ûªs go. (They exit, with Howard making croaking noises.)
The store. Sheldon is looking at two routers.
What do you think.
Um, that one.
Because of the two additional Ethernet ports.
Sure.
He doesn‰Ûªt need them, he‰Ûªs already got a 640 connect switch
Oh, okay then this one.
Why?
I don‰Ûªt know, the man on the box looks so happy.
Penny! If I‰Ûªm going to buy Leonard a gift, I‰Ûªm going to do it right. I refuse to let him experience the same childhood trauma I did.
Oh, I know I‰Ûªm going to regret this but, what trauma?
On my twelfth birthday I really wanted a titanium centrifuge, so, you know, I could separate radioactive isotopes.
Of course.
Instead of a titanium centrifuge, my parents bought me‰Û_ wow, this is hard. They got me‰Û_ a motorised dirt bike.
No?
What twelve year old boy wants a motorised dirt bike?
All of them.
Really?
Yeah.
Huh?
Okay, so we‰Ûªre getting this one?
Yeah, I suppose.
Okay, let‰Ûªs go.
Excuse me, do you know anything about this stuff?
I know everything about this stuff.
Okay, I have my own wholesale flower business, and I want to hook up my computer in the front entrance with the one in my refrigerated warehouse.
Here, buy this one. Look, it‰Ûªs the one we‰Ûªre getting, see, happy guy available.
No, no, no, no, she doesn‰Ûªt want that, she needs a point to point peer network with a range extender.
Thank you.
Which hard drive do I want, firewire or USB?
It depends on what Bus you have.
I drive a Chevy Cavalier.
Oh, dear lord.
Sheldon, we have to go.
Not now, Penny, this poor man needs me. (To woman approaching) You hold on, I‰Ûªll be right with you. What computer do you have, and please don‰Ûªt say a white one?
The hospital. Howard runs in and up to the counter.
Excuse me.
Fill this out, have a seat.
No, listen, see we‰Ûªre throwing my friend a surprise party and I‰Ûªm supposed to keep him out of his apartment for two hours.
Uh-huh, fill this out and have a seat.
No, see, the only way I could get him to leave is to tell him I ate a peanut. Because I‰Ûªm allergic to peanuts.
Oh, well in that case fill this out and have a seat.

Look, all I need from you is to take me in the back and give me a band-aid so I can pretend I had a shot of epinephrine and they you tell my friend you need to keep me under observation for about an hour, hour and a half.
Is that all you need?
Yes.
Get out of my ER.
No, you don‰Ûªt understand.
Oh, I understand, but unfortunately this hospital is not equipped to treat stupid.
Okay, I get it, I know how the world works, how about if I were to introduce you (holding up a five dollar bill) to the man who freed your people.
Hey, sorry I couldn‰Ûªt find a parking spot, how are you doing.
Bad, very bad.
Really, ‰Û÷cos you don‰Ûªt look like you‰Ûªre swelling up at all, maybe we should just pick up some benedryl at the drug store and go home.
We can‰Ûªt go home.
Why not?
Becauth (pretends tongue has swollen up) Becauth-th-th. Brissket, Brissket! Water, need water.
Alright, I‰Ûªll be right back.
Penny, look, I‰Ûªve got a problem.

character: Penny (with Sheldon in background at the head of a large queue of customers)
line: Yeah, well so do I, look you‰Ûªve got to stall Leonard a little longer.
I don‰Ûªt think I can.
You have to, we all have to be there at the same time to yell ‰ÛÏsurprise!‰Û
Okay, you have to understand something, we‰Ûªre in a hospital right now.
Why, is Leonard okay.
Leonard‰Ûªs fine. I‰Ûªm fine, thanks for asking, by the way.
Okay, I don‰Ûªt need your attitude, just hold him there a little longer.
Look, I‰Ûªve done my best but he wants to go home and I don‰Ûªt know how to stop him.
Okay, how about this. You keep him there a little longer and when you get to the party I‰Ûªll point out which of my friends are easy.
Don‰Ûªt toy with me, woman.

I‰Ûªve got a hot former fat girl with no self-esteem, I‰Ûªve got a girl who punishes her father by sleeping around and an alcoholic who‰Ûªs two tequila shots away from letting you wear her like a hat.
Thy will be done. (Thinks. Reaches into back pocket, finds the half a granola bar from earlier. Looks down.) I‰Ûªm doing this for you, little buddy. (Takes a bite.)
The store. Sheldon is on the in-store computer.
Okay, we don‰Ûªt have that in stock, but I can special order it for you.

character: Penny (with shop assistant, points at Sheldon)
line: Him.
Excuse me, sir, you don‰Ûªt work here.
Yes, well, apparently neither does anyone else.
Sheldon, we have to go.
Why?
Well, for one thing, we‰Ûªre late for Leonard‰Ûªs birthday party. And for another, I told him to call security.
Good luck. (To assistant) By the way, a six year-old could hack your computer system.
Keep walking.
Yeah, 1-2-3-4 is not a secure password.
The hospital.
Excuse me, my friend is having an allergic reaction to peanuts.
No he‰Ûªs not.
Yes he is.
Look, sir we are very busy here and I just don‰Ûªt‰Û_ (sees Leonard whose face has swollen all over) holy crap!
Pees hep me!
Code 4, I need a gurney, right away, right away.
Fank-u.
The stairwell.
Say what you will about the healthcare system in this country, but when they‰Ûªre afraid of lawsuits they sure test everything.
I really don‰Ûªt think the colonoscopy was necessary.
You know, before you got all swollen up, I actually thought you were trying to keep me out of the apartment so you could throw me a surprise party.
Oh, right, it‰Ûªs your birthday, I had no idea it was your birthday, I completely forgot, wow, what a lousy way to spend a birthday, well it‰Ûªs all over now.
There is a party, isn‰Ûªt there.
Maybe.
Howard.
Are you mad?
how could I be mad? You actually risked your life because you cared about me.
Yeah, that‰Ûªs why I did it.
Alright. Here we go. My first birthday party.
Dude! Everybody left an hour ago! Surprise!

Okay Leonard, here I am at your birthday party, I don‰Ûªt know where you are dude, but it‰Ûªs really kick-ass. Everyone is very very drunk, and uh‰Û_ (girl pours booze into his mouth) Oh look, there‰Ûªs a girl taking her shirt off.
That‰Ûªs my friend Carol. Remind me, I‰Ûªve got to introduce her to Howard.
Oh sweet Krishna, shake it, that-a rupee maker.
I‰Ûªm so sorry you didn‰Ûªt get your party.
Oh, it‰Ûªs okay.
Happy birthday anyways. (She kisses him full on the lips.)
Hey Penny, when, uh, when‰Ûªs your birthday?
The apartment living room
Wo de zhing shi Sheldon.
No, it‰Ûªs Wo de ming zi shi Sheldon. (Makes a hand movement with every syllable.)
Wo de ming zi shi Sheldon. (Copies hand movements.)
What‰Ûªs this? (Repeats hand movements.)
That‰Ûªs what you did. I assumed as in a number of languages that the gesture was part of the phrase.
Well it‰Ûªs not.
How am I supposed to know that? As the teacher it‰Ûªs your obligation to separate your personal idiosyncrasies from the subject matter.
You know, I‰Ûªm really glad you decided to learn Mandarin.
Why?
Once you‰Ûªre fluent you‰Ûªll have a billion more people to annoy instead of me.
Hey!
Mai du lui tsa.
You just called Leonard a syphilitic donkey.
My apologies Leonard, I‰Ûªm only as good as my teacher.
Why are you learning Chinese?
I believe the Szechuan Palace has been passing off orange chicken as tangerine chicken and I intend to confront them.
If I were you, I‰Ûªd be more concerned by what they‰Ûªre passing off as chicken.
I need to use your window.
Oh, yeah, no, sure, go ahead.
Hey Jerkface, you forgot your iPod! (Throws it out.)
What‰Ûªs going on?

Oh, I‰Ûªll tell you what‰Ûªs going on, that stupid self-centred bastard wrote about our sex life in his blog. (Out of window) Drop dead, you stupid self-centred bastard! (To Leonard) Thank you. (exit)
Okay, where were we?
Not now, I have a blog to find.
Leonard approaches Penny‰Ûªs door and knocks.
Penny, are you okay?
I‰Ûªm fine, Leonard, just go away.
Look, I understand that breaking up with someone can be very painful‰Û_.
GO AWAY!
Okay, feel better, bye. (Goes back to apartment) She doesn‰Ûªt want to talk.

Not surprising. Penny‰Ûªs emotional responses originate from the primitive portion of the brain known as the Amygdala, while speech is centred in the much more recently developed Neocortex. The former can easily overpower the latter giving scientific credence to the notion of being rendered speechless. (Leonard stares at him.) Or maybe she just doesn‰Ûªt want to talk.
Hey, look, I found an iPod.
It‰Ûªs smashed beyond repair, what are you going to do with it?
What else? Sell it on ebay as slightly used.
It was Penny‰Ûªs boyfriend‰Ûªs, they broke up.
Apparently he posted intimate details of their physical relationship on his blog, which I cannot find anywhere.
You know what, I‰Ûªm going to go back and try talking to her again.
Good idea. Sit with her, hold her, comfort her, and if the moment feels right, see if you can cop a feel.
I‰Ûªm not going to do that, Howard.
I‰Ûªm not aware of any social convention that requires you to intervene at all.
What about ‰ÛÏdamsel in distress?‰Û
Twelfth century code of chivalry, not exactly current. You‰Ûªd also have to be knighted for that to apply.
I don‰Ûªt care. She‰Ûªs upset, I‰Ûªm going over there.
Remember to sit on your hands a bit so they‰Ûªre warm.
I‰Ûªm her friend, I‰Ûªm not going to take advantage of her vulnerability.
What, so you‰Ûªre saying that if in the depths of despair she throws herself at you and demands you take her, right there, right now, you‰Ûªll just walk away?
I said I‰Ûªm her friend. Not her gay friend.
Penny‰Ûªs flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
Hey, listen, I know you said that you didn‰Ûªt want to talk‰Û_
I don‰Ûªt.
Sorry.
Wait.
Wait, did you say wait?
Tell me the truth. Am I just an idiot who picks giant losers?
No. No.
Okay, so I pick good guys, but turn them into losers.
Of course not.
Well, it‰Ûªs got to be one or the other, which is it?
I‰Ûªm sorry, what were the choices again?
I really thought Mike was different, I thought he was sensitive and smart. I mean, not you smart, normal non-freaky smart.
Yeah, no, sure.
You know, and then he just goes and has to humiliate me by writing about me on his blog so the entire world can read it.
Actually it‰Ûªs not all that easy to find.
Yeah, really, well my friends at work found it, my sister found it, judging by my email a number of prisoners at the Michigan State Penitentiary found it.
Okay, well, what exactly did this guy write, not that I need to know the details of your sex life, I just thought‰Û_. never mind.
Nope, you know what, you might as well read it, everybody else has, go ahead. Oh God, I just feel so betrayed and embarrassed. I just want to crawl into a hole and die.
Okay, well, you know, this isn‰Ûªt that bad. It just paints the picture of a very affectionate woman who‰Ûªs open to expressing her affection in non traditional locales.
Oh God!
Elevators, parks, movie theatres, out of curiosity, is this subway the transportation system or subway the sandwich shop?
Sandwich shop.
Doesn‰Ûªt that violate the health code?
No, at the sub shop we were only making out.
Huh. Okay. But my point is that you have absolutely no reason to be embarrassed.
Really, do you think I overreacted?
Maybe a little.
‰Û÷Cause I do that, I do overreact. Maybe I should call Mike and apologise.
No. No, no, that, that would be underreacting. He did break the implied confidentiality of the bedroom and, in your case, the elevator, parks and fast food franchise.
Yes. You‰Ûªre right. I should just say I‰Ûªm done with him.
Yes, you should, go ahead, say it.
But I never gave the man a chance to explain.
What is there to explain, it‰Ûªs all right here, it‰Ûªs a betrayal.
No, you were right the first time, this is a man who loves me, but in his own stupid way he was just trying to show people how he feels.
I‰Ûªm pretty sure I never said that.
No, you did better than that, you helped me see it on my own.
Aw, good for me. Where are you going?
I‰Ûªm going over to Mike‰Ûªs. Leonard, thank you so much.
Oh, sure. Huh, maybe I am her gay friend.
The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food.
Howard, I‰Ûªm going to need another Mandarin lesson. I obviously didn‰Ûªt make my point with those people.
For God‰Ûªs sake, Sheldon, if you don‰Ûªt like the tangerine chicken, don‰Ûªt order the tangerine chicken.
I like tangerine chicken, I‰Ûªm not getting tangerine chicken.
Can we please change the subject.
Sure. Tell us again how you screwed up and got Penny back together with her old boyfriend.
Just roll the dice.
Enslaved by warlocks, stay here till you roll 2, 4 or 6‰Û_7
She was mad at him. She was done with him, the relationship was broken beyond repair and I walked over there and I fixed it!
Boy, that story gets better every time you hear it.
Actually, I thought the first two renditions were far more compelling. Previously I felt sympathy for the Leonard character, now I just find him to be whiny and annoying.
Just eat your tangerine chicken.
I‰Ûªd love to, but I don‰Ûªt have tangerine chicken.
Thank you so much for your stupid advice. (Slams door again.)
Incredible. You managed to screw up the screw-up.
Penny‰Ûªs apartment.
I‰Ûªm back.
I‰Ûªm sorry I yelled at you. It‰Ûªs not your fault.
What happened?
Well, I went over to Mike‰Ûªs to make up with him.
Yeah, I know, I know that part.
But he had already moved on.
Already, that was quick.
That‰Ûªs what I said to the woman who had her legs wrapped around his neck.
Oh, Penny, I am so sorry.
How could he do that.
Oh, well, you know, you did throw an 8 gig iPod‰Û_ yeah, no, how could he do that.
I swear to God, I am done with guys like that. You know, macho, with the perfect body and the hair, and the money.
Yeah, that must get old quick.
You know, just once, I would like to go out with someone who is nice, and honest, and who actually cares about me.
What about me?
What about you what?
What about if you went out with me?
Are you asking me out?
Um‰Û_ yes‰Û_ I am‰Û_ asking you out.
Wow.
I was just going off your comment about the nice guy‰Û_
No, I know, I got that. Yeah, totally.
‰Û_thing and honest but, it‰Ûªs no big deal‰Û_
Yes.
Yes what?
Yes, I will go out with you.
Really?
Yeah. Why not, I mean, what do I have to lose?
Yeah. That‰Ûªs the spirit.
The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
Show me your citrus peels. Gei wo kan, ni jud di zi pei. Show me your citrus peels. Gei wo kan, ni jud di zi pei. Show me your‰Û_
Sheldon.
Aieee ya! Xia si wo le.
I‰Ûªm sorry. Look, do you have a second.
A second what? Pair of underwear?
I was just wondering if I could talk to you? It‰Ûªs about Leonard.
Why me? Why not Koothrappali or Wolowitz?
Well, Raj can‰Ûªt talk to me unless he‰Ûªs drunk, and Wolowitz is, you know, disgusting.
Yes, I suppose he is.
All I‰Ûªm saying is, you know Leonard the best.

Not necessarily. I‰Ûªm often surprised by my lack of familiarity with Leonard. Just the other day I discovered, he not only has a loofah, he hides it. Why do you suppose a man would be ashamed of having a loofah? I myself prefer to have my excess epithelial cells slough off naturally, but I don‰Ûªt condemn those who seek to accelerate the process. åÊ(Time shift) And until recently I had no idea that despite his lactose intolerance, he can tolerate small amounts of non-fat ice cream without producing a noxious gas that I maintain in the right concentration could be weaponised. (Begins to unlock apartment door.)
Leonard might come home, can we talk in my apartment.
We‰Ûªre not done?
No.
Ach, why not? We‰Ûªre already through the looking glass anyway.
Okay, so, here‰Ûªs the thing. I guess you‰Ûªre aware that Leonard asked me out.
Well, he didn‰Ûªt actually say anything, but when he came back to the apartment he was doing a dance that brought to mind the happy hippos in Fantasia.
Oh, that‰Ûªs nice. Anyhow, the thing I wanted to talk to you about is, you know, since Leonard and I have become friends, I was just‰Û_ want to sit down?
Oh, I wish it were that simple. You see, I don‰Ûªt spend much time here and so I‰Ûªve never really chosen a place to sit.
Well, choose.
There are a number of options and, I‰Ûªm really not familiar enough with the cushion densities, air flow patterns and dispersion of sunlight to make an informed choice.
Alright, why don‰Ûªt you just pick one at random, and then if you don‰Ûªt like it you can sit somewhere else next time.
No, no, that‰Ûªs crazy. You go ahead and talk while I figure it out.
Okay. Um, here‰Ûªs the thing. So, I‰Ûªve known for a while now that Leonard has had a little crush on me‰Û_
A little crush? Well I suppose so, in the same way Menelaus had a little crush on Helen of Troy.
Alright, yeah, I don‰Ûªt really know who they are‰Û_
Well Menelaus was the brother of Agamemnon‰Û_
Yeah, I don‰Ûªt care, I don‰Ûªt care. The point is Leonard isn‰Ûªt the kind of guy I usually go out with.
Leonard isn‰Ûªt the kind of guy anyone usually goes out with. Would you be open to rotating the couch clockwise thirty degrees?
No. What I‰Ûªm saying is, Leonard might be different in a good way. Obviously my usual choices have not worked out so well.
The last one worked out well for Koothrappali. He got a free iPod. Oh, glare!

But on the other hand, if things don‰Ûªt go well with Leonard, I risk losing a really good friend. I mean, I guess he‰Ûªs not looking for a fling, he‰Ûªs the kind of guy that gets into a relationship for, I don‰Ûªt know, like you would say light years.
I would not say that. No-one would say that, a light year is a unit of distance, not time.
Thank you for the clarification.
Draft. You see people hear the word year and they think duration. Foot pound has the same problem, that‰Ûªs a unit of work, not of weight.
Right, thanks.
It‰Ûªs a common mistake.
Not the first one I‰Ûªve made today.
Okay. I think this will be my seat.
Sheldon, do you have anything to say that has anything to do with, you know, what I‰Ûªm talking about.
Well, let‰Ûªs see. We might consider Schrodinger‰Ûªs Cat.
Schrodinger? Is that the woman in 2A?
No. That‰Ûªs Mrs Grossinger. And she doesn‰Ûªt have a cat, she has a Mexican hairless, annoying little animal, yip yip yip yip‰Û_
Sheldon!

Sorry, you diverted me. Anyway, in 1935, Erwin Schrodinger, in an attempt to explain the Copenhagen interpretation of quantum physics, he proposed an experiment where a cat is placed in a box with a sealed vial of poison that will break open at a random time. Now, since no-one knows when or if the poison has been released, until the box is opened, the cat can be thought of as both alive and dead.
I‰Ûªm sorry, I don‰Ûªt get the point.
Well of course you don‰Ûªt get it, I haven‰Ûªt made it yet. You‰Ûªd have to be psychic to get it, and there‰Ûªs no such thing as psychic.
Sheldon, what‰Ûªs the point?
Just like Schrodinger‰Ûªs Cat, your potential relationship with Leonard right now can be thought of as both good and bad. It is only by opening the box that you‰Ûªll find out which it is.
Okay, so you‰Ûªre saying I should go out with Leonard.
No, no, no, no, no, no. Let me start again. In 1935, Erwin Schrodinger‰Û_
The University cafeteria.
Two seats right there.

character: Sheldon (to two oriental-looking people occupying the other seats)
line: Chong sho sha pwe. (Caption translates to ‰ÛÏLong Live Concrete‰Û.) Xie xie. (Thank you)
Sheldon, I think I‰Ûªve made a mistake.
I can see that. Unless you‰Ûªre planning on running a marathon, choosing both stuffing and mashed potatoes is a starch filled redundancy.
No, it‰Ûªs about Penny.
A mistake involving Penny? Okay, you‰Ûªll have to narrow it down.
I don‰Ûªt think I can go out with her tonight.
Then don‰Ûªt.
Other people would say ‰ÛÏwhy not?‰Û
Other people might be interested.
I‰Ûªm going to talk anyway.
I assumed you would.
Now that I‰Ûªm actually about to go out with Penny, I‰Ûªm not excited, I‰Ûªm nauseous.
Ah, then your meal choice is appropriate. Starch absorbs fluid which reduces the amount of vomit available for violent expulsion.
Right.
You also made a common grammatical mistake, you said nauseous when you meant nauseated. But go on.
Sheldon, this date is probably my one chance with Penny, what happens if I blow it.

Well, if we accept your premise, and also accept the highly improbable assumption that Penny is the only woman in the world for you then we can logically conclude that the result of blowing it would be that you end up a lonely, bitter old man with no progeny. The image of any number of evil lighthouse keepers from Scooby Doo cartoons comes to mind.
You‰Ûªre not helping.
Alright, what response on my part would bring this conversation to a speedy conclusion?
Tell me whether or not to go through with the date.
Schrodinger‰Ûªs Cat.
Wow, that‰Ûªs brilliant.
You sound surprised. Mmm, hou zi shui zai li du. (Your monkey sleeps inside me.)
Leonard approaches Penny‰Ûªs door. He is wearing a suit. He knocks. Penny answers.
Hi.
Hi.
come on in.
Thank you. You look very nice.
Thank you. So do you.
I made an eight o‰Ûªclock reservation.
Okay, great, listen, um, maybe we should talk first.
Oh. Okay. But before you say anything, have you ever heard of Schrodinger‰Ûªs Cat?
Actually, I‰Ûªve heard far too much about Schrodinger‰Ûªs Cat.
Good. (He grabs her and kisses her.)
Alright, the cat‰Ûªs alive, let‰Ûªs go to dinner.
The Szechuan Palace.
Show me your mucus! Your mucus!
Blow your own nose and go away.
This is not a tangerine bicycle.
Crazy man. Call the police.
No. Don‰Ûªt call the library. Show me your mucus. (Leonard and Penny are seen entering, and then leaving again quickly.) Oxen are in my bed! Many, many oxen! Oy Vey!
The stairwell.
So you see, what you‰Ûªre eating is not technically yoghurt, because it doesn‰Ûªt have enough live acidophilus cultures. It‰Ûªs really just iced milk with carragenin added for thickness.
Oh, that‰Ûªs very interesting.
It‰Ûªs also not pink and has no berries.
Yeah, but it doesn‰Ûªt really answer my question.
What was your question again?
Do you want some.
Oh, right, no, I‰Ûªm lactose intolerant.
Right.
So, gas.
Got it.
Well, good night. (They kiss. Camera cuts away to a wall mounted security cam above the lift. Leonard spots its movement and shuffles Penny away.)
What are you doing?
There was a draft.
I didn‰Ûªt feel a draft.
Why don‰Ûªt we just go into your‰Û_.
Oh, yeah, you know what, maybe we should just slow things down a little.
No, no, I didn‰Ûªt mean to go into your apartment to‰Û_ go fast.
No, I know, I‰Û_ I know what you meant, it‰Ûªs just‰Û_ it‰Ûªs only our first date.
Yeah, okay, sure, no problem, why don‰Ûªt we just figure out where we‰Ûªre going, and when we want to get there, and then rate of speed equals distance over time. Solve for R.
Or we could just wing it.
That might work too.
Goodnight Leonard.
Goodnight. (He throws the camera a dirty look.)
He‰Ûªs coming. Screen saver.
Oh, hey, Leonard, how was your date?
Bite me. Sheldon, how could you just sit there and let them spy on me?
They were clever, Leonard. They exploited my complete lack of interest in what you were doing.
You should thank us. When future generations try to determine why your relationship with Penny crashed and burned, this right here is the black box.
What are you talking about, the date went fine.
Dude, she said she wants to slow things down.
Okay, so, she said she wants to slow things down. It‰Ûªs like saying ‰ÛÏI‰Ûªm really enjoying this meal, I‰Ûªm going to slow down and savour it.‰Û
No, it‰Ûªs like ‰ÛÏthis fish tastes bad, so I‰Ûªm going to slow down and spit it out.‰Û
You being the fish.
I‰Ûªm not the fish.
Oh really, did you make a second date.
Well, we sort of decided to wing it.
Oh, even I know that‰Ûªs lame.
Okay, alright, let‰Ûªs assume your hypothesis. We went to dinner, we talked, we laughed, we kissed, where could I have possibly gone wrong.

Think back, Leonard, the littlest things can set women off. Like, hey, the waitress is hot, I bet we could get her to come home with us. Or, how much does your mom weigh, I want to know what I‰Ûªm getting into.
I didn‰Ûªt say anything like that.
Good, ‰Û÷cos they don‰Ûªt work.
They also don‰Ûªt care for it if you stare at them and hyperventilate. Sadly, that‰Ûªs my home run swing.
Look, everything went fine. I didn‰Ûªt even have to refer to my impromptu conversation starters. The woman across the hall is into me.
Let‰Ûªs go to the tape. Look at her reaction to the goodnight kiss, no change in respiration, pupils un-dilated, no flushing of the chest.
Nice close up, by the way.
Interesting, her jaws are clenched, no tongue access, clearly a bad sign amongst mating humans.
That‰Ûªs not a bad sign.
Please, you might as well have been two iguana with no dewlap enlargement.
And the worst sign of all is, you‰Ûªre here and not there.
I‰Ûªm not there because I‰Ûªm taking things slow. Which, by the way, compared to you guys approaches warp speed. And take down that camera.
He was a lot more fun when he had no hope.
Give him time.
The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
Hi.
Oh, hi Penny. FYI, the hot water is inadequate on machine 2 so colours only, and 4 is still releasing the fabric softener too early in the cycle so I‰Ûªd avoid using that for your delicates.

character: Penny (tipping all her laundry into one machine at once)
line: Thanks.
Oh, good Lord. Why don‰Ûªt you just take your clothes down to the river and beat them with a rock?
Sheldon, may I ask you a question?
I would prefer that you not, but I won‰Ûªt go so far as to forbid it.
Alright, I heard yes, so‰Û_ okay, here‰Ûªs my question, has Leonard ever dated, you know, a regular girl.
Well I assume you‰Ûªre not referring to digestive regularity? Because I‰Ûªve come to learn that such inquiries are inappropriate.
No, I meant has he ever been involved with someone who wasn‰Ûªt a braniac?
Oh. Well, a few years ago he did go out with a woman who had a PhD in French Literature.
How is that not a braniac?
Well, for one thing, she was French. For another, it was literature.
So, do you think that if Leonard and I keep dating he‰Ûªll eventually get bored with me.
That depends.
On what?
Do you have a working knowledge of quantum physics?
No.
Do you speak Klingon?
No.
Do you know any card tricks?
Okay, okay, you know, I get it, Leonard has no business being involved with a waitress slash actress who felt so insecure that she lied to him about finishing community college.
Why would you lie about that?
Well, he was going on and on about this college and that grad school and I didn‰Ûªt want him to think I was some stupid loser.
You thought the opposite of stupid loser was community college graduate?
You know, there are a lot of successful people in this country who are community college graduates.
Yeah, but you were neither.
Right, okay look, this is between you and me, you cannot tell Leonard any of this.
You‰Ûªre asking me to keep a secret?
Yeah.

Well I‰Ûªm sorry, but you would have had to express that desire before revealing the secret, so that I could choose whether or not I wanted to accept the covenant of secret keeping. You can‰Ûªt impose a secret on an ex post facto basis.
What?

Secret keeping is a complicated endeavour. One has to be concerned not only about what one says, but about facial expression, autonomic reflexes, when I try to deceive, I myself have more nervous tics than a lyme disease research facility. (Long pause.) It‰Ûªs a joke. It relies on the hominymic relationship between tick the blood-sucking arachnid, and tic the involuntary muscular contraction. I made it up myself.
Okay, look, if Leonard finds out that I lied, I will absolutely die of embarrassment.
Physiologically impossible.
Oh Sheldon, please, look, I‰Ûªm asking you as a friend.
So you‰Ûªre saying that friendship contains within it an inherent obligation to maintain confidences?
Well, yeah.
Interesting. See, one more question, and perhaps I should have led with this, when did we become friends?
The stairwell.
I.e, I couldn‰Ûªt become Green Lantern unless I was chosen by the guardians of Oa, but given enough start-up capital and an adequate research facility, I could be Batman.
You could be Batman?
Sure. (In a gravelly voice) I‰Ûªm Batman. See.
Hi guys.
Hey.
Hi Penny.
Hey, Penny, if you‰Ûªre not doing anything Friday night I thought maybe we could go and see a movie.
Oh, um, you know, I think I have the dinner shift on Friday.
What about Saturday?
You know, I‰Ûªm not sure, the manager hasn‰Ûªt posted the schedule yet, how about I let you know.
Great. So you just let me know when you know. So‰Û_ (she leaves) Oh God, I am the bad fish! What did I do wrong?
Why are you asking me, I have no information about your interactions with Penny other than what you provided me, nor do I have any method of learning such things. (Runs away.)
What does that mean?
Nothing. You seem to be implying an informational back channel between me and Penny where obviously none exists.
No I didn‰Ûªt.
I just think you need to be careful how you phrase things, sir.
What‰Ûªs going on with you?

Well I might ask you the same question. Why do you insist on attempting to drag me into matters which have nothing to do with me? But exist between you and Penny. A person to whom I barely speak. (His eye begins to twitch.)
What‰Ûªs wrong with your face?
There‰Ûªs no reason to bring my looks into this. Good day, Leonard.
What?
I said Good Day! (He leaves)
Good day?
The Cheesecake Factory
Also today we have a fresh caught Alaska salmon, and that‰Ûªs served with a teriyaki glaze and sticky rice. Our soup of the day‰Û_
You must release me from my oath.
Sheldon, I‰Ûªm working.

Why don‰Ûªt you take a minute to decide (leads her away) I can‰Ûªt keep your secret Penny. I‰Ûªm going to fold like an energy based anobo protein in conformational space. Like a renaissance triptych. Like a cheap suit.
Oh, look, why is it so hard for you to keep one little secret?

I‰Ûªm constitutionally incapable. That‰Ûªs why I was refused clearance for a very prestigious government research fellowship at a secret military supercollider, located beneath a fake agricultural station 12.5 miles south east of Travers City, Michigan. Which you did not hear about from me.
Look, just forget I told you about me not graduating from community college. Okay?
Forget! You want me to forget? This mind does not forget. I haven‰Ûªt forgotten a single thing since the day my mother stopped breast feeding me. It was a drizzly Tuesday.
Okay, look, you promised me you would keep my secret so you‰Ûªre just going to have to figure out a way to do it.
The apartment.
Leonard, I‰Ûªm moving out.
What do you mean, you‰Ûªre moving out? Why?
There doesn‰Ûªt have to be a reason.
Yeah, there kind of does.

Not necessarily. This is a classic example of munchausen‰Ûªs trilemma. Either the reason is predicated on a series of sub-reasons leading to an infinite regression, or it tracks back to arbitrary axiomatic statements, or it‰Ûªs ultimately circular, i.e., I‰Ûªm moving out because I‰Ûªm moving out.
I‰Ûªm still confused.
Leonard, I don‰Ûªt see how I could have made it any simpler.
Hey, qu‰Ûªest q‰Ûªwass up?
We just got back from that exhibit of those plasticised human cadavers.
And some of those skinless chicks were hot.
If you‰Ûªll excuse me, I‰Ûªm going to pack.
That‰Ûªs kind of an overreaction to a little harmless necrophilia.
It‰Ûªs not you, Howard, he says he‰Ûªs moving out.
What did you do? Did you change the contrast or brightness settings on the television?
No.
Did you take a band aid off in front of him?
No.
Did you buy generic ketchup, forget to rinse the sink, talk to him through the bathroom door?
Adjust the thermostat, cook with cilantro, pronounce the T in often?
No.
Did you make fun of trains?
I didn‰Ûªt do anything, he‰Ûªs just gone insane.
Well, we all knew this day was coming.
That was fast.
It‰Ûªs my pre-packed disaster evacuation bag. Recommended by the department of homeland security. And Sarah Connor.
Where are you gonna live?
Until I find a permanent place I will stay with friends.
Bye (runs out.)
Well you can‰Ûªt stay with me, I have a teeny tiny apartment.
Excuse me, but isn‰Ûªt hosting guests an aspect of Menushya Yajna, one of the five central religious duties or sacrifices of the Hindu householder?
I hate trains.
Don‰Ûªt be ridiculous, you love trains.
Yes I do, come on. See you later Leonard. (Sheldon drops keys in bowl and leaves without a word.)
This could work.
Raj‰Ûªs apartment.
This is a very old building.
Sixty years. Used to be a watch factory.
Uh-oh.
What?
Don‰Ûªt you worry about the residual radium from the luminous dials?
Not until now.
I can‰Ûªt believe I didn‰Ûªt bring my gieger counter. You know, I had it on my bed and I didn‰Ûªt pack it.
Well, if you‰Ûªre not comfortable staying here, Sheldon‰Û_
I‰Ûªm kidding, I packed it. It was a joke, I was subverting the conversational expectations. I believe they call that the, um, old switcheroo.
Terrific.

character: Sheldon (referring to Bollywood singing on television)
line: Is that woman Aishwarya Rai?
Yes, isn‰Ûªt she an amazing actress.
Actually, I‰Ûªd say she‰Ûªs a poor man‰Ûªs Madhuri Dixit.
How dare you. Aishwarya Rai is a Goddess. By comparison Madhuri Dixit is a leprous prostitute.
Sorry, I didn‰Ûªt mean to offend you. Obviously you‰Ûªre not that familiar with Indian cinema.
Howard‰Ûªs house. The door rings.
Who is it?
Strippergram. (Howard opens door. Outside are Raj and Sheldon.)
Tag. You‰Ûªre it. (Runs away.)
Shouldn‰Ûªt you have put him in a brown paper bag and set him on fire?
Howard‰Ûªs bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
I‰Ûªve never slept on an air mattress before. No lumbar support whatsoever.
Maybe you‰Ûªd be happier on a park bench?
I don‰Ûªt see any way to get a park bench in here.
Do you want to switch?
No, that‰Ûªs fine. I‰Ûªm perfectly comfortable sleeping on a bouncy castle.
Get out of bed, we‰Ûªre switching.
Now, only if you want to.
Just get in the bed!
What‰Ûªs going on? Are you boys roughhousing?
We‰Ûªre just talking ma.
If you don‰Ûªt settle down right now, I‰Ûªm not going to let you have any more sleepovers.
For God‰Ûªs sake, ma, I‰Ûªm 27 years old. It‰Ûªs not even a school night! (To Sheldon) Comfy now?
Meh. That poster of Halle Berry‰Ûªs a little unnerving.
So don‰Ûªt look at it.
She‰Ûªs like my fourth favourite catwoman.
No kidding?
Yeah, Julie Newmar, Michelle Pfieffer, Eartha Kitt and then her.
What about Lee Meriwether?
Oh, I forgot about Lee Meriwether.
Well I‰Ûªm glad that‰Ûªs settled.
That makes Halle Berry my fifth favourite catwoman. There‰Ûªs Julie Newmar, Michelle Pfieffer, Eartha Kitt, Lee Meriwether‰Û_
Please, I‰Ûªm begging you, go to sleep.
I‰Ûªm trying, I‰Ûªm counting catwomen. She did make a fine mutant in the X-Men movies though.
Oh for God‰Ûªs sake.

But she‰Ûªs not my favourite of the X-Men, in order that would be Wolverine, Cyclops, oh wait, I forgot Professor X. Professor X, Wolverine, Cyclops, Iceman, then Storm, Angel, the Beast, oh wait, Nightcrawler. Professor X, Nightcrawler, Wolverine, Cyclops, Iceman, then Storm, Angel‰Û_.
Sheldon and Leonard‰Ûªs apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
I‰Ûªm coming! (Opens the door. Sheldon falls inside, wearing his pyjamas. Howard is outside.)
Hey, there he is, there‰Ûªs my old buddy-bud-bud.
What‰Ûªs with him?
Koothrappali dumped him on me, and he couldn‰Ûªt get to sleep, so I gave him a glass of warm milk with a handful of my mom‰Ûªs valium in it. But he still wouldn‰Ûªt shut up, so, tag, you‰Ûªre it.
I‰Ûªm ba-ack!
I still don‰Ûªt know why you left.
I can‰Ûªt tell you.
Why not.
I promised Penny.
You promised Penny what?
That I wouldn‰Ûªt tell you the secret. Shhhhh!
What secret. Tell me the secret.
Mom smokes in the car. Jesus is okay with it, but we can‰Ûªt tell Dad.
Not that secret, the other secret.
I‰Ûªm Batman. Shhhhh!
Dammit, Sheldon! You said Penny told you a secret, what was the secret.
Okay, I‰Ûªll tell you, but you can‰Ûªt tell Leonard.
I promise.
Penny lied about graduating from community college because she is afraid she‰Ûªs not smart enough for Leonard.
So it‰Ûªs nothing I did? It‰Ûªs her problem?
I drank milk that tasted funny.
Penny thinks I‰Ûªm too smart for her, that‰Ûªs ridiculous.
I know, most of your work is extremely derivative. Don‰Ûªt worry, that‰Ûªs not a secret. Everybody knows.
The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny‰Ûªs door.
Hi.
Yeah, hi, listen, I know what‰Ûªs been bothering you about us, and I have the answer.
What are you talking about.
First I want to say that it‰Ûªs not Sheldon‰Ûªs fault, he tried very hard to keep your secret, if Howard hadn‰Ûªt drugged him he would have taken it to his grave.
He told you?
Yes, but it‰Ûªs okay. Now that we know what the problem is, there‰Ûªs a simple solution. (Hands her a brochure.)
Pasadena city college?
A place for fun, a place for knowledge. See, this man here‰Ûªs playing hacky sack, and this girl‰Ûªs going to be a paralegal.
Wow, I get it, because Dr Leonard Hofstadter can‰Ûªt date a girl without a fancy college degree.
Well, it‰Ûªs really not that fancy, it‰Ûªs just a city college.
Right, but I have to have some sort of degree to date you?
That doesn‰Ûªt matter to me at all.
So, it‰Ûªs fine with you if I‰Ûªm not smart.
Absolutely. (She slams the door in his face.) Okay, this time I know where I went wrong. (Looking up and seeing the camera) Oh bite me!
The building entrance lobby. The guys enter. Sheldon is dressed as a medieval monk, Howard is a court jester, Raj is a medieval gentleman and Leonard is a knight.
Worst Renaissance Fair ever.
Please let it go, Sheldon.

It was rife with historical inaccuracies. For example, the tavern girl serving flagons of mead, now her costume was obviously Germanic, but in 1487 the Bavarian purity laws or Rhineheitsgebot severely limited the availability of mead. At best they would have had some sort of spiced wine.
You‰Ûªre nitpicking.
Oh-ho! Really? Well here‰Ûªs another nit for you. The flagons would not have been made of polypropylene.
Renaissance fairs aren‰Ûªt about historical accuracy. They‰Ûªre about taking chubby girls who work at Kinko‰Ûªs and lacing them up in corsets so tight their bosom jumps out and says howdy.
Bosoms would not have said howdy in the fifteenth century. If anything they would have said ‰ÛÏhuzzah!‰Û
I don‰Ûªt care what the bosoms say, Sheldon, I just want to be part of the conversation.

character: Penny (arriving with a man in tow)
line: Hi guys. Looks like you‰Ûªve been to the Renaissance fair. I‰Ûªm hoping.
Renaissance fair? More of a medieval slash age of enlightenment slash any excuse to wear a codpiece fair.
Okay, fine, whatever, um, you guys, this is my friend Eric.
Hello.
Hi.
Hey.
So, yeah, good to see you.
Yeah, yeah, it‰Ûªs good to see you too. We should really go.
Yeah.
Bye guys.
Like your hat.
Thanks, my mom made it. Penny with a new guy, tres awkward.
It wasn‰Ûªt awkward. It wasn‰Ûªt fun. Besides, what‰Ûªs the big deal, we dated, we stopped dating, and now we‰Ûªre both moving on.
By moving on, do you mean, she‰Ûªs going out with other men and you spent the afternoon making fifteenth century soap with Wolowitz?
That was not fifteenth century soap, my God those people need to learn you can‰Ûªt just put ‰ÛÏye olde‰Û in front of anything and expect to get away with it.
Can we please just go in, my chain mail is stuck in my underwear.
You‰Ûªre wearing modern underwear?
Relatively modern. Why, what are you wearing?
I fashioned historically accurate undergarments out of linen.
You went out and bought linen?
Don‰Ûªt be silly, I borrowed one of your pillow cases.
Borrowed?
The apartment.
You know what, I‰Ûªm happy that Penny‰Ûªs moving on. It gives me the freedom to move on myself.
Are you saying that you‰Ûªve been holding back?
Of course. Out of respect.
So, how do you explain the ten years before Penny?
Who were you respecting then?
What? I‰Ûªve dated plenty of women. There was Joyce Kim, Leslie Winkle.
Notify the editors of the Oxford English Dictionary, the word plenty has been redefined to mean two.
Uh, what about that girl last year at Comic-con?
Doesn‰Ûªt count.
Why not?
What happens in costume at Comic-con, stays at Comic-con.
You‰Ûªre only saying that because of what happened to you.
What happened to you?
N-n-n-nothing happened to me.
It wasn‰Ûªt your fault, Raj, he was dressed as a green Orion slave girl.
H-h-h-how did we get on me, we were mocking Leonard for not moving on. Dude, you have totally not moved on.
Yes I have, it‰Ûªs just a matter of actually making a date with someone.
Like who?
Well, there‰Ûªs Joyce Kim, but she defected back to North Korea so it‰Ûªs a little geographically undesireable.
What about Leslie Winkle.
Oh no.
Why?
Her research methodology is sloppy, she‰Ûªs unjustifiably arrogant about loop quantum gravity, and to make matters worse she‰Ûªs often mean to me.
I think she‰Ûªs smoking hot.
I‰Ûªd hit that.
You‰Ûªd hit particulate soil on a colloidal suspension. Mud.
Look, I like Leslie, but she‰Ûªs not interested in dating as much as using men as tools for stress release.
Yeah, so, be a tool. Go get yourself a little rebound stress release.
Technically it would only be rebound if he and Penny had actually engaged in physical intimacy.
You mean like you and Richard the slave girl?
I bought him dinner and we kissed once, that was it. (Leaving) And he told me his name was Kimberley!
The university cafeteria.
You know how I know we‰Ûªre not in The Matrix?
How?
If we were, the food would be better.
Hey, Leonard.
Hey, Leslie.
Hey, dummy.
Hello to you, insufficiently intelligent person.
Ooh, rush me to the burn unit. Hey, Leonard, do you have a second, I need to ask you something.
Uh, sure.
Well, if you‰Ûªll excuse me, I‰Ûªm going to go do work that promises significant results, as opposed to what you do, which does not. Yeah, you heard me.
Wow. So, I heard your relationship with Penny crashed to the ground like blue ice falling out of an airplane lavatory.
Where did you hear that?
Actually I read it. Wolowitz texted me. (Shows him text.)
Like blue ice falling out of an airplane lavatory. Yep.
I thought it was a pretty good one, I gave him an L-O-L. Anyway, it got me thinking, now that you‰Ûªre unattached maybe we can revisit our previous attachment.
Are you suggesting another bout of stress release.
No, I‰Ûªm all done with casual sex. From now on I‰Ûªm fully committed to the traditional relationship paradigm.
Really, what changed?
It‰Ûªs hard to say, I guess there‰Ûªs just a time in every woman‰Ûªs life when she gets tired of waking up on a strange futon with a bunch of people she doesn‰Ûªt know.
Yeah, I can see how that would‰Û_ a bunch of people?
Anyway, I just figure it‰Ûªs time to slow things down and who better to slow things down with than you?
Oh, I‰Ûªm flattered. So, how do you suggest we proceed?
Your place, we‰Ûªll order Chinese, you‰Ûªll rent a movie, artsy but accessible, then light petting, no coitus.
Sounds fun.
I‰Ûªll leave the details up to you, I think it‰Ûªs better if you assume the male role.
Thank you, that‰Ûªs very thoughtful.
Great. Call me.
The apartment. Leonard is dressed smartly and placing wine on the table. Sheldon enters.
Great news. My mom sent me my old Nintendo 64.
Terrific.
You know what this means, don‰Ûªt you? Break out the Red Bull, it‰Ûªs time to rock Mario old school.
I kind of have other plans tonight.
But it‰Ûªs Friday. Friday‰Ûªs always vintage game night. Look, mom included the memory card, we can pick up where I left off in 1999 when I had pernicious anaemia.
Well, the thing is, someone‰Ûªs coming over.
Well then, no problem, I have three controllers, the more the merrier.
Sheldon, it‰Ûªs a date, I have a date coming over.
Oh, well you can‰Ûªt blame me for not jumping to that conclusion.
Why, what‰Ûªs so unusual about me having a date?
Well, statistically speaking‰Û_
Alright, alright. Well, uh, nevertheless, I have one now and I would appreciate it if you would, you know, make yourself scarce.
Leonard, I am a published theoretical physicist with two doctorates and an IQ which can‰Ûªt be accurately measured by normal tests, how much scarcer could I be?
You know what I mean, could you just give us a little privacy?
You want me to leave the apartment?
Yes.
You mean just go someplace else and be‰Û_ someplace else?
Yes.
Well, why should I leave, this is my apartment too.
I know it is, and if science ever discovers a second member of your species and you two would like some privacy I would be more than happy to get out of your way.
Well alright then.
The entrance lobby. Sheldon is sitting on the bottom step using his laptop. Penny comes down the stairs.
Sheldon? What are you doing?
Playing Super Mario on a poorly coded Nintendo 64 emulator.
Yeah, but why are you doing it on the stairs?
I‰Ûªm a modern day Napoleon exiled to the Elba of the staircase because Leonard, get this, has a date.
Oh. Oh, well, good for him. Yeah but, why are you sitting here, why don‰Ûªt you just go to a movie or something?
Alone?
Yeah, why not?
What if I choke on my popcorn, who will administer the Heimlich manoeuvre.
Well then don‰Ûªt order popcorn.
No popcorn at the mo‰Û_ listen to yourself.
Well why don‰Ûªt you go to a coffee shop.
I don‰Ûªt drink coffee.
They have other things.
What do they have?
I don‰Ûªt know, you know, cookies, pastries‰Û_
Pastries such as bearclaws?
Yeah, sure.
I don‰Ûªt like bearclaws.
Heya Penny. Dumbass.
Leslie Winkle. Of all the overrated physicists in all the labs in all the world, why does it have to be Leslie Winkle?
Well, they have a lot in common. I mean they‰Ûªre both scientists.
Oh please. The only way she could make a contribution to science would be if they resume sending chimps into space.
Okay, well I have a date too, so see ya.
Everybody has a date. Even you, Mario, going after Princess Peach. And what am I doing, I‰Ûªm just enabling you.
The apartment.
This is pretty good Orange Chicken.
Yeah, it‰Ûªs from Changs.
Not Chows?
No, Changs.
What happened to Chows?
It changed.
Oh. So, how many children do you think we should have? (Leonard splutters and coughs) I‰Ûªm sorry, that was a little abrupt.
A little.
I mean there are so many things to talk about before we discuss reproduction.
I sure hope so.
Besides shortness, what genetic weaknesses run in your family?
I‰Ûªm sorry to interrupt, batteries dying continue.
Uh, genetic weaknesses, right, um, there‰Ûªs the lactose intolerance.

Don‰Ûªt forget the male pattern baldness. When his uncles sit around the dinner table they look like a half carton of eggs. (Exits. Extension cord trails after him. Eventually goes tight a couple of times then falls loose.)
Okay, now my uncles are bald, but my Aunt Edna is one of the hairiest women you will ever meet. So‰Û_ Sweet lady. It always tickles when she hugs me. (Sheldon knocks and enters again.) What now?
I have to make pee-pee.
Listen, I‰Ûªm sorry about all of Sheldon‰Ûªs interruptions, he can be a bit of an eccentric.
If by eccentric you mean passive-aggressive East Texas blowhole, I agree.
Well, I think tonight was a very good start.
Me too. You‰Ûªre sure you‰Ûªre okay postponing intercourse until our relationship is past the initial viability test?
No problem, I‰Ûªm very skilled at postponing intercourse. So I guess I‰Ûªll call you and we‰Ûªll arrange another evening.
Yes. I believe protocol dictates that you wait a minimum of 18 hours before you call so I‰Ûªm not repulsed by your cloying eagerness.
Sure.
Again, it‰Ûªs your decision, you‰Ûªre the man.
No, it wasn‰Ûªt my cat, it was an experiment designed by this guy named Schrodinger.
From the Charlie Brown cartoons?
No, he was some kind of scientist, let me start again. Oh, hey Leonard.
Hello.
Leslie.
Hi.
Okay, well, goodnight. (Leans in to kiss Leslie.)
Okay, well, goodnight. (Grabs Eric and kisses him more passionately.)

That ain‰Ûªt going to make your point. (Grabs him and tries to out-passion Penny. The two couples get more passionate trying to outdo each other until Leonard grabs Leslie‰Ûªs ass.) Okay, that‰Ûªs enough. (Sweetly) Call me (exits.)
Right (goes back inside flat. Closes door.)
Okay, goodnight.
What?
Had a great time, ciao (closes door.)
The university lunch room.
I‰Ûªm sorry, I am not going back to the Renaissance Fair.
Come on, Sheldon, there‰Ûªs so few places I can wear my jester costume.
I don‰Ûªt care. There are far too many historical anomalies for my comfort.
Oh, okay, how about this. You can go dressed as a Star Trek science officer exploring a planet similar to Earth in the 1500s.
You mean like Spock?
Sure.
Fascinating.
Hey fellow scientists. Sheldon.
Hey, why don‰Ûªt we all move over there so Leslie can join us.
Hmm, let‰Ûªs do it. (Sheldon does not move. Leonard looks confused.)
If you‰Ûªre having trouble deciding where to sit may I suggest one potato two potato, or as I call it the Leslie Winkle experimental methodology.
Don‰Ûªt make this hard for me.
It‰Ûªs not hard. It‰Ûªs simple. You can either sit with me, your friend, colleague and roommate, or you can sit with an overrated scientist you might have sex with.
You‰Ûªre right, it is simple. (Sits with Leslie.)
The stairs. Sheldon is playing on his computer at the end of the long extension cord.
Hey, Sheldon.
Penny.
Third floor tonight. Mixing it up? (Sheldon indicates extension cord.) Oh. You know, I still don‰Ûªt understand why you just don‰Ûªt go to dinner or something.
Alright, let‰Ûªs say I go to dinner alone. And during the meal I have to use the rest room. How do I know someone‰Ûªs not touching my food?
Goodnight Sheldon.
Penny, hold on. Are you sure things can‰Ûªt work out with you and Leonard?
Excuse me?
I‰Ûªm just wondering if you really gave it the old college try? Or in your case the old community college try?
Okay, where is this coming from?
Leonard is upstairs right now with my arch enemy.
Your arch enemy?
Yes, the Doctor Doom to my Mr Fantastic. The Doctor Octopus to my Spiderman. The Doctor Sivana to my Captain Marvel.
Okay, I get it, I get it, I get it.
Do you know, it‰Ûªs amazing how many supervillains have advanced degrees. Graduate school should probably do a better job of screening those people out.
Sheldon, come back, you‰Ûªre losing me.
Leslie Winkle, Penny. She belittles my research.
Oh, sweetie, I‰Ûªm sorry.
She called me dumbass.
I know. I heard.
Given this situation, I have no choice but to withdraw my previous objections to your ill considered relationship with Leonard.
Oh, gee, well, thankyou for that. But, um, I think for now Leonard and I are just going to stay friends.
No, that response is unacceptable to me.
Sheldon, you are a smart guy, you must know‰Û_
Smart? I‰Ûªd have to lose 60 IQ points to be classified as smart.
Are you going to let me talk?
I‰Ûªm sorry.
You must know that if Leonard and Leslie want to be together, nothing you can do is going to stop it.
You continue to underestimate my abilities madam.
Okay, let me put it this way, if you‰Ûªre really Leonard‰Ûªs friend you will support him no matter who he wants to be with.
Wait a minute, why am I doing all the giving here? If Leonard‰Ûªs really my friend, why doesn‰Ûªt he have to support me in my hatred of Leslie Winkle?
Because love trumps hate.
Oh now you‰Ûªre just making stuff up.
Okay. Goodnight Sheldon.
Oh Mario. If only I could control everyone the way I control you. Hop, you little plumber, hop, hop, hop.
The apartment. Leonard and Leslie are kissing.
When the two of you reach a natural stopping point I‰Ûªd like to have a word.
If the word is pee-pee, just do it.
Leonard, you are my friend. And friends support their friends, apparently. So I am withdrawing my objection to your desire to have a relationship with Leslie.
Thank you.

I will graciously overlook the fact that she is an arrogant sub-par scientist, who actually believes loop quantum gravity better unites quantum mechanics with general relativity than does string theory. You kids have fun.
Hang on a second. Loop quantum gravity clearly offers more testable predictions than string theory.
I‰Ûªm listening, amuse me.
Okay, well, for one thing we expect quantii space-time to manifest itself as minute differences in the speed of light for different colours.
Balderdash. Matter clearly consists of tiny strings.
Are you going to let him talk to me like that?
Okay, well, there is a lot of merit to both theories.
No there isn‰Ûªt, only loop quantum gravity calculates the entropy of black holes. (Sheldon grunts.)
Sheldon, don‰Ûªt make that noise, it‰Ûªs disrespectful.
I hope so, it was a snort of derision.
You agree with me, right, loop quantum gravity is the future of physics.
Sorry Leslie, I guess I prefer my space stringy not loopy.
Well, I‰Ûªm glad I found out the truth about you before this went any further.
Truth, what truth? We‰Ûªre talking about untested hypotheses, uh, it‰Ûªs no big deal.
Oh, it isn‰Ûªt, really? Tell me Leonard, how would we raise the children?
I guess we let them wait until they‰Ûªre old enough and let them choose their own theory.
We can‰Ûªt let them choose, Leonard, they‰Ûªre children. (Storms off.)
Wait, where are you going?
I‰Ûªm sorry, I could have accepted our kids being genetically unable to eat ice-cream or ever get a good view of a parade, but this? This is a deal breaker. (Leaves.)
Look on the bright side.
What‰Ûªs the bright side?
Only nine more months to comic-con.
Oh yeah.
The Renaissance Fair. The guys are in costume. Sheldon is Spock and has a tri-corder.
Captain, I‰Ûªm getting an unusual reading.
Yeah, that‰Ûªs great, you guys want corn dogs?
Yeah.
That‰Ûªs a temporal anomaly. Corn dogs didn‰Ûªt come into existence until the first half of the twentieth century.
The apartment. Sheldon is on the sofa, using his laptop. He is wearing a headset.

Fellow warriors, this is Sheldor the Conqueror. We are about to enter Axel‰Ûªs fortress. Now this is a long run, so let‰Ûªs do another bladder check. Alright Barry, we‰Ûªll wait for you again, but you really should see a doctor. (There is banging at the door.) Sheldor is AFK. (Goes out to find Penny having trouble getting into her apartment.) Penny, are you experiencing some sort of difficulty?
Yes, I can‰Ûªt get my stupid door open.
You appear to have put your car key in the door lock, are you aware of that?
Yeah!
Alright then. (Turns to return inside. One of the grocery bags Penny is holding falls to the floor spilling groceries.)
Dammit, dammit, dammit, dammit, dammit, dammit.
Would it be possible for you to do this a little more quietly?
I can‰Ûªt get the damned key out.
Well that‰Ûªs not surprising. That Baldwin lock on your door uses traditional edge mounted cylinders, whereas the key for your Volkswagon uses a centre cylinder system.
Thankyou, Sheldon.
You‰Ûªre welcome. Point of inquiry, why did you put your car key in the door lock?

Why? I‰Ûªll tell you why. Because today I had an audition, it took me two hours to get there, I waited an hour for my turn, and before I could even start they told me I looked too Midwest for the part. Too Midwest? What the hell does that even mean?
Well, the American Midwest was mostly settled by Scandinavian and Germanic peoples who, well they have a characteristic facial bone structure‰Û_.

I know what it means, Sheldon! God, you know, I have been in L.A. for almost two years now, and I haven‰Ûªt got a single acting job, I have accomplished nothing, haven‰Ûªt gotten a raise at work, haven‰Ûªt even had sex in six months, and just now when I was walking up those stairs a fly flew in my mouth and I ate it.
Well, actually, insects are a dietary staple in many cultures, they‰Ûªre almost pure protein.

character: Penny (picking up the bag she has just repacked, whereupon the bottom falls out and the groceries fall to the floor again)
line: Oh, sonofabitch!

I believe the condensation on your frozen foods weakened the structural integrity of the bag. But returning to your key conundrum, perhaps you should call a locksmith and have him open the door for you.
I did, and he said he‰Ûªll get here when he gets here.
And you‰Ûªre frustrated because he phrased his reply in the form of a meaningless tautology?
No! I am frustrated because I am a failure at everything and my breath smells like fly. (Bursts into tears.)
There there. (Reluctantly) Would you prefer to wait in our apartment?
No Sheldon, I‰Ûªd rather sit on this freezing cold floor sobbing like a three year-old.
Alright then. (Turns to go inside again.)
For God‰Ûªs sake! (Stomps into apartment.)
Just when I think I‰Ûªve gotten the hang of sarcasm.
Inside the apartment.

Make yourself comfortable. (Sits in Sheldon‰Ûªs place.) Not there. (Sits on other end of sofa. Puts feet on table. Sheldon looks disapprovingly. Removes feet from table. Sheldon sits and replaces headset.) Sheldor is back online.
Sheldor?
The Conqueror.
What are you doing?
AFK. I‰Ûªm playing Age of Conan, an online multiplayer game set in the universe of Robert E. Howard‰Ûªs Conan the Barbarian.
Oh.
Sheldor, back online.
What‰Ûªs AFK?
AFK. Away from keyboard.
OIC.
What does that stand for?
Oh, I see?
Yes, but what does it stand for?
The stairwell. Leonard arrives and sees the spilled groceries. A cat is lapping at a spilled pot of ice-cream. Cut to inside. Penny now has the laptop, Sheldon is instructing her.
Now just click on the enchanted boots to put them on.
Oh, I don‰Ûªt know. Can I see them in another colour?
Just click on them. Congratulations, you are now a level three warrior.
What‰Ûªs going on?
Leonard, guess what, I‰Ûªm a level three warrior.
Great, you know there are groceries outside of your apartment?
Yeah yeah yeah, shhh!
I only bring it up because your ice-cream is melting and it‰Ûªs starting to attract wildlife.
Uh-huh, yeah, do I stay in the jungle or go towards the beach?
It doesn‰Ûªt matter, right now you‰Ûªre looking for treasure.
Okay. (Leonard motions for Sheldon to talk in the kitchen.) Wait, wait, where are you going?
You‰Ûªre okay, if you run into crocodiles just kick them with your boots.
Want to catch me up?
Well let‰Ûªs see, uh, she attempted to open her apartment with her car key, because her face is overly Midwestern, um, she hasn‰Ûªt had sex in six months, and she ate a fly.
Uh-huh. Seriously, six months?
Oh my God, a treasure chest, I‰Ûªm rich!
Level three and she thinks she‰Ûªs rich! What a noob.
The apartment. Raj is pouring a white liquid into the main dish of a stereo speaker covered in cling film.
Okay, we‰Ûªre all set.
Let her rip.
Hi!
Hey, check it out, it‰Ûªs just corn starch and water.
They make up a non-Newtonian fluid which is liquid, but solid under the percussive action of the speaker.
That‰Ûªs what makes it get all funky.
Yeah, okay. Listen, I need to talk to Sheldon.

character: Howard (after Raj whispers in his ear)
line: No, that‰Ûªs what she said, Sheldon.
Okay, look, I bought the game, and I‰Ûªve been exploring the Island of Tordage but I can‰Ûªt figure out how to get past the guard captain.
Do you have the enchanted sword?
No, no, I‰Ûªve a bronze dagger.
You can‰Ûªt slay the guard captain with a bronze dagger, my Lord it‰Ûªs like the car key in your apartment door all over again.
Alright, alright, how do I get the sword?
Well, have you been to the Temple of Mithra?
Is that the place on the hill with the weird priests in front of it?
No, no, no, it‰Ûªs‰Û_ oh for God‰Ûªs sakes, gimme. (Takes laptop.)
Thank you, I really appreciate this.
You‰Ûªre going to have to learn to do these things for yourself, Penny.
Don‰Ûªt patronise me, just get the sword.
What the frak?
Beats me. They were playing all last night too.
It‰Ûªs like some kind of weird comic book crossover.
Like if Hulk were dating Peppermint Patty.
I always thought Peppermint Patty was a lesbian?
No, that‰Ûªs Marcie. Peppermint Patty‰Ûªs just athletic.
There you go, one enchanted sword.
Right, gimme, gimme, gimme, I want to kill the guard captain. (Leaves).
That girl needs to get a life.
Sheldon‰Ûªs bedroom. There is a knock on the door. Penny enters.
Sheldon. (Sing-song) Shel-don.
Danger, danger.
No danger, look, it‰Ûªs just me, Penny, look, I got to level 25 and reached Purple Lotus Swamp, right?
You‰Ûªre in my bedroom.
Yeah. Leonard gave me an emergency key.
People can‰Ûªt be in my bedroom.
Okay, well can we go talk in the living room?
I‰Ûªm not wearing pyjama bottoms.
Why not?
I spilled grape juice.
Well, wear different pyjamas.
I can‰Ûªt wear different pyjamas, these are my Monday pyjamas. Penny, people cannot be in my bedroom.
Okay, just tell me, is it too soon to join a quest to the Black Castle?
You were invited on a quest to the Black Castle?
Yeah, yeah, by some guys in Budapest, I‰Ûªm just not sure it‰Ûªs the right move for my character.
