You have a desk.
Correct.
But I can‰Ûªt have one.
You‰Ûªre two for two.
Why can‰Ûªt he have a desk, Sheldon?

Oh, Lord, will this day never end? As I‰Ûªve explained repeatedly to Dr. Koothrappali, whose ability to comprehend the American idiom fails him when it‰Ûªs convenient, there‰Ûªs absolutely no money in my budget for additional office furniture.
Oh, but there‰Ûªs money for a drawer full of Red Vines, a marshmallow shooting rifle, and a super executive ant farm with glow-in-the-dark sand?
Yes.
Okay, what if he buys his own desk?
Yeah, what if I buy my own desk?
That‰Ûªs ridiculous.
Why?
Because‰Û_
Yes?
It‰Ûªs my office.
Sheldon.
All right, all right. He can buy his own desk.
And I can put it in your office?
Well, you really want to dot the I‰Ûªs and cross the T‰Ûªs, don‰Ûªt you?
Why would you want a glow-in-the-dark ant farm?
They do some of their best work at night.
Penny‰Ûªs apartment. Penny is gathering laundry.

character: Penny (picking up a top and sniffing it)
line: Ah, it‰Ûªs okay.
(Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Penny opens door. Howard is stood outside with a hand-held voice recorder.) Penny?
Would you have opened the door if you knew it was me?
Not since I found out the teddy bear you gave me had a webcam in it.
I just have a question. Does Bernadette ever talk about me?
Oh, absolutely.
She does?
Yeah, sure. Just yesterday, she asked, why is Howard hiding under the table?
She saw that, huh?
Oh, no, not at first. Right after I pointed it out.
Let me ask you something else. Is she seeing anybody?
Uh, not that I know of. Hey, while we‰Ûªre on the subject, why did you guys break up anyway?
Oh, I‰Ûªd rather not say.
Howard, if you want my help, I‰Ûªve got to know what happened.
But it‰Ûªs embarrassing.
Yeah, that‰Ûªs what I‰Ûªm counting on. Spill.
Okay. Well, you know World of Warcraft?
Um, the online game? Sure.
Well, did you know that the characters in the game can have sex with each other?
Oh, God. I think I see where this is going.
Her name was Glissinda the Troll. Bernadette walked in on me while we were doing the cyber-nasty under the Bridge of Souls.
Oh, you‰Ûªre right. That is so embarrassing.
Would you talk to her?
Bernadette or the troll?
Bernadette. She was so mad at me, she wouldn‰Ûªt even listen to my side of the story.
Well, what was your side?
Well, for all we know, Glissinda the Troll wasn‰Ûªt even a real woman. I mean, she could‰Ûªve been a 50-year-old truck driver in New Jersey.
Really? And that didn‰Ûªt make her feel better?
Will you talk to her, see if there‰Ûªs any chance at all we could get back together?
Oh, gee, Howard, I really don‰Ûªt want to get in the middle of this.
No. Why would you? I‰Ûªm just another lonely nerd, living with his mother, trying to find any scrap of happiness he can. You know, maybe to make up for the fact that his dad left him when he was 11.
Okay, I will think about it.
You know, I‰Ûªve always blamed myself for him leaving. I always thought it was because I wasn‰Ûªt the son he wanted.
Yeah, I said I‰Ûªd think about it.
I wasn‰Ûªt athletic, yeah, I was kind of sickly.
Okay, fine. Look, look, I‰Ûªm calling her now! See?
Thank you.
A corridor at the university.
So anyway, Howard asked Penny to talk to Bernadette, and she did, and Bernadette agreed to meet him for a cup of coffee.
One question.
Yeah?
Why on earth are you telling me all this?
I don‰Ûªt know. Sometimes your movements are so lifelike, I forget you‰Ûªre not a real boy.
You said I could buy a desk.
This isn‰Ûªt a desk. This is a Brobdingnagian monstrosity.
Is that the American idiom for giant, big-ass desk?
It‰Ûªs actually British.
Can you say it again for me?
Brobdingnagian.
One more time?
Brobdingnagian.
Now three times fast?
Brobdingnagian, Brobdingna‰Û_ How did you even get it in here?
That‰Ûªs for me, Ramon, Julio, Jesus and Rodrigo to know and you to find out.
All right, you‰Ûªve made your point. A fine prank, very amusing. Now get it out.
No.
Yes.
No.
Yes.
No.
Yes.
I have three brothers and two sisters, Sheldon, I can do this all day.
All right, if you‰Ûªre not going to remove it, I‰Ûªll remove it for you.
Knock yourself out.
Help me move my desk.
No.
Yes.
No.
Yes.
No. It‰Ûªs too Brobdingnagian.
Why do you even want this here? Its size is completely disproportionate to its purpose.
Well, seeing as its purpose was to piss you off, I‰Ûªd say it‰Ûªs spot-on.
All right, I see what‰Ûªs going on. This is the opening salvo in what will be an escalating series of juvenile tit-for-tat exchanges. Well titted.
Thank you.
Stand by for my upcoming tat.
Hey, Sheldon?
Yes?
No. See what I did there? I turned it around.
The Cheesecake Factory
Sorry, I had to clock out.
Oh, no, that‰Ûªs okay. How have you been?
Okay. You know, busy, school, work. You?
Same. I took a scuba-diving course over the summer, but it turns out I‰Ûªm terrified of the ocean.
Too bad.
You wouldn‰Ûªt know anybody who wants to buy a wet suit, boy‰Ûªs large? Yeah, forget it. Not important. So, are you seeing anyone?
Well, to be honest, I‰Û_
Hey, how are we doing over here? Can I get you something to drink?
Not for me, thanks.
I‰Ûªm okay.
Are you gonna want to order food?
Maybe later.
Okay.
So, are you seeing anybody?
No.
That‰Ûªs what I told him when he asked me. I hope that‰Ûªs not out of line.
No, it‰Ûªs fine.
Penny, can we have a little privacy?
Oh. I‰Ûªm sorry.
What about you, have you been seeing anybody?
Well, you know how it is with guys. I mean, we have needs and‰Û_
So you‰Ûªve been seeing other girls?
Well, not real girls.
Does that mean slutty trolls?
You know, you look thirsty. I brought you some iced tea.
Thank you.
It‰Ûªs passion fruit, new on the menu.
Isn‰Ûªt there somewhere else you can be?
Not where I can hear you guys.

Okay, fine. I‰Ûªll admit, there are dark, sordid little corners of the Internet where the name Wolowizard is whispered in hushed tones. But the only reason I go there, the only reason I‰Ûªve ever gone there is because I don‰Ûªt have a real woman in my life. You happy?
Yeah, that‰Ûªll hold me for a while.
Howard, you did have a real woman. I was right there in the next room while you were clicking that troll‰Ûªs brains out.
Yeah, but we weren‰Ûªt, I-I mean, you and I never‰Û_
Had sex?
Yeah.
Well, whose fault was that?
Complimentary nachos! You enjoy. Never had sex? Wow.
What do you mean, whose fault was that?
Well, we could‰Ûªve been having sex, but you never made the move.
I didn‰Ûªt think you wanted me to make the move.
Howard, a girl doesn‰Ûªt go out with a man like you, with your looks, your fancy patter and your tight hoochie pants if she‰Ûªs not expecting him to eventually make the move.
Really?
Really.
Son of a bitch.
Hey, this is a little awkward, but my manager says I can‰Ûªt actually give nachos away. So, just take that when you‰Ûªre ready.
University corridor.
Yeah, we had a really great talk, and we‰Ûªre gonna start seeing each other again.
Oh, congratulations. Have you broken it to the troll yet?
Did Penny tell you about that?
No. Steve Patterson told me.
The greasy old fat guy in Facilities Management?
Yeah.
How‰Ûªd he know about it?
He‰Ûªs Glissinda the troll.
Sorry, dude, the thermostat‰Ûªs on my side of the room, so it stays Mumbai hot in here until you turn off that stupid Indian music!
I‰Ûªll turn off the music when you get rid of that salmonella-ridden parakeet!
Oh, too bad! Sheldon‰Ûªs pathologically afraid of birds! Hey, look, Sheldon! Birdie, birdie, birdie!
That‰Ûªs it! Prepare for marshmallow death!
Eat flaming Nerf! (Imitates gunfire)
So anyway, that‰Ûªs great news about you and Bernadette.
Yeah. I think I‰Ûªm gonna take her to miniature golf.
Ah. Well, I guess for you guys that‰Ûªs like regular golf.
Short jokes? Really? You‰Ûªre, like, a quarter of an inch taller than me.
Yeah, and don‰Ûªt you forget it.
Bernadette‰Ûªs car.
I had a good time.
Me, too.
Kiss her good night. All right, now a little tongue.
Hold on there. We‰Ûªve only just rekindled the romance. Let‰Ûªs not sully the moment with the exchange of saliva.
Don‰Ûªt listen to him. She wants it. Tongue. Luh-luh-luh-luh-luh. See? Now make the move.
Mm-mmm. Too soon.
Trust me, she‰Ûªs ready. Make the move.
No, no, no. A lady wants to be wooed, courted slowly.
How would you know?
I read.
Listen to me, Howard, it‰Ûªs time. Make the move, now.
Mm! What are you doing?
You said, well, the move, remember?
Oh, not now. We‰Ûªre starting a new relationship. I need to get to know you again.
No, you don‰Ûªt. It‰Ûªs me. The lusty charmer with the fancy patter and the hoochie pants.
Be patient, we‰Ûªll get there.
Told you.
University corridor.
Oh, God, what‰Ûªs that smell? (Knocks on Sheldon‰Ûªs door. Sheldon answers in a gas mask). Oh-ho-hoo!
Yes?
What are you doing in there?
I‰Ûªm making hydrogen sulphide and ammonia gas. Just a little experiment in pest control.
It‰Ûªs not gonna work, dude, I grew up in India, an entire subcontinent where cows walk in the street, and nobody has ever had a solid bowel movement.
Well, we‰Ûªll just see how long you can hold out.
Well, we‰Ûªll just see how your noxious gas fares against my cinnamon-apple-scented aroma therapy candles.
Didn‰Ûªt you say you‰Ûªre making hydrogen sulphide gas?
Yes.
Isn‰Ûªt that flammable?
Highly. Oh, dear. (Explosion)
This is not over.
The apartment.
All I‰Ûªm saying is, if they took all the money they spent trying to make a decent Hulk movie, they could probably just make an actual Hulk.
That is apt and amusing. I think I shall share that with Amy Farrah Fowler. She‰Ûªll appreciate the witticism.
Thank you.
It‰Ûªll also help improve her initial impression of you.
So what‰Ûªs going on with you two?
Well, the status is as it always was. She‰Ûªs a girl. She‰Ûªs a friend. She is not my, please forgive me for doing this, girlfriend.
Right, right. So you‰Ûªre still just texting and emailing? You don‰Ûªt feel any need to hang out with her, you know, be in the same room?

Leonard, you are my best friend. I‰Ûªve known you for seven years, and I can barely tolerate sitting on the couch with you. Imagine my attitude regarding prolonged physical proximity to Amy Farrah Fowler.
Got it.
I sense judgment on your part.
No, no. Maybe a little.
May I suggest that your criticism is based on jealousy.
Jealousy? What do I have to be jealous of?
I have a functioning and satisfying relationship with a female. You have none.
Oh, right. That.

Jealousy is an ugly green-eyed monster, not unlike the Hulk, who, by the way, also has a girlfriend. In this iteration, Jennifer Connelly, whom you may recall as the girlfriend of Russell Crowe in A Beautiful Mind, a feel-good romp if there ever was one.
I‰Ûªm not jealous.
Hu-u-urgh! Leonard not jealous.
The apartment.
You know, it just occurred to me, if there are an infinite number of parallel universes, in one of them, there‰Ûªs probably a Sheldon who doesn‰Ûªt believe parallel universes exist.
Probably. What‰Ûªs your point?
No point. It‰Ûªs just one of the things that makes one of the mes chuckle. What makes you chuckle, Leonard?
Hmm, recently? Not much.
Is it because of the conflict that arises from your desperate need to pair-bond with a woman, and the apparent collective decision of all womankind to deny you that opportunity?
Um, shut up.

You know, when my grandfather died, and Meemaw was alone, my mom arranged for her to visit a centre three times a week where she could socialize with other lonely people. It‰Ûªs very nice. They discuss current events, play bridge, get a hot meal.
That sounds lovely.
It is if you like bridge. Do you like bridge, Leonard?
Sheldon, I‰Ûªm just not dating someone right now. I don‰Ûªt need to go to a senior centre.
Meemaw resisted at first, but now she loves it.
Fine. If I don‰Ûªt meet someone soon, you can put me in a home.
It‰Ûªs not a home. It‰Ûªs a senior centre.åÊ We‰Ûªd never put Meemaw in a home!
The comic book store.
Hey, guys.
Hey.
Hey.
All right, I‰Ûªll bow to social pressure. Hey!
Excuse me. That‰Ûªs my girlfriend, Bernadette. I assigned her her own ringtone, Bernadette by The Four Tops. Hello, Bernadette.
When I call him, his phone plays Brown Eyed Girl. Which, now that I think about it, is not so good.
You realize he‰Ûªs just rubbing our noses in the fact that he has a girlfriend, and we don‰Ûªt.
You mean, you don‰Ûªt.
You have a girlfriend? How could you have a girlfriend? You can‰Ûªt even speak to women.
Two words, deaf chick. It doesn‰Ûªt matter if I can‰Ûªt talk, because she can‰Ûªt hear me.
What?
That‰Ûªs what she said.
Great. You have a girlfriend, Howard‰Ûªs got a girlfriend, Sheldon‰Ûªs got a girl‰Û_
No, no, no, no!
‰Û_who‰Ûªs a friend.
Thank you.
What about you, Stuart? You have a girlfriend yet?
Oh, yeah. Yeah. I met her at Comic-Con, the one place in the world where saying I own a comic bookstore is an actual pickup line.
Oh. Well, good for you.
Not really. She‰Ûªs horrible. When she wants to have sex, she puts on her plus-size Wonder Woman costume and shouts who wants to take a ride in my invisible plane?
Why don‰Ûªt you just break up with her?
No, no, I can‰Ûªt.
Why not?
‰Û÷Cause then I‰Ûªd be alone, like you.
Dude, why don‰Ûªt you just invoke your girlfriend pact with Wolowitz?
Because I don‰Ûªt need his girlfriend to set me up with one of her girlfriends. I‰Ûªm perfectly capable of finding a girl on my own.
Oh, Leonard, you remind me of the funny old story about a man who walks into a women‰Ûªs correctional institution with a stack of paperwork that will allow the female convicts to go free.
You‰Ûªre saying I couldn‰Ûªt get laid in a women‰Ûªs prison with a handful of pardons.
Are you going to let me tell the story or not?
The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
Leonard? Are you sleeping?
No.
Are you ill?
No.
Are you still depressed because you‰Ûªre alone, and no one loves you?
I don‰Ûªt know. Maybe.
I want you to know that I‰Ûªm genuinely concerned about your well-being.
Thank you.
You‰Ûªre welcome. But it‰Ûªs still no reason to have your feet in my spot.
May I offer an observation?
What the hell? How long has she been here?
Since we got home from the comic bookstore.
That was two hours ago.
As per your suggestion, we‰Ûªre hanging out. Quite frankly, I don‰Ûªt see what all the hoopla‰Ûªs about. Go on, Amy.
From a neurobiological standpoint, Leonard, you may be alone because your psychological state is causing an actual pheromone-based stink of desperation.
Did you know that, Leonard?
No.
I did.
I understand that some people find mates in social gathering places such as bars or taverns. Have you tried a bar or tavern?
No, I‰Ûªm not gonna try to pick up a woman in a bar.

Wise decision. You see, Amy, success at a bar is based on classic male attributes such as height, strength, attractiveness, the ability to hold one‰Ûªs liquor and throw darts, separately or together. Leonard has none of these attributes, right, Leonard?
Right.
That‰Ûªs not true of all bars. Juice bars, for example.
Oh! Good point, Amy. Yeah, building on your premise, Leonard could frequent sushi bars, salad bars, oyster bars, the Apple Genius Bar, what are you doing?
Keep going. I‰Ûªm listening.
That was rude.
He does it all the time. He‰Ûªs a cornucopia of social awkwardness.
Cornucopia. What a mellifluous word.
Let‰Ûªs make that our word of the day.
Agreed. And we‰Ûªll use mellifluous tomorrow.
Well, I have to void my bladder. It was nice spending this time with you.
Wait. I have a request.
Yes?
I‰Ûªd like you to meet my mother.
I see. Can I get back to you on that?
Certainly. Good night.
Good night. (Closing laptop, and running down stairs in panic) Leonard, Leonard, Leonard,
Yeah, what?
Amy Farrah Fowler has asked me to meet her mother.
Yeah. So?
What does that mean?
Well, you know how you‰Ûªre always saying that Amy is a girl who‰Ûªs your friend, and not your girlfriend?
Uh-huh.
You can‰Ûªt say that anymore.
Wait. What?
Look, she obviously wants to take your relationship to the next level.
I don‰Ûªt want the next level. I like this level. Fix it for me!
Me? Well, how am I supposed to fix it?
Simple! You want a girlfriend, Amy wants to be someone‰Ûªs girlfriend. Take her off my hands. I give you my blessing.
That is insane.
You‰Ûªre right. It would never work. Amy finds you tedious.
Okay, good luck.
Wait! What am I supposed to do?
Well, have you considered telling her how you feel?
Leonard, I‰Ûªm a physicist, not a hippie.
All right, well, let me see if I can explain your situation using physics. What would you be if you were attached to another object by an inclined plane wrapped helically around an axis?
Screwed.
There you go.
Amy‰Ûªs right. He is tedious.
Outside Howard‰Ûªs house. Leonard rings bell.
Howard, get the door!
Why can‰Ûªt you get it?
You know I‰Ûªm doing a bowel cleanse for my colonoscopy! I‰Ûªm like an upside-down volcano here.
Oh, hey. I hope you didn‰Ûªt hear that.
The volcano thing? No.
What‰Ûªs with the T-shirt? You working at the Apple store now?
No, it‰Ûªs just something I threw on.
I know all your shirts. That‰Ûªs not one of them. You were pretending to work at the Genius Bar to pick up women, weren‰Ûªt you?
Yeah. Turns out, they guard the iPods, but they don‰Ûªt guard the shirts.
So, how‰Ûªd it go?
It was going well. I was showing this super hot girl how to boot up in Safe Mode. The manager got suspicious, and, well, long story short, they really do have a little jail in the mall.
Just FYI, don‰Ûªt try to go back with a fake moustache. I mean, they may not really be geniuses, but they see right through that.
I want to invoke the girlfriend pact, Howard.
You that desperate?
No, I just, I want what you have. You know, I want a woman in my life.
Holy Moses, how much liquid can be in one tukus?
To be clear, I meant like Bernadette, not your mother.
Yeah, I know what you mean.
The apartment.
Well, I‰Ûªm off to meet Bernadette‰Ûªs friend. How do I look?
As if one of the plants from Invasion of the Body Snatchers duplicated you in every way, only with an absurd amount of hair gel.
What are you working on?
I‰Ûªm removing my digital footprint from the Internet so Amy Farrah Fowler can‰Ûªt find me and compel me to meet her mother.
Ah, you‰Ûªre going off the grid.
Exactly.
The old Unabomber approach. Kudos.
Thank you. I‰Ûªve also sent Amy a relationship termination notice and changed my cell phone number and e-mail address.
What if she just comes over?
She‰Ûªll get lost. We no longer live at 2311 Los Robles. We now live at 311 Los Robles.
You changed the address on the building? What about mail?
Oh, no worries, I explained my predicament to our letter carrier. He was sympathetic. His exact words were, Got your back, Jack. Bitches be crazy.

character: Leonard (there is a knock on the door)
line: Who is it?
Amy Farrah Fowler.
Darn! She found me!
She‰Ûªs been here before.
The only flaw in an otherwise perfect plan. Now, get my back, Jack.
What do you want to do?
Tell her I‰Ûªm not here.
Okay, where are you?
I don‰Ûªt know. You‰Ûªll have to devise a scenario that plausibly explains my absence, keeping in mind that the key to a good lie lies in the details.
Hi, Amy. Sheldon‰Ûªs not here.
All right. (Leaves)
Way to go on the details.
A restaurant.
Thanks again for doing this, Bernadette.

Oh, I take pacts very seriously. One time at my lab, a petri dish of genetically modified super-virus went missing. That day we made a pinky swear never to admit we crossed Ebola with the common cold.
Why the hell would you cross Ebola with the common cold?
We never did. That would be a terrible, terrible thing.
Hi. Sorry I‰Ûªm late, I was at the gym. Spin class. Worked up quite a sweat.
Joy, this is Leonard. Leonard, this is Joy.
Hi.
Hi. You don‰Ûªt look like a genius. Go ahead, say something smart.
Uh‰Û_
Aah! Time‰Ûªs up. Just kidding. First thing you need to know about me, I‰Ûªm hilarious.
Yeah. So, Bernadette tells me she knows you from self-defence classes?
Yeah. Israeli Krav Maga. Lots of fun. Basically, a hundred different ways to rip a guy‰Ûªs nuts off.
Wow. Wouldn‰Ûªt think there‰Ûªd be that many.
Number 42!
Whoa!
Isn‰Ûªt she a pip?
The stairwell.

character: Sheldon (rhythmically, while walking down the stairs)
line: Proxima Centauri‰Ûªs the nearest star. The celestial bodies that follow are Alpha Centauri A, Toli, Barnard‰Ûªs Star, Wolf 359, Lalande 21185, Sirius A, Sirius B, BL-Ceti, UV-Ceti, Ross 154, Ross 248, Epsilon Eridani, Lac-9352, Ross 128, Procyon A, oh, darn, that‰Ûªs wrong! (Heads back up stairs) EZ Aquarii A, EZ Aquarii B, EZ Aquarii C, Procyon A. Those are the stars that are nearest to me. Tra-la-la and fiddle-dee-dee. (Sees Amy standing in lobby) Oh, dear. They really do be crazy.
The restaurant.
This lobster‰Ûªs good on the way down and the way up.
Should be, it‰Ûªs thirty dollars a pound.
Hey, this is a date, right?
Yep, it is.
Whoa!
Excuse me, I have to go to the little girls‰Ûª room and take a wicked whiz.
I‰Ûªll go with you.
Fair warning, I had the asparagus. My pee is gonna stink up the place.
I think she likes you.
The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.

character: Sheldon (wearing a heavy coat and false nose and glasses)
line: EZ Aquarii B, EZ Aquarii C, excuse me, madam.
Sheldon?
Rats!
I believe a misunderstanding may have occurred when I asked you to meet my mother.
No misunderstanding. I‰Ûªve learned what that request actually means, and I don‰Ûªt want to be joined to another object by an inclined plane wrapped helically around an axis.
In what way are you screwed? All I want to do is present you as my boyfriend to my mother so she‰Ûªll be satisfied that I‰Ûªm in a relationship.
So we‰Ûªd be perpetrating a ruse?
Precisely.
And you haven‰Ûªt fallen hopelessly in love with me?
Don‰Ûªt be absurd. I find the notion of romantic love to be an unnecessary cultural construct that adds no value to human relationships.
Amy Farrah Fowler, that‰Ûªs the most pragmatic thing anyone has ever said to me.
I trust this clarification allows us to return to boy-slash-friend-slash-girl-slash-friend status.
Of course. Would you like to join me for Chinese food?
Sheldon, please, you‰Ûªre suffocating me.
My apologies. Good night, Amy.
Good night, Sheldon.
The restaurant.
Come on, just give her a chance. Maybe she‰Ûªll grow on you.
Or maybe she‰Ûªll finally succeed in ripping my nuts off. There are still 93 ways she hasn‰Ûªt tried yet. Look, Howard, I appreciate the effort, but this is, like, the worst date of my life.
Seriously? I was once robbed by a pre-op transsexual I met on J-Date, and that didn‰Ûªt even crack my top ten.
I guess the difference is, I have some self-respect.
Not that I‰Ûªve ever seen.
It‰Ûªs relatively new. I just know that I‰Ûªm not gonna spend time with someone I don‰Ûªt like simply to have a girlfriend. I‰Ûªm okay on my own.
Good news, I made lots of room for dessert.
Look, uh, Joy, it was nice to meet you, but‰Û_
Yeah, you, too. Hey, you got anything for next weekend? I need a date for my cousin‰Ûªs wedding.
You‰Ûªre asking me out?
Yeah. And it‰Ûªs an open bar, so I‰Ûªll probably be giving it away.
I look forward to it.
The apartment.
It‰Ûªs nice to meet you, too, Sheldon. I honestly didn‰Ûªt believe Amy when she told me she had a boyfriend.
I assure you I am quite real and I‰Ûªm having regular intercourse with your daughter.
What?
Oh, yes. We‰Ûªre like wild animals in heat. It‰Ûªs a wonder neither of us has been hurt.
Amy, what is he saying?
You wanted me to have a boyfriend, Mother. Well, here he is. Have to sign off now. My hunger for Sheldon is stirring in my loins.
Oh, yes, it‰Ûªs time for me to make love to your daughter‰Ûªs vagina.
Oh!
Thank you, Sheldon, that went very well.
Agreed. Amy, I find myself wondering if we should actually engage in coitus at least one time in our relationship. Bazinga. Bedtime. Please show yourself out.
The university cafeteria.
Gagh!
Problem?
This is the worst cobbler I‰Ûªve ever eaten. I mean it tastes like it was made of actual ground-up shoemaker.
Amusing. A play on the two meanings of cobbler.
Hey guys, guess who I found at LAX. My baby sister Priya.
Excuse me. I object. You propose a guessing game, yet you don‰Ûªt give me enough time to guess. For the record, I was going to say your sister Priya.
Oh, Sheldon. You haven‰Ûªt changed a bit, have you?
Why would I change?
The hope has been that you‰Ûªd eventually bend to public opinion. So, Priya, what brings you back to LA?
I have a one day layover on my way to Toronto. Corporate merger.
Can you believe it? Little Priya‰Ûªs one of the lead attorneys for the biggest car company in India.
Given that when we met her she was finishing law school and planning an internship at a large Indian car company, it‰Ûªs actually extremely plausible.
And your poll numbers just keep dropping.
I want to catch up with all of you, but first I really must visit the loo.
I‰Ûªm going too, I‰Ûªll show you where it is.
Alright, this goes without saying, but I‰Ûªm just going to say it anyway. Hands off my sister.
Why would I touch her, she‰Ûªs covered with airplane germs.
I‰Ûªm so not talking to you. I‰Ûªm talking to him.
Hey, I‰Ûªve got a girlfriend now.
Oh please. My sister‰Ûªs much hotter than your girlfriend and you know it.
Let‰Ûªs just agree they‰Ûªre both hot.
Dude, that‰Ûªs my sister you‰Ûªre talking about.
Okay, forget who‰Ûªs hotter. The first time Priya came to LA, Leonard and I made a pact out of respect to our friendship, and to you, that neither of us would hit on her.
Did you pinky swear?
Yes.
Okay then.
Cobbler. I‰Ûªm still laughing.
A corridor.
It‰Ûªs really nice to see you again Leonard.
Yeah. It‰Ûªs good to see you too. Here you go.
Thanks. (Grabs him and kisses him.)
Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa. (Looks around.) Okay.
The cafeteria.
So, you got any special plans with your sister?
Oh, not really, just hang out.
I always tell people, if you have only one day in Los Angeles, make it a train day.
Train day?

The fun starts with brunch at Carney‰Ûªs in Studio City, a hot dog stand in a converted railroad dining car. Next stop, Travel Town, an outdoor museum featuring 43 railroad engines, cars and other rolling stock from the 1880s to the 1930s. Finally, we‰Ûªre off to the glitz and glamour of Hollywood for dinner at, that‰Ûªs right, the Hollywood Carney‰Ûªs, a hot dog stand in a different converted railroad dining car.
I don‰Ûªt think we‰Ûªre going to do that.
Well then apparently, you hate fun.
Hmm, Priya‰Ûªs not back yet? Well, I guess that‰Ûªs not unusual, women, men, the whole sitting, standing deal, so, what are we talking about?
Uh, my plans with Priya.
He rejected train day.
Did you make it clear that it‰Ûªs two different train cars turned into hot dog stands?
Abundantly.
I guess he just hates fun.
That‰Ûªs what I said.
Okay, so, what‰Ûªs new with you guys.
I have a girlfriend now.
Hey, good for you.
Yeah, I just wanna put it out there in case I inadvertently squirt any pheromones in your direction. Happy? (Raj nods).
So, uh, Priya, what are your plans while you‰Ûªre here.
I don‰Ûªt know, I just have the one day.
Do you like trains?
Not particularly.
You might as well just wait at the airport for your flight.
The apartment. Sheldon is on his laptop.
You are in a forest. There is quicksand to the west, a path leads to the east. Go east. An iron gate blocks your way. Open gate. It‰Ûªs locked. Hmm, well, so much for that.
It‰Ûªs getting pretty late, how come you‰Ûªre still up?
I‰Ûªve found an emulator online that lets you play classic text based computer games from the 1980s.
That‰Ûªs pretty cool.
Oh yes. It runs on the world‰Ûªs most powerful graphics chip, imagination.
You‰Ûªve really got to get out more.

Go north. You can‰Ûªt go that way. Go west. A troll blocks your passage. Okay, fasten your seatbelts, kill troll. With what? With sword. (There is a knock on the door.) You don‰Ûªt have the sword. Good golly, it‰Ûªs as if it‰Ûªs actually happening to me.
Raj finally went to bed.
Yeah, well, (kissing her) Sheldon‰Ûªs still up.
You said he goes to bed at nine.
Yeah, he does but he got caught up in a computer game and‰Û_
Hit troll with axe. Hit troll with axe. Hit troll with axe. Oh my, this is one tough troll.
Can‰Ûªt you get rid of him?
If the past is any indication, no.
Leonard, I‰Ûªm trapped in quicksand, the axe is dragging me down.
Drop axe.
Drop axe. Brilliant.
Give me a minute. Sheldon,
Hold on. I have to figure out how to get the bucket, so I can carry the mud past the dragon.
Sheldon, you need to work in the morning.
I know.
Well then, bed mister.
Five more minutes.
Really? You‰Ûªre going to risk getting sleepy in the middle of your thermodynamic fluctuations seminar? You know what happens when you yawn in public.
Everyone will see my oddly shaped uvula.
You don‰Ûªt want that, do you?
No. But it‰Ûªs a shame our society mocks the differently uvulated. Who was at the door?
Oh, uh, building manager. They have to fix a pipe so the water will be off tomorrow from noon to two.
That‰Ûªs unacceptable. We‰Ûªre supposed to be given written notice.
No, no, it doesn‰Ûªt matter, we‰Ûªll be at work.
Well, what if I spill tomato soup on my shirt and have to come home to change, only to find there‰Ûªs no water for an enzyme soak.
Bifurcated uvula, Sheldon!
I‰Ûªll have the chicken noodle. Goodnight.
We‰Ûªre going to have to be very quiet.

I know how to get the bucket! I can turn the axe around and use the handle to reach it. Let‰Ûªs see. Go north. You are in a forest. Go north. You are in a forest. Go north. You are in a forest. Oh dear, I believe I‰Ûªm lost. Well, I‰Ûªll just have to get a fresh start tomorrow.
No, no, no, no, no. You just need, you just need, you just need to map it out. Come on, I‰Ûªll help you. So, uh, you stopped at the stream and you turned north three times?
Yes.
You‰Ûªre right, you‰Ûªre lost, good luck.
Leonard‰Ûªs bedroom. Morning.
Oh! Leonard, wake up.
Huh! Sorry!
For what?
I don‰Ûªt know. When I‰Ûªm in bed with a girl, it‰Ûªs just, it‰Ûªs my go to response.
It‰Ûªs six o‰Ûª clock, I have to get back to Raj‰Ûªs before he wakes up and realises I‰Ûªm gone.
Oh, right, sure. I wish you could stay in LA a while longer.
Mmm. Me too.
You know, I was thinking, there are some great research facilities in India.
Where are you going with this, Leonard?
Well, I‰Ûªm just saying, I don‰Ûªt have any real ties here, so if I were to move to New Delhi we could, you know, go out.
Leonard, didn‰Ûªt we have this conversation five years ago.
Well, yes, but, things have changed, you know, you‰Ûªre older, I‰Ûªm older. Look, no more superhero bedsheets.
Sweetheart, just because we have fun when I come to town doesn‰Ûªt mean I want to have a serious relationship.
It doesn‰Ûªt?
Mm-mm. And besides, I could never bring a white boy home to my parents. They‰Ûªd have a cow. Which is a much bigger deal in India.
I‰Ûªm not that white. My great-great grandmother was half Cherokee. I know that‰Ûªs not the right kind of Indian but it is something.
Aha, you‰Ûªre funny.
(Knock, knock, knock) Leonard. (Knock, knock, knock) Leonard. (Knock, knock, knock) Leonard.
What?
I heard a woman laughing.
Oh, uh, yeah, I was trying to see if I could laugh as a woman.
Oh. Well, good job, quite convincing. I smell perfume.
Air freshener.
And is that lipstick on your cheek and neck.
Uh, rash, that‰Ûªs a bad rash.
My sympathies. I am no stranger to the crimson scourge that is dermatitis. Can I interest you in a topical steroid from my lotion and unguent collection?
Uh, yeah, yeah, that sounds great.
Very well, I‰Ûªm sure I can find something that will help you ditch that itch.
Okay, he‰Ûªs in the bathroom, let‰Ûªs go.
Do you prefer ointment or cream?
Uh, cream.
With or without a numbing agent?
Without.
Really? Leonard, there are no heroes when it comes to dermatitis.
Fine. With.
Prescription or non-prescription strength.
Use your best judgement.
Well, I think I have a nice 2009 AnaMantle HC. It‰Ûªs usually indicated for acutely inflamed haemorrhoids, but it also goes nicely with non mucosal body parts.
Sounds great.
Excellent choice.
Right, right, alright. (They creep almost to the apartment door.)
Priya?
Good morning, Sheldon.
For shame, Leonard. For shame. And to think I was ready to waste the last of my good haemorrhoid cream on you.
Leonard‰Ûªs car.
Making pretty good time, huh?
Is that really what you want to talk about, Leonard?
No.
What do you want to talk about?
Please don‰Ûªt tell anyone I spent the night with Raj‰Ûªs sister.
There it is. What if someone asks?
No-one‰Ûªs going to ask if I spent the night with Raj‰Ûªs sister.
Perhaps. But they might ask me something else.
Like what?
Like, has Leonard betrayed any of his friends recently?
Priya and I are both adults. We didn‰Ûªt betray Raj.
In fact, you did, but I was referring to Howard.
What are you talking about?

April 12th, 2005, Bob‰Ûªs Big Boy, Toluca Lake. Raj had just introduced us to Priya for the first time, and she was enjoying the sweet taste of Hindu rebellion in the form of a Bob‰Ûªs Super Big Boy hamburger. In order to preserve your friendship, you and Howard made a pinky swear that neither of you would attempt to woo her. I had a patty melt.
Okay, fine, I betrayed Howard.
And Raj.
Alright, and Raj.
And me.
You?
Violation of the roommate agreement, overnight guest notification clause.
Okay fine, I‰Ûªm, I‰Ûªm a horrible human being, I‰Ûªm the Darth Vader of Pasadena.
You‰Ûªre far too short to be Darth Vader. At best you might be a turncoat Ewok.
My point is, Priya‰Ûªs gone. And it would be much better if no-one else found out about this.
You mean, you want me to keep a secret.
Yes.
You know I can‰Ûªt keep a secret.
You can if you try. Think about it this way, if I were Batman and you were Alfred, you‰Ûªd keep that secret. Right?
Why do you get to be Batman?
Because, well, Batman has the secret.
Well Alfred has secrets too.
Like what?
Alfred knows that Barbara Gordon is Batgirl. Which I‰Ûªve now just told to Batman. See, I can‰Ûªt keep a secret.
Leonard‰Ûªs lab.
Ta-da!
What.
Ta-da. It‰Ûªs short for da-da-da-da!
Kind of busy here, Sheldon.
I know, that‰Ûªs why I shortened it.
What do you want.
I came to go over your alibi for last night.
What alibi?

You‰Ûªve asked me to lie on your behalf, and as you know, I am deeply uncomfortable with impromptu dishonest, so I‰Ûªve provided you with an iron clad alibi. You couldn‰Ûªt have spent last night with Priya, because you were with another woman.
Oh, I‰Ûªm so sure I‰Ûªm going to regret this, but, who was I with?
The fun loving, and morally loose, Miss Maggie McGeary.
Oh, God.
You met her at Pasadena‰Ûªs most popular Irish watering hole, Lucky Baldwin‰Ûªs, where Maggie spends her nights tending bar, with a head full of curls and a heart full of dreams.

character: Leonard (reading a napkin Sheldon has handed him)
line: Leonard, call me if you‰Ûªre interested in coitus. Sincerely, Maggie McGeary.
And if anyone were to actually call that number they will hear this.
Top of the morning to you. You‰Ûªve reached Maggie McGeary. Leave a message after the wee little beep.
It‰Ûªs pretty convincing, huh? And it wasn‰Ûªt even a real person. And here is the clincher. A lock of Maggie‰Ûªs flaming auburn hair.
Where did you get that?
From an orang-u-tan in the primate lab.
An orang-u-tan?
Well, no-one‰Ûªs going to run a DNA test on it, Leonard, honestly you over-think everything.

Sheldon, I don‰Ûªt need an alibi. Nobody‰Ûªs going to ask about last night as long as you just zip your lip. (Sheldon makes lip zipping movement.) Thankyou. Now don‰Ûªt worry, everything is going to be fine. (Sheldon writes ‰ÛÏI doubt it‰Û on Leonard‰Ûªs whiteboard.
The cafeteria.
Hey.
Hey, Leonard, will you please tell Howard my sister‰Ûªs never been attracted to him.
C‰Ûªmon Raj, how am I supposed to know who she‰Ûªs attracted to. Or was attracted to. Or who she might be attracted to. In the future.
And I have nothing to contribute to this conversation. Because I too know absolutely nothing about Priya‰Ûªs preferences in male companionship. And with that, I will re-zip my lip.
Hey, so what did you guys think of the new episode of Caprica last night?
I didn‰Ûªt see it.
Didn‰Ûªt see it? What were you doing?
Uh, I was out.
On Caprica night?
Yeah, I, uh, went for a drink.
Really, you, and where, where did you go?
To, uh, Lucky Baldwin‰Ûªs.
Oh, I‰Ûªve heard of that place, isn‰Ûªt that Pasadena‰Ûªs favourite Irish watering hole.
Yes.
Did you meet anyone interesting there, perhaps a promiscuous redheaded barmaid?
As a matter of fact I.. I‰Û_ I can‰Ûªt‰Û_ I can‰Ûªt‰Û_ I can‰Ûªt do it.
Sure you can, you‰Ûªre doing fine, it‰Ûªs very believable.
Look, I‰Ûªm sorry Raj, but the truth is I was with Priya last night.
Don‰Ûªt listen to him, he‰Ûªs still light headed from all the Irish whiskey and pickled eggs in his system.
What were you doing with Priya?
I believe they engaged in coitus but, more importantly, if Leonard had not abandoned his story, would you have found it plausible?
What? You slept with my sister?
Yeah.
How could you? We had a pact!
Excuse me, I think how could you she‰Ûªs my sister takes precedence over a five year old pinky swear!
May I point out, in a parallel universe, your friends are saying Maggie McGeary, she sounds lovely.
Look, I admit it, I may have crossed a line here, but come on, Raj, your sister is a grown woman. To her, I‰Ûªm a forbidden piece of white chocolate.
I‰Û_ I don‰Ûªt believe it, this is a terrible betrayal of my trust.
No, no, no, would it help if I told you that I offered her my heart and she kind of stomped on it.
How hard did she stomp?
Very hard.
Okay, I‰Ûªm good.
Yeah, well, Raj, I just want to say that I‰Ûªd never betray your trust. Unlike Leonard, I respect you.
Really?
Mmm.
Was it out of respect that you didn‰Ûªt tell Raj about the time you dropped his iPhone in a urinal?
Dude! I put that thing on my face!
I think a more amusing violation of Raj‰Ûªs trust is when Howard convinced him that foreigners give presents to Americans on Thanksgiving.
Hey, I didn‰Ûªt see you giving back your Snoopy snowcone maker.
That was all a lie? This year‰Ûªs gifts are already wrapped!
And as long as we‰Ûªre talking about betraying our friends, how about the month Sheldon spent grinding up insects and mixing them into Leonard‰Ûªs food.
Well, excuse me. That was not a betrayal, that was an experiment to determine at what concentration food starts tasting mothy.
You put moths in my food?
For science.
I can‰Ûªt believe you kissed my sister with moth mouth.
Well, uh, I can‰Ûªt believe you used Sheldon‰Ûªs toothbrush.
You used my toothbrush?
Not the brush part, just the little rubber thing to pick food from my teeth and massage my gums.

Okay, I, I, I think it‰Ûªs safe to say that we‰Ûªve all done some things we‰Ûªre not particularly proud of. But come on, we‰Ûªre friends. Friends overlook each other‰Ûªs minor lapses. For the record, Howard, I‰Ûªm sorry that I broke our pact.
Thankyou, and I‰Ûªm sorry about your phone. And Thanksgiving. And while we‰Ûªre at it, you don‰Ûªt have to wash our clothes on the fourth of July.
As long as we‰Ûªre apologising, Sheldon, I, I‰Ûªm sorry I used your toothbrush.
And I‰Ûªm sorry. But that behaviour is beyond the pale and cannot be tolerated. We are no longer friends.
I got you a talking Thomas the Tank Engine for Thanksgiving.
With real puffing smoke?
Yes.
Alright. But I‰Ûªm watching you.
The apartment. Sheldon is making snowcones.
Hey, you got Snoopy out. Can I have a snowcone?
Well, sure.
These are pretty god, what flavour is this?
Guess.
Papaya?
No.
Guava?
You‰Ûªre so close.
I give up.
Mango, caterpillar. What are you doing? You said you liked it!
The University Cafeteria.
No, seriously, I think I‰Ûªve finally figured out my problem with women.
The capybara is the largest member of the rodent family.
What does that have to do with me and women?
Nothing. It was a desperate attempt to introduce an alternate topic of conversation.

My problem is, I don‰Ûªt project confidence. So I decided that the next time I meet a woman I think is attractive, rather than holding back and being cautious, I‰Ûªm going to assume the mantle of self-assurance.
Oh, yeah? What‰Ûªs that look like?
Hi. I‰Ûªm Leonard. And you are beautiful. You pop, sparkle and buzz electric. I‰Ûªm going to pick you up at eight, show you a night you will never forget.
Where are we going?
Good news. I made it onto the team for the new Defence Department laser-equipped surveillance satellite.
Excuse me. If we‰Ûªre changing topics, I believe I have first dibs with capybara, a rodent the size of a baby hippo.
Congratulations Howard.
Thanks. Listen, I have to get a security clearance, so you guys might be hearing from the FBI.
Whoa, whoa, whoa! I don‰Ûªt want to speak to the FBI.
Why not?
I‰Ûªm brown and I talk funny.
They‰Ûªre just doing a background check on me.
It doesn‰Ûªt matter. They‰Ûªll find a reason to give me a one-way ticket back to Gandhi-ville. By the way, when I say that, it‰Ûªs not offensive.
Don‰Ûªt be ridiculous, Raj. You‰Ûªre here legally.
Nobody cares. Do you know how long it‰Ûªs been since I got through airport security without being given a colonoscopy?
You know, I try very hard to make our lunch hours educational and informative, but your insistence on talking about your own lives stymies me at every turn.
Fine, Sheldon, tell us about your giant rodents.
No, you squandered your time with me, and the moment has now passed. Feast on your disappointment, much as the capybara feasts on its own waste.
Raj‰Ûªs apartment. Raj is reading New Moon.
Oh, Bella, don‰Ûªt you see? Edward‰Ûªs only pushing you away because he loves you. (Knock on door) Coming.

Dr. Koothrappali? (Raj nods) I‰Ûªm Special Agent Page, FBI. May I come in? (Nods again) I‰Ûªd like to talk to you about Howard Wolowitz. (Indicates sofa) Oh, thank you. All right. Well, how long have you known Mr. Wolowitz?

character: Raj (Holds up finger to indicate he will be right back. Runs to kitchen. Tries to drink wine but bottle is empty. Looks in fridge and finds rum cake. Comes back stuffing a piece in his mouth)
line: Rum cake?
No, thanks. Now, about Mr. Wolowitz.
Seven years.
I see.
I‰Ûªm in this country legally, you know.
I‰Ûªm sure you are. Now, to your knowledge, has Mr. Wolowitz ever committed a crime?
Of course not. I‰Ûªm here on an H-1B visa, which means I can‰Ûªt be associated in any way with crime or criminal activity. And I‰Ûªm not.
Good. To your knowledge, does Mr. Wolowitz have any foreign contacts?
No, just me. Oh, there it is. Here comes a cavity search.
Excuse me?
Please don‰Ûªt send me back to India, it‰Ûªs so crowded. It‰Ûªs like the whole country is one endless Comic-Con, except everybody‰Ûªs wearing the same costume, Indian Guy.
Dr. Koothrappali, I‰Ûªm not‰Û_
I love this country! The-the baseball, the freedom, the rampant morbid obesity! From California to the New York Island, I‰Ûªm a real Yankee Doodle boy!
Dr. Koothrappali, please.
My country ‰Ûªtis of thee, duh duh duh liberty, It‰Ûªs really great.
Leonard‰Ûªs lab.
So, when Howard said the FBI would be contacting me, I was expecting Mulder. Glad to see I got Scully.
Who?
Mulder and Scully. X-Files. The truth is out there. Never mind. Uh, so, what would you like to know?
You work with Mr. Wolowitz here at the university, correct?

Yes. Of course, we‰Ûªre in different departments. He‰Ûªs an engineer and I‰Ûªm an experimental physicist. You know, one of those guys who examines the building blocks of creation and says, Hello, maker of the universe, I see what you did there. Good one.
Right. Now, how would you characterize your relationship with Mr. Wolowitz?
Good. It‰Ûªs a good relationship. Of course, most of my relationships are good. Probably because I exude confidence. People are drawn to that, you know? Confidence, not exuding.
Do you know of any groups Mr. Wolowitz is a member of?
You are beautiful, you know that? You pop, sparkle and buzz electric. I‰Ûªm going to pick you up at eight, show you a night you will never forget.
Sounds great.
Really?
Yeah. Can my six-foot-two Navy SEAL husband come with us?
Is that, oh, my, I didn‰Ûªt see the ring with my glasses off, so, look at that, I‰Ûªm starting to exude.
The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
Want to get that?
Not particularly.
Could you get that?
I suppose I could if I were asked.
Would you please get that?
Of course. Why do you have to make things so complicated?
Dr. Cooper?
Yes.
I‰Ûªm Special Agent Page, FBI.
You say you‰Ûªre Special Agent Page, FBI.
Here‰Ûªs my I.D.
And here is my Justice League membership card. But that doesn‰Ûªt prove I know Batman.
I just want to ask you a few questions about Howard Wolowitz.
Oh. All right. I doubt anyone would risk the stiff penalties for impersonating a federal officer just to ask questions about a minor league engineer with an unresolved Oedipal complex.
Thank you.
For the record, I truly support the FBI in the mission which is expressed through their motto?
Fidelity, bravery, integrity?

Correct. Now to business. 18 years ago, I sent the FBI Crime Lab samples from a bag of excrement that had been lit on fire on my front porch for fingerprinting and DNA analysis. Why haven‰Ûªt I heard back yet?
Well, the FBI Crime Lab does have a lot on its plate.
That‰Ûªs of little comfort to a nation attempting to scrape burning feces off its shoes.
Would you mind if we talked about Mr. Wolowitz now?
A little, but go on.
Thank you. Would you characterize him as responsible?

I‰Ûªm going to answer that with a visual aid. This is my nine-disc complete Lord of the Rings trilogy blu-ray set.åÊ Mr. Wolowitz borrowed it, damaged plastic retention hub number three, and then returned it to me, hoping I wouldn‰Ûªt notice. Would you characterize that as responsible?
That‰Ûªs really not the sort of thing we‰Ûªre interested in.
You heard me say blu-ray, right?
I did.
Very well. Would you be interested in knowing that Mr. Wolowitz once snuck onto my World of Warcraft account and changed the name of a certain level-80 warlock from Sheldor to Smeldor?
I‰Ûªm afraid not. Is there anything else?

Is there anything else? Where would you like to start? He refuses to pay fines when he‰Ûªs overdue with books I lend him. He crashed the Mars Rover while attempting to impress a woman. He recommended that I go see the third Matrix movie because it was, and I quote, just as good as the first one. If that‰Ûªs not irresponsible, I don‰Ûªt know what is.
The Mars Rover?
Did I say Mars Rover?
You did.
That was actually a poorly chosen example, as it had nothing to do with me.
Yes, well, let‰Ûªs talk about it anyway.

I don‰Ûªt want to. Not that my disinclination to discuss the topic should be interpreted as evidence of Howard Wolowitz‰Ûªs culpability in the destruction of government property worth millions of dollars.
Thank you, Dr. Cooper. I think I have all I need.
Oh, good. I was afraid you were going to fixate on that Mars Rover incident.
The cafeteria.
Hey, buddies. Guess who didn‰Ûªt get security clearance to work on the giant space laser?
What happened?
Apparently, the background interviews didn‰Ûªt go well. You guys wouldn‰Ûªt know anything about that, would you?
Well, actually, I may have gotten a little tipsy when I talked to her.
And I may have hit on her a little bit.
I may have thrown up rum cake on her shoes.
I see. Well, it‰Ûªs good to know, when I need you guys, I can always count on you to step up and ruin everything.
I feel awful.
Ah, me, too.
To tell you the truth, I thought if anyone was going to screw things up for Howard, it‰Ûªd be Sheldon.
Well, your expectations have been subverted. Aha.
The apartment.
What are you doing up?
Sleep eludes me, Leonard.
Really? Maybe sleep has met you before.
Mockery? That‰Ûªs all you have to offer?
I‰Ûªm sorry. Why can‰Ûªt you sleep?

Who knows? I haven‰Ûªt watched any scary movies recently. I‰Ûªm no longer obsessing over why the predicted mass of the quantum vacuum has little effect on the expansion of the universe. And it‰Ûªs been weeks since I took that accidental sip of Red Bull.
Did something happen today that‰Ûªs bothering you?
Well, I did mention the Mars Rover incident to that FBI agent and probably cost Howard his security clearance.
What?
But why should that keep me up?
Because you feel guilty?
Interesting. So you‰Ûªre saying my insomnia is caused by a guilty conscience.
Actually, you don‰Ûªt have insomnia. You‰Ûªre sleeping now.
Excuse me?
You‰Ûªre having a guilt-ridden dream.
Do you have any evidence to support that hypothesis?
How about that Gorn sitting on the couch?
That seems fairly conclusive. (In his bed) No, Gorn, no. That‰Ûªs where I sit.
Agent Page‰Ûªs Office.
Thank you for agreeing to see me, Agent Page.
Thank you for filing a complaint with my superior, Dr. Cooper. I understand you want to recant your statement about Howard Wolowitz.
Yes.
Was your statement untrue?
No.
Then I‰Ûªm afraid you can‰Ûªt withdraw it.
I‰Ûªm sorry. I don‰Ûªt recall you saying no backsies.
Is there anything else?

Yes. I‰Ûªd like to offer a laudatory statement about Howard‰Ûªs many excellent qualities that I believe will tip the scales back in his favour. Howard Joel Wolowitz. H is for honesty, of which he has much. O‰Ûªs for outstanding, which he is such. W‰Ûªs for witty, he‰Ûªs quick with a joke. A‰Ûªs for artistic, his ability‰Û_
I‰Ûªm sorry, Dr. Cooper, this matter is already closed.
But I still have rd Joel Wolowitz left to go.
It‰Ûªs closed.

I don‰Ûªt understand why you people are picking on my friend, Howard, when there are much more serious security threats to pursue. For instance, when I first met Leonard, he was on the verge of giving away rocket secrets to a North Korean spy, and not one agent ever investigated that.
This is Leonard Hofstadter?

Of Texas.

Mm. Last night, I had a dream we got so rich from the app, you and I bought matching side-by-side mansions. But there was a secret tunnel connecting your front yard to my back yard. What do you think that means?

Don‰Ûªt beat around the bush, Leonard. If you don‰Ûªt want me here, just say the word, and I‰Ûªll leave.
The hallway.

Sitar music for her ringtone is not cool, dude.
Hit the‰Û_ Hey, sweetie. Yeah, I‰Ûªm sorry. I‰Ûªm gonna be working late. I, I, I miss you, too. Okay, sure, I‰Ûªll call you when I get home. Okay, bye-bye.
Very nice. You lie to my sister.
That‰Ûªs the nicest thing he does to your sister.
Oh, guess who.
Cover for me.

Hello, Priya. What‰Ûªs up? How would I know if Leonard‰Ûªs at work or not? Don‰Ûªt be suspicious. Look, if you want your relationship with Leonard to continue, you‰Ûªre going to have to believe whatever wild-eyed, cockamamie excuse the white devil has the nerve to offer you. Okay? Yeah, bye-bye. You owe me.
New puzzle, Ma. Same name. One N, two D‰Ûªs, three O‰Ûªs.
Whoopi and Rube Goldberg!
That‰Ûªs uncanny.
I know. It‰Ûªs her superpower. Well, that and jiggling her arm fat.
Leonard‰Ûªs car.
I can‰Ûªt believe we‰Ûªre going all the way to San Diego to confront this guy.
Yeah, we‰Ûªre kind of bad-asses, aren‰Ûªt we?
Totally.
Hey, how about we stay the night and hit Legoland in the morning?
Sea World is better. It has Shamu, who is literally tons of fun. But for the moment, let‰Ûªs stay focused on Todd Zarnecki.
Yeah, we‰Ûªre coming for you, Todd Zarnecki. And for the record, Legoland is more interactive.

I almost feel sorry for the poor fool, sitting in his split-level suburban ranch, unaware that a vengeful horde is barrelling down the San Diego Freeway at 71 miles an hour. Ease up there, lead foot. You trying to get us killed?
I took the liberty of burning us a mix of heroic questing music.
This says Beyonce Bootylicious Dance Mix.
It‰Ûªs a re-writable CD. Just put it in.
Beyonce? Really?
She‰Ûªs curvy and she owns it. I like that.

character: Leonard (as Ride of the Valkyries begins)
line: Oh, yeah, I‰Ûªm feeling it.
We are winged fury! Which is still no excuse for going over the posted speed limit.
Stuck in a traffic tailback.
Next time we go to kick someone‰Ûªs ass, we take the train.
I always prefer the train.
Outside Todd Zarnecki‰Ûªs house.
Sheldon, let‰Ûªs go.
Coming.
Why did you bring that?
No weapon strikes more fear into a man‰Ûªs heart than a Klingon bat‰Ûªleth.
Okay, let‰Ûªs get clear on something. We‰Ûªre just going to tell this guy to transfer all of your stuff back into your account and then be on our way. No one‰Ûªs bat‰Ûªlething anybody.
So my blade shall not taste blood tonight?
No.
Well, now I just feel silly holding it.
Come on.
Can I at least kick down the door?
You‰Ûªre welcome to try, but the other day, it took you 15 minutes to get into a FedEx box. (Rings bell)
Who is it?
Your doom!
Don‰Ûªt say your doom. Who opens the door for their doom?
Good point. Basket of puppies.
What?
Uh, Sheldon?
Are you Todd Zarnecki?
Yeah. Who are you?
I am Sheldor of Azeroth. I want my things back.
I don‰Ûªt think so. Let me see that.
Careful. That‰Ûªs a collectible.
I know. I‰Ûªve always wanted one. (Closes door)
Well, he‰Ûªs even more cunning than we thought.
Leonard‰Ûªs car.
You know, the joke‰Ûªs on him. Without the certificate of authenticity, that bat‰Ûªleth is worthless.
Yeah, he walked right into our trap.
Legoland seems like a hollow dream now.
Oh-oh.
What‰Ûªs the matter?
Something‰Ûªs wrong, I‰Ûªm not getting any gas. Anybody know anything about internal combustion engines?
Of course.
Very basic.
19th-century technology.
Does anybody know how to fix an internal combustion engine?
No.
No, not a clue.
Well, we‰Ûªd better call somebody to come pick us up.
It‰Ûªd be swell if they had a train.
Penny‰Ûªs car.
Thank you, Penny.
No problem. So, Leonard, I think it‰Ûªs interesting you didn‰Ûªt call your girlfriend to come get you.
Uh, I kind of told her I was working.
So you lied to her. Also interesting.
Yeah, she doesn‰Ûªt really understand the whole Warcraft adventure-role-playing thing.
Well, doesn‰Ûªt matter if she gets it, as long as she‰Ûªs pretty.
This one‰Ûªs funny, Leonard. How come you couldn‰Ûªt make it work with her?
So did you at least get Sheldon‰Ûªs fake stuff back?
No. We failed in our noble quest.
How come?
Todd Zarnecki was mean.
All right. Hang on.
What are you doing?
I‰Ûªm gonna show you how we finish a quest in Nebraska. Oh. Beyonce. (Ride of the Valkyries) This ain‰Ûªt no Beyonce.
Todd Zarnecki‰Ûªs house. Todd answers the door.
Now what?
Give my friend his stuff back.
I don‰Ûªt know what you‰Ûªre talking about.
Well, then, good news. Today‰Ûªs the day a girl‰Ûªs finally going to touch you in your little special place. (Kicks him in the groin) Now give him his stuff back.
Okay.
We did it! I said, we.
The lobby.
Oh, hold the door.
Oh, hi.
Hi.
Going to see Leonard?
Yes. How have you been?
Fine. You?
Very well, thank you.
Alright, well great seeing you.
Yeah, you too.
Amy‰Ûªs right. I do want to fling my poop at her.
A bookstore.

My new book, The Hidden Reality, takes on a grand question. Is our universe the only universe? You see, there‰Ûªs a growing belief among scientists like me that ours may only be one among many universes populating a gigantic cosmos. In The Hidden Reality, I explore this possibility without presuming any knowledge of mathematics or physics on the part of the reader.
Hysterical.
I‰Ûªm glad you talked me into this. We work so hard, sometimes, it‰Ûªs nice to goof off and do something silly.
Agreed. Wait till you hear how he dumbs down Werner Heisenberg for the crowd. You may actually believe you‰Ûªre in a comedy club.

You can think about Heisenberg‰Ûªs Uncertainty Principle much like the special order menu that you find in certain Chinese restaurants, where you have dishes in column A and other dishes in column B, and if you order the first dish in column A, you can‰Ûªt order the corresponding dish in column B. That‰Ûªs sort of like the Uncertainly Principle.
Ba-dum-bump.
Say, I heard an interesting tidbit about Howard and Bernadette.
Really, Amy? Gossip? I‰Ûªm disappointed in you.
Now, now. Evolutionary biologist Robin Dunbar has identified gossip as an aid to social bonding in large groups.
Forgive my language, but poppycock.
What if he‰Ûªs right? And by not participating in gossip, society breaks down into small feral bands of tattooed motorcycle riders fighting to the death over the last few cans of tuna fish?
Fine. In the parlance of the urban music scene, what‰Ûªs the 4-1-1?
Bernadette is thinking about breaking up with Howard.
I believe our nation‰Ûªs tuna cans are safe. Excuse me. Dr. Greene, question?
Yes?
You‰Ûªve dedicated your life‰Ûªs work to educating the general populace about complex scientific ideas.
Yes, in part.
Have you ever considered trying to do something useful? Perhaps, reading to the elderly?
Excuse me?
Yeah, but not your books. Something they might enjoy. I kid, of course. Big fan.
The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
Nice shot.
Thank you. My father taught me archery as a child. It‰Ûªs odd how the activity brings back the smell of Kmart bourbon.
Perfect.
I know. What an elf I would have made. Whoo, what do you think you‰Ûªre doing?
Shooting at a target?
With what?
An arrow.
Really? I didn‰Ûªt see you draw one from your quiver.
I‰Ûªm not going to do that, Sheldon.

Leonard, the people at Nintendo can only go so far in helping us recreate an actual athletic experience. We have to do our part, too. (Leonard mimes drawing an arrow and stabbing Sheldon with it.) That was uncalled for, but I‰Ûªll play along. Ow! I had an unusual experience with Amy last night.
Really? How could you tell?
She was attempting to engage me in gossip.
You don‰Ûªt say?
Yes. I think prolonged exposure to Penny has turned her into a bit of a Gabby Gertie.
So, what‰Ûªs the gossip?
Oh, please, I was just pointing it out. I have no desire to engage in the activity.
Fine, don‰Ûªt tell me.
All right, get this. Bernadette is thinking about breaking up with Howard.
Oh. That‰Ûªs too bad. I wonder what happened.

Mm, it‰Ûªs hard to say. I can only speculate based on the data I collected watching my parents‰Ûª marriage implode. In that case, the woman dives into religion, while the man dives into a bottle-blonde bartender who tries to buy my love with action figures. Oop! Out of arrows.
Boy, you sure get your money‰Ûªs worth out of these games.
The bathroom.
‰ÛÒ Priya, can I come in?
Sure.
Oh, God.
What?
It‰Ûªs okay. You didn‰Ûªt know. I‰Ûªll take care of it.
What, what did I do?
Sheldon doesn‰Ûªt allow flossing that close to the mirror.
You‰Ûªre kidding.
It‰Ûªs a splatter thing. There‰Ûªs a little piece of tape on the floor you‰Ûªre supposed to stand behind.
That‰Ûªs madness.
I know. Just do it. There‰Ûªs a big inspection coming up, and I don‰Ûªt want to lose my TV privileges.
You really need to let me take a look at that roommate agreement one of these days.
Mm, I don‰Ûªt know. I get a lawyer, he gets a lawyer, it‰Ûªs just easier to stand behind the tape.
Oh, by the way, a fellow at work said I could use his Dodger tickets this weekend. Does that sound like fun?
Yeah! Dodgers are baseball, right?
You‰Ûªll need to explain the game to me.
Mm, it‰Ûªs complicated, but as I remember it, the essentials are, get chosen last, get hit by the ball, cry, go home.
Well, regardless, I‰Ûªve got four tickets, and I was thinking we can bring Bernadette and Howard. She‰Ûªs really interesting, and I bet I can get used to him.
Well, it might not be a great idea to invite those two.
Why not?
Don‰Ûªt tell anybody I told you, but I heard she might be breaking up with him.
Oh, too bad. Although I do know one person for whom that‰Ûªs good news.
Really? Who?
My brother. He‰Ûªs got a big crush on Bernadette.
What? You‰Ûªre kidding!
Mmm. I found poems he wrote about her. Very disturbing. Oh, Bernadette, please play my clarinet.
Wow, that‰Ûªs hard to believe.
Yes. And for years, everyone in my family was convinced that he was the clarinet enthusiast. Hmm. What‰Ûªs that piece of tape?
Oh, that one doesn‰Ûªt apply to you. You sit.
The lobby.
Hey!
Hey! How‰Ûªs it going?
Not too bad. Did you hear about Howard and Bernadette?
‰Û÷Course I heard about it. How did you hear about it?
I heard about it from Sheldon. He got it from Amy.
Oh, damn it. I told Amy that in the strictest confidence. Boy, some people are such blabbermouths. Well, whatever, I‰Ûªm sure Bernadette can do better.
Do you think a sexually ambivalent Indian astrophysicist with selective mutism and alcohol issues is better than a hundred-pound Jewish guy who lives with his mom?
You are kidding. Raj likes Bernadette?
I didn‰Ûªt say Raj. Who said Raj?
Okay, give. How do you know? Did he tell you?
No.
Well, then who?
I can‰Ûªt say.
Priya told you. What a little gossip. You know, not an attractive quality in a woman, Leonard. Not judging, just my opinion.
Well, The point is, if this got out, it would destroy Howard and Raj‰Ûªs friendship.
You don‰Ûªt have to worry. Unlike Amy and Priya, I know how to keep a secret.
You‰Ûªre the one who told Amy in the first place.
In confidence!
Raj‰Ûªs apartment.
Hello, Mummy. Hello, Daddy. How are you?
We‰Ûªre very rich in a very poor country. So, all in all, can‰Ûªt complain.
So, Priya, how are enjoying staying with your brother?
It‰Ûªs fine. But if I‰Ûªm going to stay in Los Angeles much longer, I think I should get my own place.
Why? Is Rajesh not making you feel comfortable? Rajesh, why aren‰Ûªt you making your sister comfortable?
I am making her comfortable. Besides, she‰Ûªs not sleeping here half the time anyway.
What? Where are you sleeping, Priya?
It‰Ûªs a figure of speech, Daddy. It means I-I work late.
Please tell me you‰Ûªre not dating an American. I knew this would happen. Rajesh, are you letting your sister date that little Howard boy?
Now, hold on. If she is dating an American, that‰Ûªs not a bad way to go. He‰Ûªs Jewish. Those chaps are very successful, and they don‰Ûªt drink a lot.
It, it doesn‰Ûªt matter. Howard has a girlfriend.
For now.
What does that mean?
I‰Ûªll tell you later.
Is something going on with him and Bernadette?
Who‰Ûªs Bernadette?
Doesn‰Ûªt sound Jewish.
You can‰Ûªt tell by that. Winona Ryder is Jewish.
Okay, we‰Ûªre getting off the subject. Rajesh, I want you to try harder to make your sister feel welcome.
Thank you, Daddy.
Don‰Ûªt worry. Everything I have, I share with her. Including my friend Leon‰Û_
Good night, Mummy. Good night, Daddy.
Oh, my God, I think you broke my toe!
Well you should have kept your mouth shut.
Fair enough. Now, what‰Ûªs up with Clarinet? Bernadette!
The cafeteria.
I‰Ûªve been thinking about Dr. Greene‰Ûªs efforts to make science palatable for the masses.
Oh, yeah? What about it?
That‰Ûªs all. I‰Ûªve just been thinking about it. Now, I‰Ûªm thinking about fractal equations. Now I‰Ûªm thinking about the origin of the phrase train of thought. Now I‰Ûªm thinking about trains.
Are you listening to this guy?
Hmm? Oh, I‰Ûªm sorry. I was somewhere else.
Lucky bastard.
Now I‰Ûªm thinking about Jell-O.
So what‰Ûªs up?
It‰Ûªs a Bernadette thing.
Oh, no. I hope everything‰Ûªs okay.
Whatever it is, we‰Ûªre here for you. You can tell us anything.
Yeah. Good or devastating.
I‰Ûªm gonna ask her to marry me.
Marry you?
What?
Yeah. I just need to figure out the right time to pop the question.
Oh, I‰Ûªd wait.
No rush, no rush.

Oh, great. It‰Ûªs my cousin David about the ring. Hey, David, what‰Ûªd you find? Oh, sure, a half a carat‰Ûªs fine. Her freakishly small hands make anything look big. It‰Ûªs one of the reasons I love her.
Man, he‰Ûªs going to be blindsided.
I know. It‰Ûªll be awful.
Why are you smiling?
Yeah, Raj, why?
Uh, a smile means something different in my country. You know, tears of joy, smile of sadness. India‰Ûªs a goofy place.
Oh, I‰Ûªm back to trains. Woo-woo.
The apartment.
Did I tell you our lab got a grant to study addiction?
No.
Fascinating work. I recently trained a capuchin monkey to smoke cigarettes.
Have you learned anything?
Yes. He looks much cooler than the non-smoking monkeys. Although it‰Ûªs not much of a contest. The other monkeys just sit around and masturbate.
If you don‰Ûªt mind, I‰Ûªd like to stop listening to you and start talking.
By all means.
Howard has announced his intention to propose marriage to Bernadette.
I don‰Ûªt understand. The original piece of gossip indicated an impending breakup.
I know. The group consensus is that his proposal will be met with an humiliating, soul-crushing rejection. Everyone was set a-twitter. Although oddly, no one tweeted.
It‰Ûªs not surprising that the story has captured the attention of our little circle of friends. Are you familiar with meme theory?
I‰Ûªm familiar with everything, but go on.
Meme theory suggests that items of gossip are like living things that seek to reproduce using humans as their host.
I‰Ûªm no stranger to memetic epidemiology. At Johnson Elementary School, the phrase Shelly Cooper‰Ûªs a smelly pooper spread like wildfire.
I should think so. That‰Ûªs gold.
Your meme hypothesis does intrigue me. How might we examine this more closely?
Do you have any ethical qualms regarding human experimentation?
It‰Ûªs one of the few forms of interaction with people that I don‰Ûªt find repellent.
We need to fabricate a tantalizing piece of gossip.
And a second non-tantalizing piece to use as a control.
Then we‰Ûªll track its progress through our social group and interpret the results through the competing academic prisms of memetic theory, algebraic gossip and epidemiology.
Look at you, getting me to engage in the social sciences. You‰Ûªre a vixen, Amy Farrah Fowler.
Penny‰Ûªs door.
Oh, hey, Amy. What‰Ûªs up?
Sheldon and I engaged in sexual intercourse. In other news, I‰Ûªm thinking of starting an herb garden. Mum‰Ûªs the word. Gotta go.
The Cheesecake Factory
Oh, hey, Raj, what are you doing here?
I just felt like drinking alone, because I‰Ûªm deep and dark.
Uh-huh. So, uh, Howard‰Ûªs not here?

No. It‰Ûªs just one of those times when it‰Ûªs just you and me. Like when the three of us went to the movies and you and I waited outside the bathroom while Howard threw up Red Vines and Cherry Coke. Do you remember that?
Yeah.
Me, too. Good times.
Hey, 16 wants to order appetizers.
Oh, thanks.
This was nice.
What the hell are you doing? Howard is your best friend, and that is his girlfriend. You should be ashamed of yourself.
I was when I came in, but it‰Ûªs amazing what liquor does to guilt. Besides what you might not know is, Bernadette is planning on breaking up with Howard.
Well, I know that. How do you know that?
My sister told me.
Oh, that gossipy bitch! No offense.
None taken. You should hear how she talks about you.
Okay, listen, just because Howard and Bernadette are having problems, does not mean you should be here sniffing around.
What can I do? I can‰Ûªt stop thinking about her.
All right, try thinking about this. Sheldon and Amy had sex.
Shut your ass!
Yeah, it‰Ûªs true. Amy told me.
How did that even happen? Did they know that‰Ûªs what they were doing when they were doing it?
I-I guess they just figured it out at some point.
Wow. I can‰Ûªt believe old Smelly Pooper finally got laid.
The apartment.
Hey.
Hey.
Hope you‰Ûªre hungry.
Interesting. A friendly sentiment in this country, cruel taunt in the Sudan. It‰Ûªs a lesson in context.
Will Amy be joining us for dinner?
Yes, I believe so.
Good, good. Everything okay between you two?
Yes. Why do you ask?
No reason. I was just talking to Raj, and he mentioned what a lovely glow she has these days.
Did he mean as if she‰Ûªd been out in the sun, tending an herb garden without wearing a hat or sunblock?
No. That‰Ûªs not what he meant.
Well, we may never know. As my mother would say, the Asians are an inscrutable folk. Now, if you‰Ûªll excuse me, I have work to do.
Yeah, you do. You dog, you.
Did you get that?
Every word. Our false gossip meme appears to have reached node lambda.
This is moving faster than we thought.
Agreed. It appears the rate of gossip transmission is proportional to the number of nodes squared.
I must say, Amy, pretending to have intercourse with you is giving me a great deal of satisfaction.
Slow down, Sheldon. I‰Ûªm not quite there yet.
The apartment, later.
Pass the soy sauce.
Sure.
Bernadette just asked about my sexual encounter with you. The meme has reached full penetration.
Pun intended?
No. Happy accident.
This is remarkable. Took less than 24 hours.
I should let you know that she asked for details about our dalliance.
Interesting. So it went beyond the mere fact of coitus to a blow by blow, as it were.
Pun intended?
I‰Ûªm sorry. What pun?
Not important. I described your lovemaking as aloof, but effective.
I wish you hadn‰Ûªt done that. That‰Ûªs going to make me a chick magnet, and I‰Ûªm so busy as it is.
Hey, everybody, I got something I want to ask Bernadette, and I can‰Ûªt think of a better time than when I‰Ûªm with all my friends.
Oh, hold on, Howard. There‰Ûªs lots of better times.
Leonard, please. The man is talking. Let him get it out, and let the chips fall where they may.
Thank you. Bernadette Maryann Rostenkowski‰Û_
Oh, God. What‰Ûªs happening?
I know things haven‰Ûªt been perfect with us, and we‰Ûªve had our problems, but I just have to tell you, from the moment I‰Û_
Howard, let me just stop you right here.
This is it.
Yes.
Yes, what?
Yes, I will marry you.
You will?
You will?
I will. I will!
Oh, I love you so much.
Oh, I love you, too.
Congratulations!
Oh, it‰Ûªs so exciting.
I wonder what changed her mind.
Perhaps your talk of my sexual prowess renewed her faith in love.
As good an explanation as any.
That‰Ûªs great.
Penny‰Ûªs door.
Oh, hey, Amy. Bernadette just texted me. Howard proposed?
Yes, not important. Just stopped by to let you know I‰Ûªm getting orthotics. Also, I‰Ûªm carrying Sheldon‰Ûªs baby. Mum‰Ûªs the word.
The stairwell, moments later. Leonard is reading a text message.
You‰Ûªre pregnant?
Wow. Is there anything on there about orthotics?
The bathroom
Leonard, are you in the shower?
I can‰Ûªt hear you, I‰Ûªm in the shower.
I asked if you were in the shower, but that‰Ûªs moot now.
What?
Moot. Rendered unimportant by recent events.
I can‰Ûªt hear you, I‰Ûªm in the shower.
I have to skip the chitchat. Emergency.
What kind of emergency?
Mathematical. 32-ounce banana smoothie, 16-ounce bladder.
You might not want to do that.
I assure you I do.
Sheldon, I‰Ûªm not alone in here.
What?
Hello, Sheldon.
What are you doing in there? She can‰Ûªt be in here.
We were in here first, you can‰Ûªt be in here.
According to the roommate agreement, paragraph nine, subsection B, the right to bathroom privacy is suspended in the event of force majeure. And believe me, I am experiencing a very majeure force.
Come on, you can‰Ûªt wait two minutes?
Oh, Leonard, let the man pee.
Penny‰Ûªs door.
(Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny?
What?
Move. Move. Move!
The apartment.
Dr. Leonard Hofstadter, you are officially charged with two violations of the roommate agreement. Do you waive reading of the charges?
Yeah, fine.
Hang on. No, my client does not waive reading of the charges.
Oh. Cool. I‰Ûªve got a lawyer. And I‰Ûªve seen her naked.
Proceed.

Very well. Count the first, on or about the 28th day of April, the accused did knowingly and with malice aforethought deny access to the shared bathroom in a time of emergency, to wit, my back teeth were floating. Count the second, the accused exceeded the agreed upon occupancy of the shower, to wit, one, unless we are under attack by water-soluble aliens.
Can I see the roommate agreement?
Um, it‰Ûªs fairly technical.
I think I can handle it.
Top of her class, Cambridge University. Licensed to practice law in three countries. And your face.
All right, based on a cursory reading, it doesn‰Ûªt look like you have much of a case, Sheldon.
Do so, do so.
Oh, I‰Ûªm afraid not. Section seven here, on the right to enter the bathroom in emergency situations, is not specific as to what constitutes an emergency.
Oh, that‰Ûªs ridiculous. A bathroom emergency is self-explanatory.
Is it? If Leonard forgot to trim his nose hair, could he barge in while you were showering?
Irrelevant. Leonard doesn‰Ûªt trim his nose hair. He thinks because he‰Ûªs short nobody can see up there.
My point is, Sheldon, the legal principle is ambiguity in a contract benefits the party that did not draft it, in this case, Leonard. So much for count one.
But‰Û_
There‰Ûªs no buts, Sheldon, that‰Ûªs how the law works.
Schooled!

As for the shower capacity issue, I cite addendum J. When Sheldon showers second, any and all measures shall be taken to ensure an adequate supply of hot water. I believe this supercedes the occupancy issue.
Superceded!
This isn‰Ûªt over.
No offence, but shower sex with you is now the second best thing that‰Ûªs happened today.
The apartment.
Mmm, Greek food on pizza night? This is the most delightfully cruel thing we‰Ûªve done to Sheldon since we left that fake message from Stephen Hawking on his voice mail.
Seriously?
What is that you‰Ûªre eating? Tonight is pizza night.
I‰Ûªd like to refer that to my attorney.
According to what I see here, Thursday nights are Franconi‰Ûªs pizza night.
Yes, and when Franconi‰Ûªs went out of business, we switched to Graziano‰Ûªs.
That‰Ûªs interesting. Can you just switch restaurants like that, Priya?

A good question, Howard. Turns out you can‰Ûªt. According to the document you drew up, Sheldon, the selection of a new takeout restaurant requires public hearings and a 60-day comment period. Were those criteria met?
No.
Opa!
This is Greek food? Leonard, you hate Greek food.
Not as much as you.
Fine. I‰Ûªm nothing if not adaptable.
I got you the lamb kabob.

Thank you. If you think about it, Greek food isn‰Ûªt that far from italian food. They share a spice palette. And what a civilization is the Greeks. They gave us science, democracy, and little cubes of charred meat that taste like sweat.
Penny‰Ûªs door.
(Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny?
Hey. What‰Ûªs up?
The mean Indian lady tried to make me eat lamb. Congratulations. Pizza night will now be at your apartment. Order one.
Oh, I‰Ûªm sorry, honey, I‰Ûªm meeting Amy and Bernadette for dinner. But you‰Ûªre welcome to tag along.
A girls night? Oh, I don‰Ûªt know if I‰Ûªm up for an evening talking about rainbows, unicorns and menstrual cramps.
Okay, suit yourself. We‰Ûªll probably be trashing Priya a little.
Shotgun.
A bar.
Okay, I‰Ûªd like to propose a toast to a wonderful girls night out.
Fair warning, we can get ker-razy.
Yeah. Last week we smoked cigars and pretended to be dragons.
Really, Amy? Tobacco and alcohol? Need I remind you not a lot of scientific discoveries were made by people having a good time?
Why did you bring him? He‰Ûªs harshing my buzz.
I felt sorry for him. Priya‰Ûªs giving him a hard time.
Ooh, the Priya bashing‰Ûªs starting early. Yay! Okay, what‰Ûªs up with those pantsuits?
I need some context.
