Right, right, whereas Jewish mothers take a casual, la-di-da approach to their sons.
I gargled with tequila and may have swallowed a teeny bit.
You all right?
Fine. Thank you for asking. I love you so much.
The apartment.
Fire demon.
Ooh, fire demon. Sheldon‰Ûªs turning up the heat.
Troll master.
Check it! Howard pulls one out from under the bridge. Nice!
Water nymph.
Oh, yeah, she‰Ûªs got puddles in all the right places.
Could you please play the game without commenting on every card?
Sorry. Walking tree.
Last one.
I‰Ûªm taking a stroll and I‰Ûªm sporting wood.
Okay, the Eagle has landed.
What‰Ûªs going on?
Bernadette and my mother are having a get-to-know-you lunch at the Old Town Deli.
Oh, that sounds lovely.
Hope so. Of course, if history is any indication, my mother will swallow her whole and spit out her bones like an owl.
Have you met Bernadette‰Ûªs parents?
You mean Adolf and Eva? Not yet. One goose step at a time.
Sheldon, that‰Ûªs my water.
Oh, dear Lord!
That‰Ûªs not your water.
I know.
Where‰Ûªs the mouthwash?
Where indeed.
Howard‰Ûªs house.
Ma, I‰Ûªm home! Where are you?
I‰Ûªm in the toilet.
So, how‰Ûªd it go?
Too soon to say. I‰Ûªm not done yet.
No, I mean lunch, today, with Bernadette.
Oh! I had a pastrami sandwich. She had eggplant lasagna. Like that‰Ûªs what a person orders in a Jewish deli.
Besides food, did you get along? Did you talk?
Oh, sure. Did you know she‰Ûªs going to school to become a microbiologist?
No, she never mentioned it.
I bet she did and you didn‰Ûªt listen.
Yeah, that‰Ûªs probably it. So, what do you think? Do you like her? She‰Ûªs great, huh?
She‰Ûªs a lovely girl. Cute as a button.
That‰Ûªs good to hear, ‰Ûªcause I‰Ûªve got some news.
I hope it‰Ûªs good news, because I‰Ûªve got nothing but disappointment in here!

Bernadette and I are getting married. Ma? You too busy bearing down? Ma? (crashing sound from in bathroom) Oh, my God, Ma? Ma? Ma? Stand back, I‰Ûªm gonna break the door down! (Runs at door. It doesn‰Ûªt break down. Falls over.) Son of a bitch! Ma, help!
The laundry room.
Hey.
Hello.
Haven‰Ûªt seen you in a while. How‰Ûªs it going?
Oh, other than waiting out the exponential growth period of the virulent organisms trooping through my microvilli into my circulatory system, hunky-dory. (Penny laughs) Did I say something amusing?
I don‰Ûªt know, maybe, I have no idea what you said.
So your mirth is merely a discharge of nervous energy with no semantic content at all?
My mirth. Classic.
Is there a station coming up where I can board your giggling train of thought?
It‰Ûªs not a big deal, Sheldon. It‰Ûªs just, ever since Leonard‰Ûªs been dating Raj‰Ûªs sister, I‰Ûªve had to keep my distance. I don‰Ûªt get to hear all your jibber-jabber.
Jibber-jabber? I don‰Ûªt jibber-jabber.
What are you doing at work these days?
Oh, I‰Ûªm working on time-dependent backgrounds in string theory, specifically quantum field theory in D-dimensional de Sitter space.
Alright, come on, even you have to admit that‰Ûªs jibber-jabber.
Interesting, do you know where the phrase jibber-jabber comes from?
Oh, my God, you‰Ûªre about to jibber-jabber about jibber-jabber.
Howard and his mother are at the hospital. Come on, we gotta go.
Oh, my God! What happened?
I don‰Ûªt know, I just got a text. Come on, hurry.
Okay.
Sheldon, let‰Ûªs go!
To a hospital? Full of sick people? Oh, I don‰Ûªt think so.
Okay, well, your friend and his mother are there, we‰Ûªre going.
I can‰Ûªt.
Oh, don‰Ûªt tell me you‰Ûªre afraid of germs.
Not all germs. Just the ones that will kill me. It‰Ûªs the same way I‰Ûªm not afraid of all steak knives, just the ones that might be plunged in my thorax.
Right, fine. I‰Ûªll tell Howard you didn‰Ûªt come because you‰Ûªre more concerned about your own well-being than his.
I would think he would know that.
Okay, you know what? You are unbelievable. You buy all these superhero T-shirts, but when it‰Ûªs time for you to step up and do the right thing, you just hide in the laundry room.

Fine, I‰Ûªll go. Just for the record, my Aunt Ruth died in a hospital. She went in to visit my Uncle Roger, caught something and bit the dust a week later. The two of them now share a coffee can on my mother‰Ûªs mantel.
A hospital waiting room.
So I knocked down the bathroom door, picked up my poor unconscious mother, carried her to the car, and drove like a madman to the emergency room.
You‰Ûªre a real hero, Howard.
No, I did what any son would do.
Hang on a second, you picked up your mother? Her own legs are barely able to do that.
I was filled with adrenaline. It happens to be how women lift cars off babies.
Yeah, I‰Ûªm saying, it‰Ûªd be easier to lift a car.
What can I tell you? After I found the courage to put her pants back on, I was unstoppable.
So, how is she?
They‰Ûªre running tests. I don‰Ûªt know. It may have been a heart attack or heart-attack-like event.
What‰Ûªs the difference?
A heart-attack-like event is an event that‰Ûªs like a heart attack.
Thanks for clearing that up.

Regardless, coronary problems are eminently treatable. What‰Ûªs more likely going to kill Howard‰Ûªs mother are the antibiotic-resistant super-bugs festering in every nook and cranny of this hospital.
Okay, you‰Ûªre not helping.
Disagree.
Go sit over there.
I‰Ûªll sit over there, it looks cleaner.
Is there a history of heart disease in your family?
My family is the history of heart disease. There‰Ûªs a cave painting in France of one of my ancestors doing this (clutches chest).
So it‰Ûªs probably genetic.
Well, maybe. Mom also had just gotten some news that might have upset her.
What?
It‰Ûªs not important.
Come on, Howard, I‰Ûªm going to be your wife. You can share anything with me.
You‰Ûªd think that. But no.
You told her we were going to get married and she had a heart attack?
You can‰Ûªt take that personally.
How else is she supposed to take it?
What you‰Ûªve got to keep in mind is that ever since my dad left, I‰Ûªve been the whole world to my mother. I mean, she‰Ûªd be threatened by any woman who can give me what she can‰Ûªt.
You mean sexual intercourse?
Well, when you say it like that you make it sound creepy.
What happened?
Howard‰Ûªs mother had a heart attack because I have sex with him and she can‰Ûªt.
Bernie, wait!
I‰Ûªll give you $1,000 if you‰Ûªll drive me home.
The same, later.
Nice of you to come for Howard.
Well, he‰Ûªs my friend. It‰Ûªs what you do. (Laughs)
I‰Ûªm sorry, did I miss something?
It‰Ûªs just so weird. Howard Wolowitz is my friend. You know, once he tried to stick his tongue down my throat and I broke his nose.
That‰Ûªs a little easier to believe than he‰Ûªs your friend.
Yeah, tell me about it.
You know, my brother had a group of friends like this in India. They dressed up in leotards and goggles and called themselves the New Delhi Power Rangers.
You mean when he was little.
Not as little as you‰Ûªd want him to be.
You know, this stuff is horrible. You want to see if we can find the cafeteria and get real coffee?
Sure. We‰Ûªre going to the cafeteria to get some coffee. You want anything?
I‰Ûªm fine. That‰Ûªs nice that they‰Ûªre getting along.
Your girlfriend and your ex-girlfriend are hanging out together? Oh, yeah, that can only be good for you.
What are you talking about?
One of them broke up with you. Do you really want her telling the other one why?
I don‰Ûªt care. I don‰Ûªt have anything to hide.
Good, good. Then you have nothing to worry about.
No, I do not. You are a mean little man.
You‰Ûªd think it‰Ûªd be because my parents didn‰Ûªt love me, but actually they loved me a great deal.
Bernie, it‰Ûªs not you. She‰Ûªs just set in her ways.
How can we be together if the thought of us getting married might kill your mother?
It‰Ûªs the circle of life, sweetie. One day our son will marry someone and it will kill you.
Howard, I have to go to the bathroom and no one will take me home.
What‰Ûªs wrong with the bathroom here?
Pneumococcus, streptococcus, staphylococcus and other assorted coccuses.
Sheldon, my mother is on her deathbed and my fiancÌ©e is grief-stricken over putting her there. I‰Ûªm not taking you home.
Will you at least go with me to the restroom here, so you can open the door and flush the urinal?
No!
This might be a good time to point out, Howard, that friendship requires a certain give and take. Hold the door!
Mr. Wolowitz?
Is she okay?
It wasn‰Ûªt a heart attack. She‰Ûªs awake, she‰Ûªs resting comfortably. We‰Ûªre still running a few tests.
Can I see her?
Actually, she said, and I quote, she‰Ûªd like to see the little Catholic girl first.
Me? Why me?
Jews have been asking that for centuries. There‰Ûªs no real good answer.
Okay, well, wish me luck.
Don‰Ûªt worry, you‰Ûªll be fine. Let‰Ûªs just hide Mr. Cross. If it touches her, it burns.
You brought a Catholic girl home to your mother?
Yeah.
Why don‰Ûªt I write you a prescription for Xanax.
Outside the hospital washroom. A man enters. 339

character: Sheldon (exiting while the door is open)
line: Finally. (Goes down corridor. Dodges into a door to avoid a coughing patient on a trolley. The room is full of doctors in hazmat suits.) Oh, what fresh hell is this?
Wait, you can‰Ûªt leave here, you‰Ûªve been exposed.
No, I haven‰Ûªt. It‰Ûªs all good.
A hospital corridor.
You want to talk about crazy mothers, Leonard‰Ûªs mom wouldn‰Ûªt give him any sort of approval growing up.
Oh, the poor thing.
It makes him desperate to please women. That‰Ûªs why the foreplay goes on and on.
It does, doesn‰Ûªt it?
It‰Ûªs like he‰Ûªs trying to win a prize. A word of advice, don‰Ûªt doze off. You will never hear the end of it.
Help me! Come back! Penny!
The waiting room.
There are a couple of things I did with Penny that might be a little silly, but‰Û_
Like what?
Every once in a while, before we‰Ûªd go to bed, I‰Ûªd put on a little show for her.
What do you mean, a show?
Well, you know, the way I took my clothes off.
Like, to music?
I‰Ûªd look pretty stupid if there was no music.
So you‰Ûªd do a striptease?
I wasn‰Ûªt swinging around a pole.
Good, good.
There was one time I put body glitter on.
Well, I don‰Ûªt think you have to worry about Penny telling my sister that.
No, she wouldn‰Ûªt.
Your big problem is me telling her.
You really are a mean little man.
Oh, God, that‰Ûªs so true.
Yeah, I know, right?
Hey, what took you guys so long?
Oh, we were just chatting.
That‰Ûªs nice. What about?
We were just comparing notes about how you are in the sack.
That‰Ûªs funny.
Yeah.
What if she wasn‰Ûªt kidding?
It doesn‰Ûªt matter. I‰Ûªm the king of foreplay.
Hey, how‰Ûªd it go?
You‰Ûªre a putz. You know what that means?
Yeah. Do you?
Your mother just taught it to me. She thinks she got food poisoning from that deli and she just wanted to make sure I was okay.
And are you?
No, because I‰Ûªm engaged to a putz. You let me believe I was the reason she had a heart attack.
Well, based on the available evid‰Û_
Shut up! She said I‰Ûªm a wonderful girl and that you‰Ûªre lucky to have me.
Where are you going?

character: Bermadette (in a voice like Mrs Wolowitz)
line: To the toilet! Is that okay with you?
Is it just me, or does she sound sexy when she‰Ûªs angry?
A hospital room. The guys except for Sheldon are in Hazmat suits.
Mountain Elf.
He takes the elf from off the shelf.
Hell Hounds.
Hell Hounds. Who let the Satanic dogs out? Who? Who-who?
Colossal Serpent.
I got a colossal serpent right here.
Must you?
Sorry, I‰Ûªm just trying to cheer my buddy up. Rotting Zombie. Sheldon‰Ûªs new Facebook photo.
Zandor, Wizard of the North. Ha! I win.
If you skip the part about being under a two-week quarantine because you were exposed to a deadly disease, absolutely.
The Cheesecake Factory
Hey, you guys ready to order?
Uh..
Sure
Okay, Priya?
Uh, I‰Ûªll have the Shepherd‰Ûªs Pie. You want to split that with me?
Oh, no, no, no, he doesn‰Ûªt.
Why not?
Well, you have milk in the taters, milk in the gravy, parmesan crust. Your lactose-intolerant boyfriend will turn into a gas-filled Macy‰Ûªs Day balloon.
Not quite accurate. The Macy‰Ûªs balloons are filled with helium, whereas Leonard produces copious amounts of methane.
So, no, on the Shepherd‰Ûªs Pie. Can we move on?
Sea bass. I‰Ûªll have the sea bass.
You gotta like this, the girlfriend and the ex-girlfriend bonding over your rooty-tooty stinky booty.
Kill me.
It wouldn‰Ûªhelp. The human body is capable of being flatulent for hours after death.
Guys, sorry I‰Ûªm late. I have amazing news.
Bernadette, before you change the subject, does anyone have any final comments on Leonard‰Ûªs faulty digestive system?
So, what‰Ûªs your news, Bernadette?
The thesis committee accepted my doctoral dissertation. I‰Ûªm getting my PhD.
Oh!
Oh, congratulations.
Wow, so that means you‰Ûªre a doctor, you‰Ûªre a doctor, you‰Ûªre a doctor, you‰Ûªre a doctor, and Howard, you know a lot of doctors.
Congratulations, honey.
Thank you.
So, Howard, tell us, how‰Ûªs it feel knowing that when you two get married, you‰Ûªll be referred to as Mr. and Dr. Wolowitz?
Unless he takes Bernadette‰Ûªs last name. And considering her advanced status, that could open some doors for him.
Please, this isn‰Ûªt about me. I‰Ûªm proud of you.
Well, you‰Ûªll be really be proud of this. I was headhunted by a big pharmaceutical company. They‰Ûªre gonna pay me a buttload of money!
What?
Bernadette, that‰Ûªs great. Howard, do you make a buttload?
Better than what you‰Ûªve got a buttload of.
Hey, if I roll down the windows in the car, everything‰Ûªs peachy. If you do it, you‰Ûªre still not a doctor.
Yeah, just a heads-up on the car window deal. It helps, but everything is not peachy.
Raj‰Ûªs apartment.
Oh, if there was a problem, you can‰Ûªt solve it, check out the hook while my DJ revolves it. Ice, Ice, baby. Ice, Ice, baby. (Removes headphones and goes to refrigerator).
Oh, God, I feel ridiculous in this dress.
You look beautiful, Lieutenant Uhura. Now prepare for inspection.
Shh, my brother‰Ûªs going to hear you.
Relax, he‰Ûªs got headphones on. And we‰Ûªre ten miles above Earth in a starship.
Really, ten miles? You‰Ûªre orbiting inside the atmosphere? Moron.
I can‰Ûªt believe I‰Ûªm wearing my brother‰Ûªs Halloween costume.
I can‰Ûªt believe you think he only wears it on Halloween. Open the landing bay doors, shuttle craft approaching.
Okay, gotta go.
Howard‰Ûªs house.
Hey, what‰Ûªs up?
Is that my future daughter-in-law, the doctor?
No, Ma! It‰Ûªs Raj!
He‰Ûªs a doctor too, right?
Yes!
Like Leonard and the skinny weirdo!
Sheldon, yes! Everybody‰Ûªs a doctor but me!
Well, whose fault is that?
What‰Ûªs up?
Leonard‰Ûªs putting disgusting memories in my memory foam mattress. Can I stay here tonight?
Sure, but I‰Ûªm going out with Bernadette. It‰Ûªll just be you and my mother.
I guess that‰Ûªs okay.
Ma, can Rajesh sleep over?!
Of course, he and I can play doctor!
She‰Ûªs kidding, right?
I don‰Ûªt know, she‰Ûªs pretty feisty since they put her on hormone-replacement therapy.
Paging Dr. Cutie Pie!
The apartment. Sheldon is talking to Amy on webcam.
I must say, Amy, I was very impressed to see that Bernadette got her PhD.
It‰Ûªs indeed admirable. Although, it is microbiology.
Your doctorate is in neurobiology. I fail to see the distinction.

I‰Ûªll make it simple for you. I study the brain, the organ responsible for Beethoven‰Ûªs Fifth Symphony. Bernadette studies yeast, the organism responsible for Michelob Lite. Is there something wrong with your neck?
It‰Ûªs a little stiff. What a remarkably fragile structure to support such a valuable payload. Not unlike balancing a Faberge egg on a Pixie Stick.
Have you considered massage?
I‰Ûªd like to respond to that sarcastically. Yes, I relish the thought of a stranger covering my body with oil and rubbing it.
I was proposing you massage your muscles with your own hands.
Still sounds like a lot of unnecessary touching.
Trust me. With your right hand, locate the spot where the scapula meets the acromion process.
All right.
Now push your third finger along the ridge of the shoulder blade, making a small rotation as you do so.
Rotating.
You should feel a small node-like object rolling back and forth along the bone.
You mean the myofascial point?
Obviously. Now bear down on it like the seventh grade noogies we all know too well.
Oh, dear Lord, yes, yes, oh, yes! Amy, I‰Ûªve never been touched like this before! Oh! Oh, my hands are magic!
Don‰Ûªt flatter yourself. Your hands are blunt tools guided by my knowledge of the nervous system. I could just as easily have paralyzed you.
There‰Ûªs someone at my door.
That doesn‰Ûªt interest me. Goodbye.
Can I sleep here tonight?
Why?
Leonard‰Ûªs having astronomically inaccurate Star Trek sex with my sister.
I can see how that would be upsetting. Come in. I‰Ûªll get the sheets and blankets for the couch.
Oh, don‰Ûªt bother. I‰Ûªll just sleep in Leonard‰Ûªs room.
No, I can‰Ûªt authorize that.
Well, he‰Ûªs in my bed. Why can‰Ûªt I be in his?
The Hammurabic Code is an eye for an eye, not a bed for a bed.
Come on, dude, I‰Ûªm exhausted, and Tyra Banks says the most important item in your makeup bag is a good night‰Ûªs sleep.
All right. This is a form indemnifying me from your use of Leonard‰Ûªs bedroom. Sign here, indicating that I tried to stop you and did so using a stern facial expression.
Good night, Sheldon.

Wait. Not yet. We still have to go over safety procedures. Now, the apartment has three emergency exits located here, here, and here. In the event of a power outage, luminous paint will guide you to the nearest exit.
You‰Ûªre kidding.
I never kid about safety.
Leonard‰Ûªs bedroom. Leonard enters, and accidentally sits on Raj. Both exclaim.
What are you doing here?
I was sleeping.
In my bed?
Well, I would‰Ûªve slept in my own bed, but it was being used to bring shame to my family. And the memory of Gene Roddenberry.
Oh, you heard?
Scotty, I need more power.
Sorry. Does Sheldon know you‰Ûªre sleeping in here?
Are you kidding? He made me sign a waiver, participate in an emergency fire drill and take a refresher course in CPR. Thank God he had a dummy.
Oh, yeah. Mouth-to-Mouth Mona. You know, she used to date Howard?
Oh, my God, she‰Ûªs that Mona? Why can‰Ûªt you and my sister spend your nights here?
We tried. She doesn‰Ûªt get along with Sheldon.
Sheldon doesn‰Ûªt get along with Sheldon. It‰Ûªs still no reason for me to have to listen to you arm your photon torpedoes every night.
Okay, well, how about this. Until Priya gets her own place, you stay here and I‰Ûªll stay at your apartment.
Can I bring girls here?
You? Sure. Bring as many as you want.
Okay, deal.
Just not against their will.
The cafeteria.
Do you really think you should be eating that cake?
Why?
If you‰Ûªre gonna be a trophy husband for a rich wife, you might want to watch your waistline.
He‰Ûªs right. A minute on the lips, a lifetime on the hips.
Yeah, ha-ha. First of all, I‰Ûªm not threatened by my fiancÌ©e‰Ûªs success. I‰Ûªm proud of her. And secondly, I have my own career.
Until you have kids.
Good news, Raj. I got the blood work back from the lab. You‰Ûªre okay to stay for a while.
When did you take my blood?
Not important. Your sugar was a little high. I‰Ûªd follow up with your regular physician. In the meantime, I have some paperwork here for you to go over.
What the hell is this?
Boilerplate stuff. A modified roommate agreement for a temporary house guest. And a living will and durable power of attorney.
This says you can make end of life decisions for me.
As your friend, let‰Ûªs hope it doesn‰Ûªt come to that. Please sign.
Did you sign this?
There‰Ûªs a reciprocity clause. You get to pull the plug on him, too.
Well, that seems fair.

Congratulations and welcome temporarily aboard. Here‰Ûªs your I.D. Card, your key and your lapel pin. Which Leonard was too cool to wear. FYI, part of your responsibilities as roommate pro tem will be to drive me to and from work, the comic book store, the barbershop and the park for one hour every other Sunday for fresh air.
Bring a ball or a Frisbee, you know, something he can chase.

Also, you‰Ûªre tasked with bringing home all takeout dinners. Tonight is Thai food. You‰Ûªll find the standard order in appendix B or downloadable from my FTP server. If you have any questions, here‰Ûªs the FAQ sheet, or if you prefer the human touch, I do a live web chat called Apartment Talk on Tuesday nights.
No backsies.
The apartment.
Sheldon, dinner!
What is this?
This is the difference between eating and dining.
Remarkable. I‰Ûªm just realizing how much Leonard‰Ûªs been skating by all these years.
It‰Ûªs not a big thing. Just think of me as a brown Martha Stewart.
Hey, Sheldon, did you change your Wi-Fi password again?
Yes, it‰Ûªs ‰ÛÏPenny, get your own Wi-Fi.‰Û No spaces.
Thanks. Wow! What‰Ûªs with the fancy spread?
My new roommate is bending over backwards to ingratiate himself to me. (Pointing to lapel badge) Uh, nice touch, by the way.
What do you mean, new roommate? What happened to Leonard?
The same thing that happened to Homo Erectus. He was replaced by a superior species.
I‰Ûªm the new Homo in town. That came out wrong.
All right, let me try this again. Where‰Ûªs Leonard?
He‰Ûªs living at my place, so I‰Ûªm living here.
You‰Ûªre living here provisionally. But I must say it‰Ûªs looking good.
Woah, Leonard and Priya are living together? That‰Ûªs big.
No. Origami napkin swans, that‰Ûªs the headline.
It‰Ûªs a good thing.
Bernadette‰Ûªs bedroom.
So do you know what kind of research you‰Ûªll be doing at this pharmaceutical company?

Well, there are a couple of opportunities available, but I volunteered for the premature ejaculation project. I mean, it‰Ûªs not like either one of us has heart disease. Oh, I almost forgot. I got you a little present.
Oh, Bernie, no. You didn‰Ûªt have to.
I wanted to. Come on, open it.
You bought me a Rolex? How much did this cost?
Oh, you let me worry about the money. I just want my baby to have pretty things.
The apartment.
More wine?
Oh, no, no, no. I‰Ûªve had way too much already.
Here‰Ûªs an interesting fact about alcohol.
Hit me.
Man is not the only species that ferments fruit in order to become intoxicated. Can you guess what the other is? Hint, sometimes they pack the alcohol in their trunks.
Monkeys.
When does a monkey have a trunk?
When a suitcase just won‰Ûªt do.

Mmm, all right. It would appear as if alcohol is playing keep-away with your intelligence. Good night. Please note, it is now past ten p.m. Per our roommate agreement, kindly refrain from raucous laughter, clinking of glasses, and celebratory gunfire.
Okay, explain something to me. You watch Leonard put up with that guy for years and years. What has to break inside your brain for you to think, Oh, Krishna, I‰Ûªve got to get me some of that?
Well, it‰Ûªs a lot better than having to wear noise-cancelling headphones in my own apartment.
What? Oh, God, yeah. Yeah. Leonard‰Ûªs a noisy little dude in the sack.
Every night.
Really? Even during allergy season, when he has to alternate between kissing and breathing?
It‰Ûªs my sister. Can we not talk about this any more?
Yeah. Sorry, sorry. Can I tell you a secret?
Yeah.
I screwed up. Leonard‰Ûªs a great guy. Never should have broken up with him.
Well, uh, to paraphrase Shakespeare, It‰Ûªs better to have loved and lost than to stay home every night and download increasingly shameful pornography.
Oh, you poor baby.
What‰Ûªs wrong with me, Penny?
Nothing, nothing. You know, if we weren‰Ûªt friends, and you hadn‰Ûªt brought up that creepy pornography story, I‰Ûªd be on you like the speed of light squared on matter to make energy.
Hey, you totally got that right! E equals M C squared.
I listen. I have no idea what it means, but I listen. To friendship.
To friendship.
Would you booze hounds please stop that infernal clinking? And the answer was elephant!
Raj‰Ûªs apartment. Leonard and Priya are kissing.
Mmm. Mmm.
Leonard, sweetheart, we‰Ûªre kissing, not eating hot soup.
Sorry.
That‰Ûªs my parents on video chat. Go hide in the bedroom.
Oh, come on! Why don‰Ûªt we just tell them that we‰Ûªre dating?
Oh, we‰Ûªve been through this. It‰Ûªs not the time.
When is the time?
I‰Ûªve got five brothers and sisters. One of them is bound to screw up real big, and then I‰Ûªll tell my parents about you. Now, shoo.
Fine.
Hello, Mummy. Hello, Daddy.
We heard there was a tornado in Kansas City. Is that close to you?
No.
Where is your brother?
Out with friends.
I don‰Ûªt like it, a young girl alone in an apartment.
I‰Ûªll sleep so much better when you move back here next month.
You‰Ûªre moving back to India?
Who‰Ûªs that?
Oh, my God! There‰Ûªs someone in your apartment. Call the police in America!
When were you going to tell me about this?
Oh, hello, Leonard. What a pleasant surprise! Mummy, Daddy, you remember Rajesh‰Ûªs friend Leonard.
I thought you said Rajesh was out with his friends.
He has many friends.
Rajesh has many friends?
Why are you lying to us?
She‰Ûªs lying because she doesn‰Ûªt want you to know we‰Ûªre dating.
Leonard!
Well, what difference does it make? If you‰Ûªre moving back to India, we‰Ûªre obviously breaking up.
You know what? I don‰Ûªt want to deal with this right now.
So. Hot in India?
Of course it is. It always is. It‰Ûªs India. Now, what do you have to say for yourself?
Uh. That is a beautiful tapestry.
Leonard‰Ûªs bedroom. Raj and Penny are in bed.
Oh, God. Oh, God! Oh. Okay, look. This never happened. Do you understand me? (Raj nods) Really? Still can‰Ûªt talk to me?
The living room. Leonard is asleep on the couch.
What are you doing here?
What?
I said, what are you doing here?
I live here.
I have paperwork that says differently.
Priya‰Ûªs going back to India.
Irrelevant. Rajesh and I have a good thing going and you‰Ûªre not going to ruin it. (Knock on door) What are you doing here?
I‰Ûªve been up all night. I had a fight with Bernadette.
Why?
She gave me a beautiful watch.
Leonard, do you understand this?
Yes.
Talk to him.

character: Penny (entering room dishevelled, with a half naked Raj behind)
line: Damn.
What‰Ûªs going on?
Oh. It‰Ûªs, it‰Ûªs not what it looks like.
What does it look like?
The Cafeteria
It‰Ûªs not what it looks like. It‰Ûªs not what it looks like.
What are you grinding about?
Penny‰Ûªs brain teaser this morning. She and Koothrappali emerge from your bedroom. She is dishevelled, and Raj is dressed only in a sheet. The sole clue, it‰Ûªs not what it looks like.
Just let it go, Sheldon.

If I could, I would, but I can‰Ûªt, so I shan‰Ûªt. Now, knowing Penny, the obvious answer is, they engaged in coitus. But, since that‰Ûªs what it looked like, we can rule that out. Let‰Ûªs put on our thinking cap, shall we? (Mimes doing so) Raj is from India, a tropical country. Third World hygiene. Parasitic infections are common, such as pinworms. Mm-hmm. The procedure for diagnosing pinworms is to wait until the subject is asleep, and the worms crawl out of the rectum for air. (Leonard spits out food) Yes, just like that. Penny could have been inspecting Raj‰Ûªs anal region for parasites. Oh, boy. That‰Ûªs a true blue friend.
They slept together, Sherlock.
No, you weren‰Ûªt listening. She said, it‰Ûªs not what it looks like.
She lied.
Oh. Well don‰Ûªt I look silly sitting here wearing this?
The Cafeteria
Hey.
Hey.
Hey.
Hey. Leonard, is it awkward for you knowing that one of your dear friends had sexual intercourse with a woman you used to love in the very place you lay your head?
No, I‰Ûªm fine with it.

That sounds like sarcasm, but I‰Ûªm going to disregard it, because I have an agenda. Paintball. Specifically, the interdepartmental tournament this weekend. Now, in order to function better as a fighting unit, I thought we should establish a chain of command. Now, it goes without saying that I would outrank the three of you, but the question remains, by how much? Now, I don‰Ûªt see me as some four-star general, back at HQ riding a desk and playing golf with the Secretary of Defence. But I also can‰Ûªt be Sergeant Cooper, because that might lead you to think of me as just a regular Joe. This might take some thought. As you were.
What the hell is wrong with you?
Yeah, how could you do that?
What is it to you?
I got his back.
Yeah, right. You‰Ûªre just jealous because it turns out I‰Ûªm Penny‰Ûªs number two choice after Leonard.
Hey, if I wasn‰Ûªt engaged to Bernadette, that totally could have been me.
Please. Sheldon would have been before you, and he might not even have genitals.
Why do you care so much? You‰Ûªre dating my sister, and Penny and I are in love.
What?
Gentlemen, if I may interject, I‰Ûªve decided my rank will be captain. If it‰Ûªs good enough for Kirk, Crunch and Kangaroo, it‰Ûªs good enough for me.
You‰Ûªre not in love with Penny.
Yes, I am. The god Kamadeva has shot us with his flowery arrows of love.
Who?
He‰Ûªs the Hindu version of Cupid, but way better, because he rides a giant parrot.
Raj, come on. You fall in love with any girl who smiles at you. A month ago, you were writing poems about his fiancee.
I‰Ûªm sorry. What?
Rubbish. He‰Ûªs talking rubbish.
Oh, Bernadette, please play my clarinet.
That could have been about anyone. Besides, you have nothing to worry about, because now I‰Ûªm the dusky half of Koothrapenny.
For the record, I do have genitals. They‰Ûªre functional and aesthetically pleasing.
Penny‰Ûªs apartment. Penny has a bottle of wine. She can‰Ûªt find a glass. Finds a measuring jug and uses that instead. There is a knock on the door.
Coming. Yup, that‰Ûªs good. Wine glasses should have handles.
Keeping accurate track of your alcohol intake. Smart idea considering how trampy you get when you‰Ûªve had a few.
You heard what I did?
Well, I heard who you did.
Oh, my God, I screwed up everything. I hurt Leonard, I hurt Raj, I mean, what is wrong with me? I feel like two totally different people, Dr. Jekyll and Mrs. Whore.
Don‰Ûªt be so hard on yourself. Do you know the story of Catherine the Great?
No.
She ruled Russia in the late seventeen hundreds, and one night, when she was feeling particularly randy, she used an intricate system of pulleys to have intimate relations with a horse.
I‰Ûªm‰Û_ I‰Ûªm sorry. What does this have to do with me?
She engaged in interspecies hanky-panky, and people still call her great. I‰Ûªm sure your reputation can survive you shagging a little Indian boy.
Raj‰Ûªs apartment. There is a knock on the door. He opens it.
You jerk face! What did you tell Howard? Did you say there was something going on between us? Because he thinks there is. He‰Ûªs completely freaking out!
Please, come in.
What the hell is wrong with you?
Well, you were always so nice to me, I thought maybe you liked me.
I‰Ûªm nice to everyone.
I‰Ûªm sorry.
Damn right, you‰Ûªre sorry. And you tell Howard there‰Ûªs never been anything between us.
I will. Hey, Bernadette?
What?!
Do you think I have a shot with Penny?
Of course you do. You‰Ûªre a cutie pie. Any girl would be lucky to have you.
Penny‰Ûªs apartment.

You know, I‰Ûªve done this before. In kindergarten, I was supposed to marry Jason Sorensen at recess, but by the time my class got out there, he was already engaged to Chelsea Himmelfarb. So what did I do? Hung upside down from the monkey bars, let all the boys see my underpants.
You can‰Ûªt blame yourself. When your prefrontal cortex fails to make you happy, promiscuity rewards you with the needed flood of dopamine. We neurobiologists refer to this as the skank reflex.
You know what? Let‰Ûªs get out of here.
Where are we going?
Somewhere where no one‰Ûªs seen me naked. We may have to drive awhile. (Opens door. Sees Leonard and Sheldon. Slams it shut again.)
Subtlety isn‰Ûªt her strong suit, is it?
Can I stay at your place for a few nights?
Really? A best friend sleepover? Yay.
Yeah, sure. Yay!
We‰Ûªll make popcorn, stay up all night and I‰Ûªll teach you my secret language, Op.
Sounds great.
Nope. Sounds Gop Rop E A Top.
Yeah, I‰Ûªm gonna go pack a bag.
No, you‰Ûªre not. You‰Ûªre gonna Pop A Cop Kop A Bop A Gop.
The apartment.
Do we really have to wear this camouflage crap to play paintball?
Who said that? Leonard, I can hear your voice, but I can‰Ûªt see you.
I‰Ûªm not in the mood, Sheldon.
Oh, there you are. Leonard, I know you‰Ûªre upset about recent events, and I have someone here to help. (Showing laptop screen)
I don‰Ûªt want to talk to Amy.
No, it‰Ûªs not Amy.
Hello, dear.
You called my mother?
Oh, Leonard, is it really necessary to caption the obvious?
He‰Ûªs been like that since he was a toddler. Look, Mommy, a butterfly. Maddening.
What‰Ûªs going on? What do you want?
Sheldon informed me that you‰Ûªre experiencing an emotional upheaval, and I‰Ûªm here to help.
That‰Ûªs so nice.
And we‰Ûªre back to the obvious. Now, what‰Ûªs up?

Well, uh, okay, um, I don‰Ûªt want to get back together with Penny. We tried it, it was crazy, it didn‰Ûªt work, but I can‰Ûªt deal with the fact that she slept with my friend Raj. And then I find out that Raj‰Ûªs sister Priya, who I‰Ûªve been going out with for eight months, is moving back to India. So I‰Ûªm just completely confused and alone.
I understand.
Got any advice?
Yes. Buck up.
Excuse me. You‰Ûªre a world-renowned expert in parenting and child development, and all you‰Ûªve got is buck up?
Sorry. Buck up, sissy pants.
Thanks, Mother. I feel much better.
If you need any more help from me, my books are available on Amazon. Logging off.
Amy‰Ûªs apartment. Amy is brushing Penny‰Ûªs hair.
Ninety-nine, one hundred. It‰Ûªs like a waterfall of liquid gold. My turn.

You know, I don‰Ûªt even know what the point of me staying in L.A. is. I haven‰Ûªt gotten a single acting job since I moved out here. The closest I came was last month, I got a callback for a hemorrhoid commercial.
Oh, I could so see you being the face of haemorrhoids.
I know, right? Maybe I should just move back to Nebraska.
No, I can‰Ûªt let you do that.
Why not? (There is a knock on the door)
For the first time ever, I have a thriving social life. And no pressure, but it kind of lives and dies with you.
Hi, Amy. Can I talk to Penny?
A guest in my trundle bed and a boy at my door? I wish I could tell 13-year-old me it does get better.
How did you know I was here?
It‰Ûªs all over her Facebook page.
I‰Ûªll take your stuff to the bedroom and clear out a drawer.
Thanks.
No problem. Try and keep it in your pants, okay?
So, hi. What‰Ûªs up?
I was wondering if you‰Ûªre free Friday. They‰Ûªre having a Totally ‰Ûª80s Night at the Greek. Hall & Oates, Katrina and the Waves and three-fifths of Kajagoogoo.
Oh. Gee, that‰Ûªs really sweet, but the thing is‰Û_
Aw, there‰Ûªs a thing.
Look, honey, I was really drunk and made a huge mistake last night. We should‰Ûªve never slept together. It‰Ûªs what ruins friendships.
You can‰Ûªt ruin a friendship with sex. That‰Ûªs like trying to ruin ice cream with chocolate sprinkles.
Come here. Just listen to me. I want to go back to the way we were before. You know, friends. No sprinkles.
Oh. All right.
Thank you.
Well, uh, as your friend, you might like to know that, um, we didn‰Ûªt have sex in the conventional sense.
Oh, God. Did you pull some weird Indian crap on me?
No, no. After we got undressed and jumped in bed, you, you asked if I had protection.
Oh, you did, didn‰Ûªt you?
Of course. I‰Ûªm always packing. Anyway, um, I had trouble putting it on and you tried to help and, that was all she wrote.
So, we didn‰Ûªt actually‰Û_
I did. It was beautiful.
Oh!
Penny, please, please promise me you won‰Ûªt tell anybody about this.
Of course I won‰Ûªt. No, I won‰Ûªt.
Oh, good. Um, can I tell people that our love burned too bright and too quickly? Kind of a Candle in the Wind deal?
Sure.
Cool. Can I say it fell apart because you were all, I want to have your babies, and I was like, I‰Ûªm too rock and roll to be tied down?
No.
Can I say I ruined you for white men?
Also no.
Okay, just the candle thing.
Yeah.
Cool. All right friend.
Hmm.
I‰Ûªll see you around.
Okay. Raj, wait. Thank you for being my friend. (She hugs him.)
Penny?
Mm-hmm?
It‰Ûªs getting beautiful again.
A shed on the paintball range.
All right, this is a Google Earth view of the field of battle.
I don‰Ûªt see anything.

Give it a second to load. Whenever you‰Ûªre ready, AT&T! Okay, here we go. This is us here. To the south is Professor Loomis and the Geology Department. According to their Twitter feed, they‰Ûªre out of sunblock, which means they‰Ûªll have to hug the tree line or risk melanoma. That‰Ûªs our edge. All we have to do is move quickly over this ridge, the rock-worshipping pasty-faced bastards won‰Ûªt know what hit them. All right, let‰Ûªs move out.
Hang on, Sheldon. How could you not tell me your sister was moving back to India?
Maybe he was too busy writing clumsy penis metaphors about my fiancee.
Screw you. That was a beautifully written penis metaphor.
You know what, guys, I‰Ûªm not in the mood for paintball. What do you say we just bag it?
Fine with me.
Sure, whatever.
You can‰Ûªt quit. That‰Ûªs a court-martial offence. That‰Ûªs punishable by‰Û_ You can‰Ûªt quit.
Sorry, Sheldon, it‰Ûªs just not a good time for playing games.
This is a game to you? Uh, was the Battle of Antietam a game? Huh? Was the sack of Rome a game?
Yes, no and no.

Wait. I just want you all to know that I forgive you. This mutiny isn‰Ûªt your fault, it‰Ûªs mine. I haven‰Ûªt earned these bars. Although what I lack in leadership, apparently I more than make up for in sewing.
Let it go, Sheldon. I‰Ûªll get you a Jamba Juice on the way home.
No. Jamba Juice is for heroes. And that‰Ûªs what we‰Ûªre going to be.
What are you doing?
Following in the footsteps of Kirk, Crunch and Kangaroo. (Walks outside) Geology isn‰Ûªt a real science! (Gets hit by countless paintball pellets)
Damn those sons of bitches!
Let‰Ûªs get ‰Ûªem!
If there‰Ûªs ever a Church of Sheldon, this will be when it started. Ow!
The apartment.
I‰Ûªd like to propose a toast to the man whose noble sacrifice inspired our victory, Captain Sheldon Cooper.
Here, here.
Excuse me. It‰Ûªs Major Sheldon Cooper. With my last breath, I awarded myself a battlefield promotion. It‰Ûªs kind of a big deal.
Hi. You guys have a minute?
Uh, yeah, sure.
Okay. Um. Well, I already talked to Raj, but I wanted to apologize to the rest of you for, you know, everything.
Please, Penny, let me. We‰Ûªve decided to let our crazy, wonderful night together be just one of those memories you have and can call to mind when you‰Ûªre feeling blue or you‰Ûªre in the shower.
Hey, what you doing, Quick Draw?
Sorry. Go on.

Anyways, I wanted you guys all to know that I‰Ûªve been taking a really hard look at things and come to the conclusion I have to stop kidding myself. I suck at acting. It‰Ûªs time for me to move back to Nebraska.
You‰Ûªre leaving?
Yeah.
What are you going to do in Nebraska?
I don‰Ûªt know, maybe teach acting. (Phone rings) Oh, sorry. Hold on. Hello?
Penny, Penny, listen, I hope you‰Ûªre not doing this ‰Ûªcause of you and me, because I have a girlfriend, and you‰Ûªre a single woman.

Shh! It‰Ûªs my agent, it‰Ûªs my agent. You‰Ûªre kidding. Oh, my gosh. I can‰Ûªt believe it! Really? Oh, I‰Ûªm so excited, thank you, thank you so much. Okay, bye. I got the haemorrhoid commercial! I start Monday.
What about Nebraska?
Oh, hell with Nebraska. I‰Ûªm gonna be a star!
Have you ever thought of teaching physics?
The apartment. Penny‰Ûªs ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
Ready to ride?
I don‰Ûªt think so, Mom. Not today.
Oh, sweetie. Haemorrhoids acting up again?
You don‰Ûªt know the half of it.
Oh, yes, I do. Try a dab of this.
Rose-scented Preparation-H for women?
Now, the H is for Her.
I‰Ûªm proud of you.
Shh! Here comes my joke.
How are you doing?
Sittin‰Ûª pretty.
34 pm
The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
What are you doing?
Oh, uh, Priya‰Ûªs calling in a few minutes on Skype, and we are gonna have a dinner date.
It‰Ûªs eight o‰Ûªclock in the morning in Mumbai. How can she have dinner?
Fine, whatever. Priya will be having breakfast.

All right, so technically it‰Ûªs not a dinner date. I suppose you could call it a, uh, dinfast date. But if you did, you‰Ûªd open yourself to peer-based mocking, such as, Hey, Leonard, how was your dinfast with Priya last night?
That doesn‰Ûªt sound like mocking.
You didn‰Ûªt let me finish. Dinfast (rolls eyes). Are those soy-based candles?
I don‰Ûªt know. Why?
Paraffin candles may contain carcinogens. Unless lung cancer is the ambiance you were going for at your dinfast. Dinfast (rolls eyes).
Listen, I don‰Ûªt want to be rude, but Priya‰Ûªs gonna be calling any minute, so‰Û_
Oh, yes, Priya. Leonard, you know I make a point of never interfering in your personal affairs.
Yes, I‰Ûªve always admired that about you.
As well you should. But I‰Ûªm going to make an exception here.
Oh, good.
Priya has moved back to India to pursue her law career. Instead of desperately trying to keep this intercontinental relationship alive, you could use that time to take up a hobby.
A hobby?
Yes. I read recently about a fellow in Kansas with an enormous ball of twine. I bet you could give him a run for his money.
You know, some people might say that it‰Ûªs great that we‰Ûªre trying to make things work long distance. They‰Ûªd say things like, love is stronger than the miles between you.
When I rise to power, those people will be sterilized.
You video-chat with Amy all the time. How is this different?
Don‰Ûªt you like Amy?
Of course I like Amy.
Well, there‰Ûªs the difference. (Skype tone rings)
Excuse me, that‰Ûªs Priya.
Hi, Leonard.
Hey, honey.
I miss you.
Oh, I miss you, too.
I miss the old days when your romantic partners could be returned to the video store.
Penny‰Ûªs apartment.
Thanks for letting me stay here while Leonard Skypes with his girlfriend.
Oh, it‰Ûªs no problem. It‰Ûªs actually kind of nice. You reading, me reading. We‰Ûªre like an old married couple.
If we were an old married couple, the wife would serve iced tea and snickerdoodles.
I don‰Ûªt have iced tea and snickerdoodles.
A good wife would go to the store.
I want a divorce.
Good. On the way to see the lawyer, pick up some tea and cookies. I must say, I am enjoying your new chair.
It‰Ûªs great, isn‰Ûªt it?
It is. Aligns the lumbar, cradles the coccyx, balances the buttocks. This is a chair worthy of the name.
What name?
Chair.
Oh, all right, well, I‰Ûªm glad you like it. I mean, I still can‰Ûªt get over the fact someone just threw it away.
What?
Yeah, it was just sitting on the street. I paid a homeless guy ten bucks to help me get it up here.
Oh, dear. Oh, dear. Oh, dear. (Starts stripping off clothing)
What is wrong?
I‰Ûªve been sitting in garbage!
Sheldon, take it easy.
You take it easy! I need to use your shower.
I went into this marriage with so much hope.
There‰Ûªs a wet Band-Aid on the shower floor. (Runs out of apartment).
Howard‰Ûªs workshop.
This is fun. I‰Ûªve never used a hydraulic thermoforming press before.
Pretty sweet, huh? This little baby set the university back 175 grand.
That‰Ûªs three minutes. Should we see what we got?
Hang on.
Oh, yeah. This is one good-looking panini.
Hand me the tuna melt.
Yep.
Thank you. How‰Ûªs it going with the long-distance love affair?
Not easy, but we‰Ûªre making it work.
When you say making it work, does that include doing the cyber nasty?
What?
You know, the virtual pickle tickle. The digital bow-chicka-bow-bow.
Come on, dude. This is my sister you‰Ûªre talking about.
Hey, Leonard jiggling his junk at her through a webcam has got to be easier for you to deal with than him actually touching her with it.
There‰Ûªs no junk jiggling. We just talk.
Are you insane? With high-speed Internet, you have at your fingertips the greatest advancement in the field of sex since the invention of the washcloth.
I can‰Ûªt do that.
Well, if you don‰Ûªt, you‰Ûªre gonna lose Priya to some fancy guy in a turban who grew up with Kama Sutra coloring books.
How can you be so racist?
Oh, come on, tell me I‰Ûªm wrong.
Oh, Leonard, good. There you are. I need you to check my head for chair lice.
I did it last night, I‰Ûªm not doing it again.
Just his head, right?
I don‰Ûªt want to talk about it. You didn‰Ûªt catch bugs from Penny‰Ûªs chair.
Yes, I did. And now they‰Ûªre cavorting at the base of my hair follicles like dancing hippies at the Redwood National Forest.
Sheldon, you do this all the time. You fixate on some crazy idea and then blow it way out of proportion.
Name one time I‰Ûªve ever done that.

How about when you put GPS trackers in your garbage because you were convinced North Korean spies were stealing your doodles? The chicken nuggets you were sure were human nuggets. The strangely-shaped cloud that was following you around town. The time you put on my shirt by mistake and were convinced you‰Ûªd started growing again.
I said, name one. You really need to work on your listening skills.
Penny‰Ûªs apartment door.
(Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Penny.
Yello.
You need to remove that chair from the building. It‰Ûªs a health hazard.
Okay, relax. I took off the slipcovers, had them dry-cleaned and then fumigated the cushions.
Really?
Yeah. It‰Ûªs cleaner than my couch. Found half a Hot Pocket in there.
It certainly looks okay. Has a strong toxic chemical smell. That‰Ûªs reassuring.
Why don‰Ûªt you give it a try, Sheldon?
All right. It is a comfortable chair.
Why don‰Ûªt you just admit you overreacted?
No, thank you. (Sees insect. More appear and swarm all over him. He jumps out of a daydream on his own couch. Jumps up and runs out to Penny‰Ûªs apartment.
It‰Ûªs like living with a Chihuahua.
(Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Penny.
What‰Ûªs up, buttercup?
You have to get rid of the chair.
Nope. (Closes door)
(Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Penny.
What‰Ûªs the word, hummingbird?
For your safety, please wait in my apartment as I call the authorities so they may remove the chair of death.
No. (Closes door)
(Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Penny.
What‰Ûªs the gist, physicist?

Under my authority as a self-appointed member of the Centres for Disease Control street team, these premises are condemned. (Penny tries to close door) As a man with a keen sense of style, I must tell you, that chair does not work with the room. (Penny closes door). (Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Penny opens door and waves seat cushion at him. He screams and runs off. She closes door. He sneaks back) (Knock, knock, knock) Penny.
Leonard‰Ûªs bedroom.
So, here we are. Back in bed together.
Yep, here we are.
Okay, so I, I, I guess I‰Ûªll just jump right in.
All right.
Uh, you‰Ûªre a naughty girl. And, and, uh, I, I want to punish you with my love?
What?
Not good?
That‰Ûªs terrible. Try again.
Okay. Uh, uh, you‰Ûªre not naughty. Uh, you‰Ûªre, you‰Ûªre, you‰Ûªre dirty. You‰Ûªre, you‰Ûªre a, a dirty girl?
Oh, yes. Yes, I am.
Yeah, yeah. Uh, okay. You‰Ûªre a, you‰Ûªre a, you‰Ûªre a, a dirty, disgusting, revolting girl. Ugh!
God, Leonard, stop talking.
Why don‰Ûªt you just give me five minutes? I‰Ûªll Google how to do this. I‰Ûªll call you right back.
Shh-shh-shh. Just be quiet and do what I tell you.
Okay, like usual. Good.
Take off your shirt.
All rightie. Shirt coming off. Ta-da! Man nipples.
I said be quiet.
Yes, ma‰Ûªam.
Now take off your shorts.
Taking shorts off. There we go. Naked, naked, naked!
Wonderful. Now I‰Ûªll take off my clothes.
Cool. (computer screen bugs out) Uh-oh!
Here I am, baby. You miss these?
Oh, damn it!
Oh, Leonard! Already?
No, no! No-no-no! The screen froze. It‰Ûªs probably just buffering, just give it a second.
Fine.
So, how are your mom and dad?
Yeah, I really don‰Ûªt want to talk about my parents now.
Yeah. Sure, sure.
If your video‰Ûªs frozen, try resetting the TCP/IP stack.
Oh! I didn‰Ûªt even think of that. Thanks.
You‰Ûªre welcome. Please let me know when you and your girlfriend are done hogging the bandwidth for your self-abuse. I‰Ûªm trying to stream a movie on Netflix in here.
Amy‰Ûªs apartment. Amy is playing a harp.
Five, six, seven, eight. Tall and tan and young and lovely, the girl from Ipanema goes walking, and when she passes, each one she passes goes‰Û_
(Knock, knock, knock) Amy. (Knock, knock, knock) Amy. (Knock, knock, knock) Amy.
Oh‰Û_ You are aware that your ritualistic knocking behaviour is symptomatic of obsessive compulsive disorder?
Is not. Is not, is not.
Denial. Denial, denial. Come in.
Thank you.
Would you like to hear me play a bossa nova standard on the harp?
No.
How about the theme song to the classic television show Diff‰Ûªrent Strokes? Now the world don‰Ûªt move to the beat‰Û_
No.
Well, that‰Ûªs every song I know. What‰Ûªs up?
You‰Ûªre good friends with Penny, right?
