You are, but you‰Ûªve got kind of a big personality, with your flashy clothes and your Woody Allen swagger.
You know, maybe she‰Ûªd be more comfortable meeting a girl first.
Good idea. Bernadette?
What the hell?
Well, you‰Ûªre very pretty. That could be intimidating to another woman.
Oh, yeah.
Hey, you don‰Ûªt think I‰Ûªm pretty enough to scare your girlfriend?
Calm down, Bernie. You‰Ûªre very scary.
It should be me.
Why? So you can make jokes about cutting open my brain?

A, that was not a joke, that was a sincere request. And B, more importantly, I was the outsider to this group, and I know how frightening that can be. But you guys took me in and made me feel loved, like I was family.
Fine, I‰Ûªll do it.
Raj‰Ûªs apartment.
So, after I started dating Sheldon, I met Leonard, and then everybody else, and they‰Ûªve all been so wonderful to me.
That‰Ûªs really nice to hear.
Maybe next week, we could all get together.
Oh, Lucy, you don‰Ûªt have to answer that. Don‰Ûªt put her on the spot. She hates that. Am I right? Tell her how much you hate being put on the spot. Go ahead, tell her.
Ignore him. He‰Ûªs a little nervous ‰Ûªcause he doesn‰Ûªt think I understand the severity of your social anxiety.
What the? Are you crazy? You can‰Ûªt talk about social anxiety to someone who has social anxiety. It makes them socially anxious!
Excuse me, but I‰Ûªm a neurobiologist. I think I‰Ûªm a little more qualified than you to understand what‰Ûªs not working in your girlfriend‰Ûªs brain!

Don‰Ûªt call her my girlfriend. We haven‰Ûªt discussed whether or not we‰Ûªre girlfriend or boyfriend yet. Now that it‰Ûªs out there, are you my girlfriend? By the way, if you say no, I‰Ûªll never be happy again. Not to put you on the spot.
I think I have to go to the bathroom.
We might as well go ahead and eat. She‰Ûªs not coming back anytime soon.
A store.
This is ridiculous, we‰Ûªre shopping for a party and this store doesn‰Ûªt even have a party section.
Yeah, it does, and here we are.
You know, I have to say, Penny, I don‰Ûªt understand why you of all people are encouraging Leonard to do this.
Well, I‰Ûªm his girlfriend, of course I‰Ûªm gonna support him.
Yeah, well, you‰Ûªre his girlfriend for now. You know, maybe you‰Ûªre not aware of this, but there is a rich tradition of men at sea finding comfort in each other‰Ûªs arms and britches.
Honey, this is a big deal for Leonard, okay? He gets to work with Stephen Hawking. Who, by the way, will not be on the boat. I checked it out.

It‰Ûªs not that big of an opportunity. And even if Hawking‰Ûªs theories are correct, all they prove is where the universe came from, why everything exists and what its ultimate end will be. I mean, me? I‰Ûªm interested in the big questions.
Oh, my God, Sheldon the genius is jealous of Leonard.
I‰Ûªm not jealous. I‰Ûªm just very unhappy that good things are happening for him and not happening for me.

Look, sweetie, this is a natural thing to feel, okay? But just because good things are happening to Leonard doesn‰Ûªt take anything away from you. You know what? Let me tell you a little story. Once there was a girl who worked at the Cheesecake Factory, and she wasn‰Ûªt very good at her job.
It was you.
It wasn‰Ûªt me. But she was also an actress, and we were both up for the same part in a toothpaste commercial. She got it. Look, I was so jealous. But instead of ripping out her fake blonde hair‰Û_
You ripped out your own fake blonde hair.
I, looked her in the eye, smiled and said, I‰Ûªm happy for you. Because that‰Ûªs what friends do.
They lie so they don‰Ûªt look petty.
Yeah.
How?
Like this. I am so happy for you.
Wow. No wonder you didn‰Ûªt get that toothpaste commercial.
Raj‰Ûªs apartment.
Hey.
Hi.
I want to apologize for Amy last night. She was completely out of line. Are you, are you not speaking to me or did the screen freeze again?
Amy wasn‰Ûªt the problem.
Okay. I know. It was me. I, I pushed too hard. I‰Ûªm sorry.
Thank you.
You know, I, I‰Ûªve been thinking that maybe meeting somebody one-on-one is too intense, so Friday night, my friends are having a party.
A party?
A little one. It‰Ûªs, it‰Ûªs a farewell for Leonard, so all the attention will be on him. If you wear something brown and sit on the couch, they won‰Ûªt even know you‰Ûªre there.
I‰Ûªm not sure.
Oh, please?
Raj.
Come on. Don‰Ûªt make me beg. And I‰Ûªm from India, so I know how to do it.
Okay.
Yeah, thank you! This means a lot to me. My friends are like my family. Unless you don‰Ûªt like them, in which case, they‰Ûªre dead to me.
The apartment.
So, have you ever spent a long time on a boat before?
Yeah.
Are you referring to the time we got stuck on the Small World ride at Disneyland?
Yeah.
I‰Ûªm proud of you, Leonard. Working out on the North Sea for months, that‰Ûªs really something.
I know. As far as science goes, this is the adventure of a lifetime.
Maybe your lifetime. I went to space.
It‰Ûªs not a competition.
You‰Ûªre right, you‰Ûªre right. I‰Ûªm really proud of you, and I‰Ûªm gonna miss you when you‰Ûªre gone. And space beats water.
Rajesh, I thought Lucy was coming.
She is. She‰Ûªs just running a little late. You know how it is, girls always fussing about their hair, their makeup. She‰Ûªll be here. Just give it a rest, okay?

Um, can I have your attention, everyone? (Clinks glass) That‰Ûªs, uh, B-flat, for those who don‰Ûªt have perfect pitch. I would like to propose a toast to my best friend, Dr. Leonard Hofstadter. He has been presented with a wonderful opportunity, and I couldn‰Ûªt be happier for him.
Thank you, Sheldon. That must‰Ûªve been very hard for you to say.
Well, I mean it. I‰Ûªm really happy for you. And that‰Ûªs how you get a toothpaste commercial. Cheers.
Cheers.
Cheers.
It was really nice of you to try to be happy for Leonard.
Thank you.
It must‰Ûªve killed you when I went to space.
Oh, no.
Buddy, you okay? Oh, man.
What‰Ûªs going on?
Uh, go ahead. Read it.
Raj, I can‰Ûªt come to the party. This is all just too much for me. I don‰Ûªt think we should see each other any more. Sorry. Lucy.
Excuse me.
Raj, I‰Ûªm so sorry.
Me, too.
It did not kill me when you went to space. Monkeys went to space.
Penny‰Ûªs car, outside the Airport.
Well, here we are.
Yep. I‰Ûªm really gonna miss you.
I‰Ûªm gonna miss you, too.
Penny, we‰Ûªre in the red zone. The white zone is for loading and unloading. We‰Ûªre breaking the law.
Okay, there‰Ûªs no space in the white zone, so‰Û_
Anyway, we can e-mail, and I think the phone connections are pretty good.
All right, you have to get out of the car right now. I‰Ûªm not going to jail for you.
Would you just relax?
Oh, I see a space in the white zone. Quick, circle the airport.
Did you bring enough inhalers?
Yeah.
And, uh, extra Dramamine? You remember what happened on It‰Ûªs a Small World.
I‰Ûªm covered.
Okay.
Oh, dear Lord, a police officer‰Ûªs glancing in our direction. We‰Ûªve been made.
Calm down. I‰Ûªm getting out. I have something I want to give you.
Oh, Leonard.
It‰Ûªs just a heart-shaped locket with a picture of Leonard‰Ûªs face in it. He got it at the mall on clearance. Now move, move, move.
I love you.
I love you, too.
Don‰Ûªt worry, Officer. They just love each other. We‰Ûªre not smuggling drugs.
Raj‰Ûªs apartment.
Raj, it‰Ûªs Penny. Are you in there?
Hang on.
Hey. I‰Ûªm just coming back from the airport. I wanted to see how you‰Ûªre doing.
That‰Ûªs, that‰Ûªs very nice of you. Uh, come, come. Come on in.
Can‰Ûªt stay long. I left Sheldon in the car with the window cracked open. He‰Ûªs gonna go through that activity book in, like, 30 seconds, so‰Û_ Are you okay?
No.
Oh. I‰Ûªm so sorry.
No. It‰Ûªs my fault. You know, I finally found someone who was right for me, and I, I drove her away.
Oh, Raj.
Penny, I, I miss her already.
I know how you feel. I miss Leonard, too.
What‰Ûªs like, what is wrong with me? Why, why can‰Ûªt I ever have love?
You will.
No, I, I won‰Ûªt. I‰Ûªm, I‰Ûªm unlovable.
That‰Ûªs just the booze talking.
No, it‰Ûªs not. I haven‰Ûªt had a drink since last night.
You‰Ûªre talking to me.
I am. And now I‰Ûªm crying for a whole different reason!
Oh, me, too.
Penny‰Ûªs apartment.
So I guess what I‰Ûªm saying is I get where Lucy‰Ûªs coming from.
That‰Ûªs great. Do you want some wine?

Uh, no, water‰Ûªs fine. Anyhow, I‰Ûªve been thinking about it a lot and, and I totally see why Lucy did what she did. I pushed too hard. But you know what? If I back off and give her enough space, maybe there‰Ûªs still a future for us. Yeah, the funny thing about life is that, you know, sometimes‰Û_
Does he ever shut up?

‰Û_ but then it turns good again, and that means it‰Ûªs better than if it had never been bad for a while. I know that now, thing‰Ûªs aren‰Ûªt good, they are in fact very very bad but at least my heart is starting to heal. Slowly but surely. And oh how I cried. It was like a little, uh, thunderstorm on my face. But I‰Ûªm a man, okay? So I need to pull myself together, pick up a pen and get it all out in my journal. I mean, it‰Ûªs not all bad, right? Having my heart broken has allowed me to finally speak in front of you, so, you know, a silver lining‰Û_.
On the deck of a ship on the North Sea, in the middle of a storm. Leonard is on a sat-phone.
Sheldon, it‰Ûªs not a great time, what do you want?
Hello to you, too. I‰Ûªm sorry, but this is important.
What is it?
Back to the Future II was in the Back to the Future III case, and Back to the Future III was, get this, in the Back to the Future II case.
So?
So, did you do that, or am I in the house with an intruder?
Sheldon, I got to go inside. It‰Ûªs getting rough out here.
You‰Ûªre dodging the question, I knew it was you. What was that?
What was what?
This isn‰Ûªt a very good connection, but it sounded like someone just released a kraken.
Okay, I‰Ûªm hanging up now. You know there‰Ûªs no such thing as a k‰Û_ (Leonard is attacked and dragged into the sea by a huge tentacle. Sheldon wakes up in bed.)
No!
Penny‰Ûªs apartment door.
(Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Penny.
What‰Ûªs the matter?
Um, well, I was worried that you might be missing Leonard. And that might be causing you to have bad dreams, like the kind you‰Ûªd get if you watched Clash of the Titans right before you went to bed.
Sweetie, did you have a bad dream?
To be honest, I did.
Aw.
Back to the Future II was in the Back to the Future III case. Leonard did it.
Good night.
No, wait. Perhaps I should sleep here so you don‰Ûªt miss Leonard as much, uh, ‰Ûªcause you‰Ûªre being kind of a baby about it.
You know what? That would make me feel better. Thank you.
You‰Ûªre welcome. Good night.
The cafeteria.
I think you‰Ûªd be pleased to hear that this morning in the parking garage I saw this oil stain on the ground that was shaped just like my ex-girlfriend, Lucy, and I didn‰Ûªt get upset at all.
I‰Ûªm proud of you.
Well, you should be, ‰Ûªcause she was looking good.
Dear Lord, you‰Ûªre an astronomer. Although you may have earthly woes, get your mind back on the stars. Gee, even the lowly dung beetle chooses to plot its course by using the Milky Way.
Is that true?

Everything I say is true. Now, of course, the dung beetle also enjoys eating faeces, living in faeces and making little balls out of faeces, so, you know, pick and choose which aspects of its lifestyle you want to embrace.
Come on, you can talk to girls now. It shouldn‰Ûªt be hard for you to meet someone new.
How can I meet someone new when everywhere I look, I see Lucy‰Ûªs face? Tell me you don‰Ûªt see her smile in the crust of this chicken pot pie.
Oh, will you stop it. Now, listen to me, there‰Ûªs a welcome party for incoming post-docs tonight. Go to it and meet someone who isn‰Ûªt made of grease or pie.
You think you‰Ûªre so cool because your wife is a person?
Look, Bernie‰Ûªs at a neuroscience conference with Amy, I‰Ûªll go with you.
You would do that for me?
Of course. You‰Ûªre my friend. I want you to be happy.
Thanks. Oh, Sheldon, since Amy‰Ûªs out of town, would you like to join us?
I want you to be happy, too, but not enough to do anything about it.
A hotel room.
Howie, stop. I can‰Ûªt talk like that. Amy‰Ûªs right here.
Sheldon, stop. For the last time, I will not bring home bed bugs.
The hotel‰Ûªs nice. There‰Ûªs a pool, a gym, the bar looks like fun.
Because I looked in the bed, and there are no bugs.
Aw, I love you, too. If I don‰Ûªt talk to you before you go to sleep, I‰Ûªll meet you in dreamland.
Good night. No, I will not consider sleeping in my garment bag.
The apartment.
Penny, did you ever wonder how Starfleet captains‰Û_
No.
Well, now that I‰Ûªve piqued your interest, welcome to the exciting world of 3D chess.
Why don‰Ûªt you just admit you only want to play this game because you always play it with Leonard and you miss him?
You overestimate his significance in my life.
Mmm.

Do I miss how he makes a face on my toaster waffle with syrup? No. Do I miss the way he fixes the zipper on my jacket when it gets stuck? I don‰Ûªt think so. Do I miss how we say good night to each other through the walls of our bedroom using Morse code? (Taps out No in morse code on the table)
Okay, I get it, I get it. You are an emotionless robot.
Well, I try.
All right, let‰Ûªs just get this stupid game over with.
Great. I‰Ûªll go first.
Okay.
By the way, how are you with zippers?
Why?
Well, I really need to go to the bathroom, and this one‰Ûªs gone all cattywampus.
The mixer party.
Wow, your work on jellyfish neural nets sounds so interesting.
It is. You can download my paper off the university server.
I will. You can download my paper on the Van Allen Belts from the university server as well.
I will.
All right.
How‰Ûªd it go?
Well, if you like dry, factual statements interspersed with painful moments of silence, it was bananas.
Check it out. Mrs. Davis from Human Resources is here. She‰Ûªs probably on the lookout for sexual harassment.
Oh, great. There go my chances of being sexually harassed.
I heard her husband left her for a hot, young undergrad.
That‰Ûªs so much better than the old, ugly ones.
Mr. Wolowitz, Dr. Koothrappali.
Mrs. Davis, nice to see you.
You know, I recently read a fascinating article on infidelity among penguins.
Okay.
So if the fact that your husband left you makes you feel unattractive, just remember, penguins get cheated on, and they‰Ûªre adorable.
It was better when you couldn‰Ûªt talk to women.
The hotel bar.
I was thinking of going to the lecture on posterior cingulate cortex lesions in the formation of autobiographical memory.
Oh, brain lesions are fascinating. Unless they‰Ûªre yours, then they‰Ûªre a drag.
To the advancement of science.
And to the sick and dying who make it possible.
This is fun, we never really get to talk shop with Penny around. We usually just end up talking about boys.
Which is fine, but it‰Ûªs nice to mix it up with a little intellectual conversation.
From the two gentlemen at the bar.
Oh, my gosh, boys bought us drinks, boys bought us drinks. Thank you, thank you, thank you so much.
Be cool.
You be cool. Guys are hitting on us, and not just to get to Penny.
You‰Ûªre right. Thank you.
The apartment.
Ooh. Bad move.
Really? Why?
My queen can now take your rook from below.
So that means I lose, right? It‰Ûªs over?
If I make this move, but I won‰Ûªt because we‰Ûªre having too much fun.
Okay, let‰Ûªs take a break.
We‰Ûªre all out of alcohol.
I wasn‰Ûªt going to get alcohol. Gosh, I wonder what Leonard‰Ûªs doing right now. I miss him so much.

Well, if you‰Ûªd like, we could call him. I mean that you could call him. As I‰Ûªve explained, the absence of my friends does not cause me pain. As rock and roll bad boy Paul Simon once said, I am a rock, I am an i-i-i-island.
I‰Ûªm calling him.
Oh, goodie, put him on speaker phone.

character: Leonard (on board boat, at a party, dancing)
line: Excuse me, ladies, my pants are buzzing. North Sea, how can I kelp you?
Leonard?
Penny? Hey, it‰Ûªs Penny. Everybody say hi to Penny.
Hi, Penny!
Wow, it sounds like you‰Ûªre having a good time.
Best time of my life.
Isn‰Ûªt it five thirty in the morning there?
Is it? Hey, everybody, it‰Ûªs five thirty in the morning!
Uh, okay, well, we were just calling you because we were missing you.
Iceberg!
Uh-oh, hang on.
Are you in danger?
No, it‰Ûªs a drinking game. Whenever we see an iceberg, we take a shot!
Berg! Berg! Berg! Berg! Berg! Berg!
Leonard, Leonard? I cannot believe we were missing that jerk.
You were.
The hotel bar.
So what happened? How‰Ûªd it go?
It‰Ûªs fine. I thanked them again and let them know we‰Ûªre not available.
So I can drink this without having to give up the goodies?
Yes, it‰Ûªs all cool. Although, if you wanted to talk to one of them, no one would blame you.
And why would no one blame me?
I don‰Ûªt know what I‰Ûªm saying.
Well, it sounds like you‰Ûªre saying that I could do better than Sheldon.
Boy, these drinks are strong. Hoo, mama, I‰Ûªm gonna be huggin‰Ûª the toilet tonight.
No, tell me, I want to know what you meant by that.
I just meant that you‰Ûªre not married and your boyfriend‰Ûªs kind of, Sheldon.
And your husband is extremely Howard. What‰Ûªs your point?
Sorry. I have no point. That was a stupid thing to say. Can we please just go back to having a nice time?
We could, but unfortunately my brain is lesion-free and I remember that rotten thing you just said about my sweet baboo.
Come on. I apologize. Can we please just let it go?
Sure.
Thanks.
Your husband‰Ûªs weird and his clothes are ridiculous.
The apartment.
I can‰Ûªt believe it. All this time I‰Ûªve been doing nothing but sit around and miss that guy. And you know what the worst part is?
That you‰Ûªre having to process your emotional pain without vodka?
No. Yeah. But you know what the second-worst part is? He does not miss me at all.
Allow me to comfort you. At least you‰Ûªve got your health.
Really? That, that‰Ûªs it? That‰Ûªs comforting?
Um, uh, in a hundred years, you‰Ûªll both be dead and it won‰Ûªt matter?
No. Come on, you‰Ûªre supposed to say, of course he misses you, the only reason he‰Ûªs partying is to cover up his pain.
Oh, no, I don‰Ûªt think that‰Ûªs true at all.
This is ridiculous. Why am I upset just because he‰Ûªs off having a good time?
Well, perhaps you‰Ûªre obsessively picturing him engaged in drunken coitus with another woman. Is that it? Did I get it right?
Okay, that, that‰Ûªs great. You can stop trying to make me feel better now.
Actually, I can‰Ûªt. Before Leonard left, he made me promise that I‰Ûªd take care of you.
He did?
Yes.
Oh, that‰Ûªs really sweet.
Plus, if I do a good job, he said he‰Ûªd bring me back a sailor‰Ûªs cap.
Well, now I miss him even more.
Well, if it‰Ûªs any consolation, I‰Ûªm sure Leonard‰Ûªs tormented every moment he‰Ûªs away from your warm embrace and cherry lips.
Thanks.
Oh, seriously?
The mixer.
Uh, excuse me, Mrs. Davis?
What?
I‰Ûªd like to apologize for being insensitive. And for possibly making penguins seem like jerks, because 99% of them are stand-up guys.
Forget about it.
You know, you, you and I, you and I have a lot in common.
Is that right?
Oh, yes, I, I too am in the throes of heartbreak. Okay, fine, I‰Ûªll tell you about it.
The apartment.
Here is a hot beverage to comfort you. It‰Ûªs in a to-go cup. Make of that what you will.
Come on. It‰Ûªs still early. Let‰Ûªs do something.
Well, I have been toying around with an idea for 4D chess.
How about we just talk?
All right. In 4D chess‰Û_
No. Come on, let‰Ûªs talk about our lives. Tell me something about you I don‰Ûªt know.
I own nine pairs of pants.
Okay, that, that‰Ûªs a good start, but I was thinking maybe something a little more personal.
I see. I own nine pairs of underpants.
How about I go first?
But I don‰Ûªt want to know how many underpants you own. Although, based on the floor of your bedroom, I‰Ûªd say it‰Ûªs a thousand.

Okay, look, here‰Ûªs something people do not know about me. When I first moved out to L.A., I did a topless scene in a low-budget horror movie about a killer gorilla. Ugh! After I did it, I felt so ashamed. Thankfully, that thing never came out.
I‰Ûªve seen that. Yeah. Serial Apeist. Howard found it online the day we met you.
Oh, God.
And it was literally the moment you walked out the door. But I see the type of personal revelations you‰Ûªre going for. Okay, here‰Ûªs one I thought I‰Ûªd take to the grave.
Okay.
Hmm. A while back, YouTube changed its user interface from a star-based rating system to a thumbs-up rating system. I tell people I‰Ûªm okay with it, but I‰Ûªm really not.
That‰Ûªs your big revelation?
Yes. Whew, I feel ten pounds lighter.
Okay, you know what? I give up. I‰Ûªm going to bed.
Here‰Ûªs something else you don‰Ûªt know about me. You just hurt my feelings.
What did I do?
I opened up and shared something deeply upsetting to me, and you treated it as if it were nothing.
I, I didn‰Ûªt think it was a big deal.
It is to me; that‰Ûªs the point.
Sheldon, you are right. I‰Ûªm really sorry. I should‰Ûªve known better.
Your apology is accepted.
Thank you. How about a hug?
How about a hearty handshake?
Come on.
Now I know how you felt getting mauled by that sex-crazed gorilla.
The hotel room.
Good night.
Mm-hmm. It was rather flattering to have strangers send us drinks.
Yeah, that felt nice.
Maybe tomorrow morning we put on some hot pants and see if we can score us some free omelettes.
So, hypothetically, if, if we were to have gone with them, which one would you have picked?
I think I would have gone with the short one with the goofy haircut.
Oh, good, ‰Ûªcause I liked the tall thin one. He seemed intelligent, kind of a loner, maybe a little sexually inexperienced, like I‰Ûªd have to teach him a thing or two.
Not my guy. I caught him staring at my rack. It‰Ûªd be nice to be with a man who wants to know what‰Ûªs underneath my cardigan. FYI, it‰Ûªs another cardigan.
Your short sexed-up guy kind of sounds like Howard.
Your brainy virgin kind of sounds like Sheldon.
Good night.
The mixer.
All right, Dr. Koothrappali, it‰Ûªs been nice talking to you, but I need to go home and relieve my babysitter.
Yeah, I can relate to being a single parent. I have a dog.
Yeah, it‰Ûªs exactly the same thing. Good night.

Mrs. Davis, I, uh, I must confess, I came here tonight in a futile attempt to pick up some lonely postdoc, but instead I got to connect with you at a human level. That‰Ûªs a much better evening. You‰Ûªre a lovely person.
Are you hitting on me?
No, no, no, that would be crazy. I mean, if I were hitting on you, you‰Ûªd know it ‰Ûªcause you‰Ûªd feel uncomfortable and a little sad for me.
You‰Ûªre sweet. Good night, Dr. Koothrappali.
Good night.
Looks like she accepted your apology.
And then some. I think we had a moment.
Oh, please, you did not have a moment.
Who died and made you king of moments?
Okay, fine. Let‰Ûªs say there was a moment.
There was.
There wasn‰Ûªt. But, but even if there was, what are you gonna do about it?
I will slowly seduce her until she falls helpless into my bed, hungry for the pleasure only I can give her.
So nothing.
No, not a thing.
A bathroom shower.
Ah, I‰Ûªm so glad the police finally caught that psychotic genetically engineered ape.
That is my girlfriend. I swear to God.
Leonard! Leonard! Leonard! Leonard!
Aaaaaaah!
The stairwell
And here‰Ûªs another interesting weather fact.
Another? Great.
Changes in jet streams can affect the speed at which the Earth rotates on its axis, so bad weather can actually make the day longer.
Well, there must be a hell of a storm somewhere.
Joke if you must, but you‰Ûªre going to miss these moments. With Leonard home in a few days, this was your last time driving me to the grocery store.
You know, I will miss this.

I‰Ûªll tell you what, if my apples are mealy, we‰Ûªll hit the produce section for one last crazy blowout. Heck, you can even push the cart. Please don‰Ûªt take my looking forward to Leonard‰Ûªs return as criticism of the job you‰Ûªve been doing in his absence.
I won‰Ûªt.
That criticism will come later in your report card.
Yeah, I didn‰Ûªt stay for the detention, I‰Ûªm not gonna read the report card.
Hello.
Leonard! Hi!
Keep your voice down.
Oh, my God. You weren‰Ûªt supposed to be here till Sunday.
We finished the experiment early, so I thought I‰Ûªd come home and surprise you.
Oh, my gosh, why are we whispering?
I didn‰Ûªt tell Sheldon, so we could have a few days alone.

That‰Ûªs the wrong arm for a heart attack, doofus.
My point is, I‰Ûªm sure there are things about me that would drive you crazy if you had to deal with them all day long.
Like looking me in the eye and lying to me?
Oh, well, come on, where am I supposed to look when I lie to you?
Find somewhere else to sleep tonight.
Bernie‰Û_
If it makes you feel any better, Amy and I are fine. I mean, really good.
The cafeteria.
So, boys, how was the pyjama party? You guys jump on the bed and sing into hair brushes?
It wasn‰Ûªt a pyjama party. It was just a couple of bros hanging out, giggling, eating cookie dough and watching Princess Bride.
Please, stop talking.
As you wish.
I mean, you know, Sheldon, none of this would‰Ûªve happened if I hadn‰Ûªt tried to help you.
Uh, it also wouldn‰Ûªt have happened if, in the early universe, hydrogen was a little more common or a little less common. This is fun. Your turn.
Gentlemen.
Amy.
Hey.
Hello.
That was kind of icy. You two okay?
Oh, we‰Ûªre fine. As Howard advised, she‰Ûªs merely respecting our professional boundaries.
Smart. Take relationship advice from a man who spent last night braiding Raj‰Ûªs hair.
Yeah, you make a good point. It would appear I was worried for nothing. Look at her, desperately wishing she was over here at the cool table. Don‰Ûªt worry, little moth. The flame will come to you.
Oh, uh, on the off chance that Bernadette doesn‰Ûªt call back and apologize, how do you feel about Mexican food for dinner tonight?
I don‰Ûªt know. Sounds kind of heavy.
That‰Ûªs ‰Ûªcause you always fill up on chips.
And this is Dr. Gunderson from Stockholm.
Ah, Sweden. Yeah, home of my favourite Muppet and, uh, second favourite meatball. Okay, the Nordic reputation for lack of humour is well-founded. Boy, is his name Gunderson or No-Funderson?
Where are we going with this, Dr. Cooper?
Oh, please, I‰Ûªm your boyfriend. You call me Sheldon. That‰Ûªs right, I am in a boy-girl relationship with this cute little lump of wool.
Sheldon.

It‰Ûªs a physical relationship, too. Hand-holding, hugging, even on hot days. Ow. Okay, here‰Ûªs a new one. Apparently now we kick each other in the shin under the table. How do you like it when I do it to you? Not so much, huh?
Amy‰Ûªs lab.

Test subject D7, aka Betsy, fear response study. Image number one, Frenchman on bicycle carrying baguettes. No visible reaction. Image number two, sousaphone. Still no reaction. Okay. Let‰Ûªs kick things up a notch. Image number three, crocodile with a mouthful of monkeys. Okay, now we‰Ûªre talking.
Dr. Fowler?
What do you want, Sheldon?
Well, I‰Ûªm done with work, so‰Û_ ugh!
Oh, sorry, sorry, sorry. Sorry, uh, better?
Oh, baguettes. Yes, I like baguettes. What exactly are you doing?
Determining baseline fear levels in capuchin monkeys by measuring their response to visual stimuli.

So, goofing off. As I was saying, I‰Ûªm done with work and Leonard‰Ûªs not. So good news, you get to take me home. Play your cards right, I‰Ûªll let you drive me past the lot where the buses park at night.
I can‰Ûªt leave now, Sheldon. I‰Ûªm very busy. Besides, why would I want to do you a favour after the way you treated me in the cafeteria? Image number four, boa constrictor.
What on earth are you talking about? My behaviour in the cafeteria was delightful. Maybe your friend Gunderson needs to head over to IKEA and assemble a sense of humour.
You embarrassed me in front of my colleagues on my first day here. Image number five, kitten in a teacup.
Aw. Embarrassed you?
You know what? I don‰Ûªt have time for this. Find another way home.
I‰Ûªm starting to get the sense that you‰Ûªre angry with me.
Really? What tipped you off?
Couple things, actually. Your tone of voice, your body language‰Û_
Get out.
Well, now, that.
Image number six, woman giving birth.
Bleugh!
The apartment.
It‰Ûªs nine o‰Ûªclock, where you been?
Oh, I had to take the bus home. Fell asleep and missed my stop.
Oh, no.
Did you know that Los Angeles has a Little Sri Lanka?
I did not.
Well, I do now. They‰Ûªre a lovely people. Although terrifying when you wake up face-to-face with them. If you‰Ûªre hungry, I brought home some mutton and coconut milk.
Why‰Ûªd you get that? You hate lamb.
I was asking for directions. Apparently, there was a communication problem.
I thought Amy was gonna drive you home.

Yeah, I thought so, too, but she‰Ûªs acting very strangely. I was discussing it with a Sri Lankan fellow on the bus, and he hypothesized that a tiger may have recently run across her shadow. Although he may have just been trying to drum up business for his brother-in-law‰Ûªs witch doctor practice.
Okay, Sheldon, what happened between you and Amy?
Well, can you believe she said I embarrassed her?
Yeah.
But you didn‰Ûªt even hear the details.
Sheldon, I‰Ûªve known you a long time, and I‰Ûªm going to tell you this with all the love I can possibly muster. Amy‰Ûªs right. You‰Ûªre wrong.
But you don‰Ûªt even know‰Û_
Doesn‰Ûªt matter.
But, now, but in my defence‰Û_
Doesn‰Ûªt matter.
You‰Ûªre not listening to my side of it.
Okay, fine, Sheldon. What is your side?
Well‰Û_
Nope, got to go with Amy on this one.
Raj‰Ûªs apartment.
Ooh, shrimp was spicy.
You want a TUMS?
You got the tropical fruit kind?
No, if I buy those, I just go through them like candy.
Tell me about it. One time, I swear I pooped out a stick of chalk. (Knock on door) I‰Ûªll get it.
Thanks.
Hi.
Oh, hi.
I may have overreacted.
Yeah, well, I didn‰Ûªt handle it so great, either.
It‰Ûªs just sometimes I feel like you enjoy spending time with your friends more than with me.
That‰Ûªs not true.

It‰Ûªs not? You spend all day together at work, and then you all hang out at night playing games, going to the comic book store. Last week, you two got a couples massage. So, when you said you wouldn‰Ûªt want to spend that much time with me, it really hurt my feelings.
Oh, wow. Yeah, no, I get that. I‰Ûªm so sorry. Starting tomorrow, I am turning over a new leaf. Time with you is my number one priority.
Why tomorrow?
Well, we‰Ûªre real close to finishing off the new Batman game.
It is awesome. Uh, you should probably go after her.
Should I go after you?
No!
Thanks for getting me in trouble.
Amy‰Ûªs apartment.
(Knock, knock, knock) Amy. (Knock, knock, knock) Amy. (Knock, knock, knock) Amy.
Sheldon, what are you doing here so late?
I couldn‰Ûªt sleep because I kept thinking about what happened earlier between us. Also, I had one heck of a bus nap. Oh, speaking of which, do you want some mutton and coconut milk?
No.
Well, I cannot give this stuff away.
What do you want?

Amy, this isn‰Ûªt easy to say. All relationships are difficult, but even more so when you‰Ûªre in one with a person who struggles with everyday social interactions. And frankly, who can strike some people as being kind of a weirdo.
Sheldon, you‰Ûªre not a weirdo.

I wasn‰Ûªt speaking about me. I mean, honestly, there‰Ûªs no telling what will set you off. You know, introducing myself as your boyfriend. Giving you the opportunity to drive me home. Breaking the ice with your colleagues using ethnic humour, the funniest kind of humour.
What‰Ûªs your point?
My point is, we‰Ûªre a couple, and I like you for who you are, quirks and all.
I like you, too.

Well, I should hope so. I don‰Ûªt see anyone else banging on this door to put up with your nonsense. Not even a good-bye? You see, that‰Ûªs the kind of thing that makes people think you‰Ûªre weird. Poor kid. She just doesn‰Ûªt see it.
The Cheesecake Factory Bar.
I‰Ûªm not apologizing to Howard. He can come beg me on his knees.
Sheldon, too. If I see him at work, I‰Ûªm just going to ignore him.
All right, don‰Ûªt worry. I talked to Leonard. He is gonna sit the guys down and set them straight.
The apartment.
Laser‰Ûªs warmed up.
Pull.
Yeah!
The Cheesecake Factory
What are you working on?
Can‰Ûªt talk. In the zone.
Do you know what he‰Ûªs doing?

Could be anything. Last time he was like this, he figured out electron transport in graphene. The time before that, he was making a list of who‰Ûªs allowed in his tree fort if fe ever gets one. Still can‰Ûªt believe I didn‰Ûªt make the cut.
Uh, Sheldon, you want to take a break? Your food‰Ûªs ready.
No, no, what are you doing? He‰Ûªs both happy and quiet. It‰Ûªs like seeing a unicorn and Bigfoot at the same time.
Sorry we‰Ûªre so late. Bernadette got stuck at work.
Great news. A raccoon virus just crossed the species barrier and now can infect humans.
Why is that great news?
In the pharmaceutical business we have a saying, mo‰Ûª infections, mo‰Ûª money.
Wait, Maybe you want to wash your little raccoon hands first.
Oh, calm down. If I had it, I‰Ûªd be dead already.
Guys, listen up.
Can‰Ûªt listen, zone. Also don‰Ûªt care.
Next week is the anniversary of my first date with Bernadette.
Really don‰Ûªt care.
I want to do something special, and I was hoping you guys could be a part of it.
Aw, what horrible thing are you trying to make up for?
Just putting something in the bank for what horrible thing I do next.
Ah.
Look, she‰Ûªs gonna be back any second, so here‰Ûªs the deal. I‰Ûªm writing a song, and I was hoping we could all play it for her together.
Aw.
Oh, I love that.
That is so beautiful.
Sheldon?
When did we get to the Cheesecake Factory?
The stairwell
It‰Ûªs really sweet what Howard wants to do for Bernadette.
Yeah. Hey, how come you‰Ûªve never done anything romantic to celebrate our first date?
Well, for starters, you‰Ûªve broken up with me so many times, which first date are we talking about?
Ooh, somebody call the burn ward. And back to the zone.
And besides, I do romantic things for you all the time. Can you even name one romantic thing you‰Ûªve done for me?
I can name tons.
Sex doesn‰Ûªt count.
Oh. I know, what about that bed-and-breakfast?
Well, I took you there. All you did was‰Û_
I know what I did. I bet they had to throw out that rocking chair. You know, I can be romantic if I want to.
It‰Ûªs fine. And also not true.
Okay, just you wait and see. I‰Ûªm gonna romance your freakin‰Ûª ass off.
That‰Ûªs beautiful. Is that Shakespeare?
Sheldon?
Zone.
He‰Ûªll figure it out when he falls off the roof.
The apartment.

Sheldon, I know you‰Ûªre in the zone, but do you want some tea? All right, I can‰Ûªt believe I‰Ûªm gonna say this, but you haven‰Ûªt spoken in hours and I‰Ûªm starting to get worried. Please say something.
Leonard, prepare to be humbled and weep at the glory of my genius.
Nope, it was better before.
Look at it. I feel like my mind just made a baby. And it‰Ûªs beautiful. It‰Ûªs not like human babies, which are loud and covered in goop.
Holy crap, Sheldon, did you just figure out a method for synthesizing a new stable super-heavy element?

Did I? Well, that can‰Ûªt be right. No one‰Ûªs ever done that before. Except me, because I just did it. Sheldon and his brain, yeah. Sheldon and his brain, yeah. Sheldon and his brain, yeah. Sheldon and his brain, yeah. Sheldon and his brain‰Û_
Yeah, definitely better before.
The cafeteria.
So I‰Ûªm almost done writing the song for Bernadette. Are you cool playing the cello?
If by cool you mean willing to, yes. If by cool you mean cool, clearly you‰Ûªve never seen me play the cello.
Great. Will you play the ukulele?
Of course. I‰Ûªd be happy to shred it on my ax.
Or you could just play your tiny, ridiculous guitar.
Fine. I will melt her heart. And her face.

Gentlemen. Uh, no doubt you heard about my little breakthrough. Now, if your plan is to hoist me on your shoulders and carry me around the cafeteria, please refrain. I don‰Ûªt care for heights, motion sickness or the thought of your necks touching my buttocks.
Seriously, congratulations, Sheldon.
Yeah, I read your paper online. That technique for creating a new heavy element is inspired.
Oh, well, thank you. Believe it or not, I just learned a Chinese research team at the Hubei Institute for Nuclear Physics ran a test on a cyclotron, and the results were extremely promising.
Sheldon, that‰Ûªs incredible.

Yeah, I know. They called it the greatest thing since the Communist party. Although I‰Ûªm pretty sure that the Communist party made them say that. I like China. See, they know how to keep people in line.
So, what happens next?
Oh, more testing, more success, more fame. Yeah, but don‰Ûªt worry, I will remain the same down-to-earth humble Joe I‰Ûªve always been.
Good to know.
Now give me that cookie, I discovered an element.
Penny‰Ûªs apartment.
Thank you so much for coming.
You called the right person. I believe I have the perfect romantic evening for you to give Leonard.
Okay, good, ‰Ûªcause I‰Ûªve been really struggling with this.
As I‰Ûªm sure you‰Ûªre aware, the quickest way to a man‰Ûªs heart is through his‰Û_
Pants, but Leonard says sex doesn‰Ûªt count.
Oh. You poor thing. You have one arrow in your quiver, and you just can‰Ûªt use it. Fortunately, another pathway to a man‰Ûªs heart is through his stomach.

I don‰Ûªt know if I want to cook for him. He‰Ûªs kind of a picky eater. I mean, it‰Ûªs too salty, it‰Ûªs too dry, it‰Ûªs too burnt and frozen at the same time. Okay, come on, what else would sweep you off your feet?

Well, I‰Ûªve always had this fantasy that involves dancing. The sexual chemistry between my partner and me is electric. But boy, oh, boy, does my father not approve until he sees us in the big dance competition.
Okay, that‰Ûªs just the plot for Dirty Dancing. What else would you love? Other than being lifted over Patrick Swayze‰Ûªs head.
Oh, oh, uh, you could, uh, stand outside his window with a boom box in the air.
That‰Ûªs from Say Anything.
Look, I‰Ûªm a lonely guy, I watch a lot of movies. Look, Penny, if you truly want to be romantic, it needs to come from you.
I get that, but why is this so hard?
Well, you‰Ûªve probably never had to do this stuff ‰Ûªcause you‰Ûªre young and beautiful and men have always thrown themselves at you.
Yeah, I‰Ûªm trying to be sad about that. I can‰Ûªt.
The apartment.
Let‰Ûªs see, what‰Ûªs next? Okay, here. This is the Magic Marker I was using when I made the discovery.
I don‰Ûªt think the Smithsonian‰Ûªs gonna want your marker.

And that‰Ûªs why you‰Ûªre not on a list for my tree fort. Ooh, guess who‰Ûªs getting an article written about him in Physics Today? I‰Ûªll give you a hint. You measured the diameter of his suspicious mole yesterday.
Sheldon, I‰Ûªm so proud of you.
Well, you should be. My discovery is spreading like wildfire. Unlike my mole, which is holding steady at the size of a navy bean.
What‰Ûªs next?
This is the very copy of The Handbook of Chemistry and Physics in which I looked up the reaction rates of mendelevium and‰Û_
And what?
No. No, no, no, no.
What‰Ûªs wrong?
I‰Ûªve made a horrible mistake.
What are you talking about?
This table, it‰Ûªs in square centimetres. I read it as square metres. You know what that means?
That Americans can‰Ûªt handle the metric system?
Amy, I was off by a factor of 10,000.
But the Chinese team found the element.
Yeah, well, they shouldn‰Ûªt have. My calculations were wrong. There must be some resonance between the elements I didn‰Ûªt know about.
So you just got lucky?
Sheldon Cooper does not get lucky.
You and me both, brother. It doesn‰Ûªt matter. The element was found because of you, and that‰Ûªs groundbreaking.
What matters is the greatest scientific achievement of my life is based on a blunder. I‰Ûªm not a genius, I‰Ûªm a fraud.
You know, Sheldon, in neuroscience, we‰Ûªre forever finding something in one part of the brain that we thought was someplace else.
Oh, great. Now I‰Ûªm worse than a fraud. I‰Ûªm practically a biologist.
Leonard‰Ûªs car.
There‰Ûªs nothing happy about it. I‰Ûªm being given credit that I don‰Ûªt deserve.
Oh, people get things they don‰Ûªt deserve all the time. Look at me with you.

No, Leonard, this is going to haunt me for the rest of my life. Every science classroom, every periodic table, every textbook, this mistake will be staring back at me. Like that time you let Koothrappali wax your eyebrows. I‰Ûªve got to find a way to stop this thing.
Buddy, I don‰Ûªt think you can. I mean, once it‰Ûªs out there, it‰Ûªs out there. This thing is like the science equivalent of a sex tape.
You know, frankly, I‰Ûªd prefer a sex tape.
You don‰Ûªt know what a sex tape is, do you?
No.
The cafeteria.
Make sure you guys get to the restaurant by eight. Bernadette‰Ûªs meeting me there at eight thirty and I don‰Ûªt want to blow the surprise.
We‰Ûªll be there.
Got it. Now, uh, I have a question about the song. I was thinking at some point I could bust out a little rap.
E-Ni-Ni-Ni-Ni-No.
Come on, come on, you haven‰Ûªt even heard it yet. Leonard, give me a beat.
I will not.
Oh, please?
No, I want this to be romantic.
It will be. I don‰Ûªt call anyone a ho, and the only time I use the phrase my bitch, I‰Ûªm referring to you.
There he is. (General applause)
Stop it. Stop celebrating me.
Woo!

And no woos. Oh, not you, Dr. Woo. You‰Ûªre fine. I want you all to know that you have no reason to applaud me. My so-called breakthrough wasn‰Ûªt the result of my genius. It was nothing more than a boneheaded mistake. So please refrain from praising me for it in the future.
Wait, I don‰Ûªt understand. They didn‰Ûªt find the element?
Oh, no, they found the element. (More applause) No, no, stop it. I don‰Ûªt need to take this admiration from the likes of you people. How do I make them stop loving me?
Invite them to live with us.
A restaurant.
Boy, Bernadette is gonna love this.
Yeah. It must be nice to have someone do something so romantic.
Okay, you know what‰Ûªs not romantic? Rubbing it in someone‰Ûªs face.
Actually, it can be, but I told you sex doesn‰Ûªt count.
I‰Ûªm getting worried about Bernadette. I‰Ûªm gonna call and check on her.
The National Science Foundation wants to give me a substantial grant.
Oh, that‰Ûªs a big deal.
I know. When will this nightmare end?
Hey, I get that you feel bad about all the attention, but still, what you did is amazing. We‰Ûªre really proud of you.
I‰Ûªm not.
You‰Ûªre not?

Sheldon, I‰Ûªve been thinking about it, and you‰Ûªre right. You don‰Ûªt deserve any credit. All you did was misread some numbers on a table. A very easy table, too. Honestly, I‰Ûªm embarrassed for you.
That‰Ûªs the most romantic thing I‰Ûªve ever heard.
Damn it, everyone‰Ûªs better at this than me.
Congratulations, Dr. Fowler. You just made the fort.
Guys, there was an accident at Bernie‰Ûªs lab.
Oh, my God, is she okay?
Yeah, but she‰Ûªs at the hospital in quarantine.
What?
Poor Bernadette.
Oh, no.
I hate to pile on the bad news, but I just got a raise.
The hospital.
Oh, my God, Bernie, what happened?
Well, let‰Ûªs just say the next time you move a dozen vials of raccoon virus to the fridge, make two trips.
You‰Ûªre sure you‰Ûªre okay?
Yeah, it‰Ûªs just a precaution. If there was a problem, I‰Ûªd be throwing up out of my eyeballs by now. Sorry I messed up our date.
Oh, don‰Ûªt worry about it. I brought the date here. Guys, come on in.
What‰Ûªs all this?
Well, tonight is the anniversary of our first date, and I wanted to celebrate it by writing a song for you.
Howie.
Sheldon, get over here.
She might be contagious. Don‰Ûªt you think I‰Ûªm having a rough enough day?
Sheldon.
If I didn‰Ûªt have you, life would be blue, I‰Ûªd be Dr. Who without the TARDIS.
Is it me, or does she not look so good?
Shh.

A candle without a wick, a Watson without a Crick, I‰Ûªd be one of my outfits without a dick-ie. I‰Ûªd be cheese without the mac, Jobs without the Wozniak, I‰Ûªd be solving exponential equations that use bases not found on your calculator making it much harder to crack. I‰Ûªd be an atom without a bomb, a dot without the com, and I‰Ûªd probably still live with my mom.
And he‰Ûªd probably still live with his mom.

Ever since I met you, you turned my world around. You supported all my dreams and all my hopes. You‰Ûªre like uranium-235 and I‰Ûªm uranium-238, almost inseparable isotopes. I couldn‰Ûªt have imagined how good my life would get from the moment that I met you Bernadette.
Oh, Howie.

If I didn‰Ûªt have you life would be dreary, I‰Ûªd be string theory without any string. I‰Ûªd be binary code without a one, a cathode ray tube without an electron gun. I‰Ûªd be Firefly, Buffy and Avengers without Joss Whedon. I‰Ûªd speak a lot more Klingon, Heghlu‰ÛªmeH QaQ jajvam.
And he‰Ûªd definitely still live with his mom.

Ever since I met you, you turned my world around. You‰Ûªre my best friend and my lover. We‰Ûªre like changing electric and magnetic fields. You can‰Ûªt have one without the other. I couldn‰Ûªt have imagined how good my life would get from the moment that I met you, Bernadette.
Oh, we couldn‰Ûªt have imagined how good our lives would get from the moment that we met you, Bernadette.
Howie, that was amazing. Look, I‰Ûªm shaking.
She‰Ûªs sick, I knew it. Bye.
Penny‰Ûªs apartment.
I have to say, this is the best Top Ramen you‰Ûªve ever made.
I discovered a secret ingredient. The flavour packet. That sucker is well named. All right, lover boy, get ready, ‰Ûªcause there is a crap storm of romance coming your way.
Stop it, you‰Ûªre gonna make me cry. All right. You seem pretty confident.
Oh, I am. Maybe if you follow this trail, you‰Ûªll see why.
Oh, rose petals.
Yes. The most beautiful and shockingly expensive of all the flowers.
You made the bed? You really are pulling out all the stops.
Okay, I gave this a lot of thought, and I finally found something to show you how much I love you.
Oh, wow.
It‰Ûªs a first edition of Hitchhiker‰Ûªs Guide to the Galaxy. I remember it was your favourite book growing up.
This is great. It, thank you, it‰Ûªs, so much.
What?
Nothing. I love it.
No. Something‰Ûªs going on. What‰Ûªs wrong with it? I remember you saying how great it would be to have a first edition.
It‰Ûªs true, I did. I did say that. When we were at the used bookstore together and I saw the first edition and I bought it.
Oh, my God, I am the worst.
No, no, it‰Ûªs okay. It‰Ûªs really thoughtful.

No, it‰Ûªs not. I mean, what‰Ûªs thoughtful is everything you do. Here, you know what? Look at this. Look, here‰Ûªs the, the plane ticket you bought me when I was too poor to go home for the holidays. And the rose you left on my windshield just because. Here‰Ûªs the, the thank-you letter you wrote me after the first time I slept with you. All 11 pages of it.
I can‰Ûªt believe you saved all this stuff.
Of course I did. It‰Ûªs you.
Come here.
Oh.
Is that a pregnancy test?
Oh, yeah, just the first one. I didn‰Ûªt save them all.
The apartment.
I can‰Ûªt believe I read this table wrong. I blame you.
Me? What did I do?
You distract me. I‰Ûªve been distracted since the moment I met you.
Sorry.
Well, you should be. Because all I can think about is how much I want to kiss you. And not just on the cheek, but on the mouth. Like mommies and daddies do.
Oh, Sheldon.

character: Sheldon (not in Amy‰Ûªs daydream, now in the Cheesecake Factory)
line: Amy? Amy? Did you hear what I said?
Can‰Ûªt talk, in the zone.
A supermarket
I‰Ûªve never seen him this happy before.
That‰Ûªs because you‰Ûªve never seen him on restock the medicine cabinet day.
Look. A new topical antihistamine with lidocaine. Wow. I can‰Ûªt wait until I get a rash.
Oh, Gas-X has a new ultra strength. I guess they really do read their mail.
Hey, isn‰Ûªt that Professor Proton?
Oh, yeah.
Look at him, just standing in line like he wasn‰Ûªt moderately famous 30 years ago. Let‰Ûªs go say hello.
Oh, maybe we shouldn‰Ûªt bother him.
I‰Ûªm not going to bother him, I‰Ûªm going to talk to him.
He thinks there‰Ûªs a difference.
Arthur? Arthur, it‰Ûªs me, Sheldon Cooper. You may not remember because of your advanced age.
Trust me, I, I remember.
This is my girlfriend, Amy. Amy, this is television legend Arthur Jeffries. His science show inspired millions of children.
Hold, hold, hold on. You, you have a girlfriend?
Yes, and I‰Ûªve heard so much about you. Hey look, we‰Ûªre wearing the same orthopaedic shoes. I can‰Ûªt believe I dress like a celebrity.
Oh, okay, I get it now.
Dr. Jeffries, hello again. Leonard Hofstadter.
Oh, oh, right, I remember your, your girlfriend. Is, is she, is she here?
No, she‰Ûªs not.
So, what prescription are you getting filled?
Sheldon.
No. Wait, I want to guess. Don‰Ûªt tell me.
I wasn‰Ûªt going to tell you.
Sheldon, come on.
No, no, no. I‰Ûªm really good at this. All right, give me a hint. Does it involve difficulty initiating a stream of anything?
Well, given my age, that‰Ûªs more than just a lucky guess.
Hey, Sheldon, let‰Ûªs go mock the people buying homeopathic medicine, you love that.
But I‰Ûªm hanging out with my friend, and we‰Ûªre having fun. Look how happy he is.
Bernie‰Ûªs having a girls‰Ûª night on Friday at our place. You want to do something?
Actually, I‰Ûªm busy.
Doing what?
